loans.name: Aqil

texts.en: Aqil is 39 years old and has been married for many years. He has two children who are school-aged. Aqil sells shoes and mens clothes. He started this business in 2001, in order to be able to improve his income. He works every day selling shoes to his neighbors and other clients. Aqil wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1500 AZN for the purchase of shoes in order to expand his business. This is his second loan from AqroInvest and he hopes that this loan will help his business progress and increase his earnings. He wants to thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy new products for his store

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child.
 
Shirly has a shop that sells fish, like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell in her shop.

Shirly has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Shirly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua, a 40-year-old married father of four children, lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, where he has been selling goats in the market for the past 15 years. His challenge is inadequate capital to buy goats whose prices keep increasing, and his dream is to have a big farm of goats that people can purchase without going to the market. Joshua is requesting this loan to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and to do improvements to the locale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old and lives in the town of Busia in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past four years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his fresh produce shop, in which he sells mainly coffee and maize.

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to find a second source of income.

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale.

loans.name: Bokk Diom 28 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Bokk Diom  28 dont la présidente est la dame Adama, regroupe 5 membres  dont la principale des activités qu’elles exercent est la vente de fruits à hauteur d’un arrêt de bus. En dehors de cela, il y a l’embouche.
Adama, la présidente pratique les deux activités, mais elle est beaucoup plus connu pour la vente de fruits : orange, melon, mandarine et c’est à cela que va lui servir le prêt. Elle a une expérience de  dix ans.
Elle  n’a pas de charge et aimerai avec son bénéfice  améliorer son activité d’embouche.
texts.en:
The group Bokk Diom 28, the president of which is the lady Adama, is made up of five members. The principal commercial activity that they practice is fruit sales in the vicinity of a bus stop. Besides that, there is animal fattening.
Adama, the president, practices the two activities, but she is much more well known for fruit sales: orange, melon, mandarin, and this is what the loan will be used for. She has ten years of experience.
She is not providing for anyone, and would like to use her earnings to improve her animal fattening business.

loans.use:
aheter des fruits:mandarine,melon...et faire aussi de l 'embouche
to buy fruit: mandarin, melon, and also to practice animal fattening

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en: Amuor is a 30-year-old married woman with no children. She has run a food stall in Bor, South Sudan, for one year. Amuor is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, oil, and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase onions, oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel Abelardo

texts.es:
Gabriel Abelardo tiene 20 años es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Gabriel Abelardo se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 2 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Gabriel Abelardo is 20 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Gabriel Abelardo is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for two years. He learned this trade from his parents. His purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and he sells his products in the same city. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of his crops. This will also help increase his family’s income. His dream is to have a house and a plot of land.

Gabriel Abelardo enjoys playing sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is married and the father of two children. For the last five years, he has earned a living as a mechanic and earns a monthly income of Kes 25,000. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET ltd for Kes 35,000, which he will use to pay his children's school fees. His dream is to educate his children through the university level.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis, quiere seguir creciendo, por eso está decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para salir a vender especias, para atender otras zonas, comprara más productos en cominos, achiotes, canela, orégano, semillas, entre otras hierbas que son utilizadas en la cocina.
Él manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo de la inversión anterior, porque le permitió comprarse lo necesario en mercadería,  para salir a ofrecer a los clientes, viendo la manera de tener ingresos para su familia, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis wants to keep his business growing. That's why he is has decided on a new loan, so that he can go out and sell spices and serve other areas. He will buy more product, including cumin seeds, achiote, cinnamon, oregano, seeds, and other herbs used in the kitchen.

He states that he has had a positive effect from the previous investment. This is because it allowed him to buy the necessary merchandise, in order to go out and sell to his customers. He is looking at this as a way to have income for his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cumin seeds, achiote, cinnamon, oregano and seeds.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years-old.  She is a widow and has five children aged between 20 and 38 years.

She has been selling food for 17 years and she has a monthly income of fifty thousand Kenyan shillings.  The loan will be used to purchase stock skuma wiki, cabbages.The anticipated profits will be used to purchase land in order to construct her own house.

This is her loan from Kadet.  Her dreams and hopes are to start another business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
ISSA  est âgé de 52 ans et vit avec ses six enfants et ses époux à  DONGORONA dans la sous-préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
ISSA   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il  a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le quatrième prêt il est à son cinquième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONAN et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
ISSA  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  investir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use: Achat de céréales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Kibera

texts.en: I am a 27-year-old father of 2.  I take care of 2 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for my brother in  secondary school.

loans.use: I will use the loan to buy more high quality shoes

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo sells sportsware for men, women, and children.  Guillermo started his business selling clothing door-to-door.  Initially he only sold children's clothes, which he continues to sell together with men's and women's clothing.  He will use this loan to purchase backpacks and plastic products for resale. He is confident that the addition of these products will help his business grow and he will be able to make additional investments.  Guillermo has one son, is separated, 57 years old and originally from Oriundo de Ambata. He is sure that this loan will help to improve his family's quality of life and will help to grow his business.



 
 Guillermo  se dedica a la venta de ropa sport para damas caballeros y niños.
Guillermo   empezó  su negocio  vendiendo ropa puerta a puerta.  Al principio el solo vendía ropa para niños. Ahora ofrece este producto junto con ropa de caballeros   y damas.
El usara el préstamo para la  para comprar mochilas y artículos plásticos.
El tiene fe que con la introducción de estos productos nuevos  su negocio se incrementara   y  seguirá haciendo inversiones.
Guillermo  es  padre de  un hijos, separado  tiene 57 años Oriundo de Ambato.
El tiene la seguridad  que el préstamo le ayudara   a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y su negocio crecerá.

loans.use: Buy book bags and plastic products

loans.name: Khavasmoh

texts.en: R. Khavasmoh is 42 years old. She has a high education – her specialization is law. She is married and has 4 children. After she graduated, Khavasmoh was hired for a job at a pension fund. During her professional career she   was promoted several times. But nowadays salary in regular employment is very low and Khavasmoh decided to start her own business. At the end of 2006 her colleague who had a sale-point in a market offered to go with her to a town for goods. Together they bought cheap kids' clothes.  After trading she had a good income which was higher than her salary, and she decided to leave her job and start trading. Thereafter she rented a sale-point in a “Tijorat” market. It has been 7 months since she started trading. With the loan amount, she is going to buy cheap kids' clothes. This loan helps her to increase the range of goods. Considering the fact that Yavan district habitants are poor, they now have the opportunity to buy cheap kids' clothes.

loans.use: To increase the range of kids' clothes

loans.name: Nanga Frida

texts.en: Nanga Frida is married and a mother of eight children. She has always been a hard working  woman with little or no fruits of her labour. This is because she could not lay her hands on a profitable business and even when she did, could not make profit because she lacked capital to invest. Because of this, her children were always suffered from not having school fees and hunger. With these challenges, she sought help from GHAPE in 1998. Since then she has been able to obtain loans with which she sold motor spare parts and raised enough money to pay an apprentice and school fees for her children. Given a loan of $1200, she plans to buy and  sell spare motor parts in the capital city of the country where more people own cars. Her son has built a house for the business so that a building will not have to be rented and she will use his experience to help manage it. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of motor spare parts and construct a building for her business location

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en:
Viviane A. is 29 years old and a single mother. She lives in Kouassi with her 11 year old daughter who is starting secondary school this month (October 2007). Viviane has been selling various dry aromatic products in the Koumassi market since she left school eight years ago. After she got her baby she was not able to continue her studies because she did not have resources to care for her baby and pay school expenses.
Viviane got her first loan from AE&I in January 2006 and has performed very well since then. She wants to use part of the loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: Viviane Ano will use the loan to purchase goods and school expenses

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is 45 years old and is the mother of a child aged 15. Previously she had a small shop where she sold snacks etc. but she had to close it due to lack of capital. After joining MBK, she started a new business together with her husband, S., selling meatballs. She is requesting a loan that she can use for this new business as capital and make it sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To use as capital for their meatball business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another tricycle for delivering his product

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Pineapples, oranges, mandarins, bananas, etc., are the products that Norma M. has sold with much effort over the past three years in the market in León. Prior to dedicating herself to this activity she was a housewife but, seeing how difficult it was to cover daily living expenses, she decided to invest a small amount of capital to purchase fruits to offer for sale.

We can’t ignore the fact that it is very beneficial to invest in the infrastructure of her business, which currently lacks a roof and walls. Instead, she uses a few pieces of lumber to support plastic to provide some shade as well as protection from rain.

Wisely, Mrs. M. has fulfilled loans with Ceprodel in order to supply her business with more products. Her biggest wish is to build her own stand so she can provide better service to her customers. Currently, she has a record of 18 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Piñas, naranjas , mandarinas, bananos, etc. son los productos que muy esforzadamente vende la señora Norma M. en el mercado la Terminal de León desde hace 3 años. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad su labor era desempeñarse como ama de casa, pero al contemplar que difícilmente cubría los gastos de su hogar decide invertir su poco capital en la compra de frutas para luego comercializarlas.

No podemos pasar por alto que le es de mucha utilidad invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio ya que actualmente no posee techo ni paredes, sino que utiliza algunos trozos de madera que sostienen plásticos para cubrirla del sol y de igual manera de la lluvia.

Muy sabiamente, la señora M. ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio con mayores volúmenes de productos, su mayor anhelo es construir su propio tramo para brindar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. Actualmente su record es de 18 creditos.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, and investment in business infrastructure.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn T. is 34 years old and works as a fish vendor in a market in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  On average, she makes about $4.30 a day. Her husband supplements her household's income by working as a logger in the village.  He normally earns around $1.80 each day.  Together they have three children and all of them are students.  Houn and her husband plan to breed pigs to earn more money, and  have applied for a loan of $300.

loans.use: They plans to breed pigs to add more revenue.

loans.name: Safina's Jitihada Group

texts.en:
Safina is 20 years old and is married with 1 child, age 8. Safina is a cloth seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth sales and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Areli

texts.es:
Miss C. works as a nurse in the Rama health center, she is 34 years old and has 9 years of service. She has 3 children (ages 13, 15 and 18) who are students, she is with Jemer Antonio Lopez who works at MINSA. Together they have been able to help their children and to slowly build a house.

Miss C. is known for being a great person, with good feelings, respectful, honest and very responsible. She wishes to study to be a professional. She asks for a loan to build a room to her older daughter and to improve the conditions of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra C. es Trabajadora del centro de salud del Rama como enfermera con 34 años de edad y 9 de servic tiene 3 hijos( 13,15, 18) los tres estudian , acompañada del Sr Jemer antonio Lopez que tambien trabaja en el MINSA. han logrado juntos ir sacando adelante asus hijos y construyendo poco a poco su vivienda.

La sra C. es conocida en el sector salud como una persona de buenos sentimeintos, respetuosa y honrada y con una gran responsabilidad, desea continuar estudiando para profesionalizarse . solicia el credito para construir un cuarto a su hija mayor y mejorar las condiciones en el hogar

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Mr. Benito T. is 43 years and has been separated for approximately two years, and he has two adolescent children who are still studying and live with him.

He lives in a neighborhood a few kilometers from the center of the city of Encarnación. He owns his own house that he bought several years ago; since he was young he has worked and saved to be able to buy his house and start his own business.

Benito is the proprietary of a well-stocked grocery store that he has run for more than nine years from his house and that is run by himself or sometimes by his two children in their free moments when they are not going to school or studying.

Benito is a very sacrificing person, since the time he separated he has been the only one supporting his family. Now Benito is requesting a new loan because he wants to purchase a motorcycle that would help him move around because he lives in a neighborhood removed from the city and every day he goes to the city market to make purchases so he needs greater mobility to help facilitate his work.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C.Smith, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Benito T. de 43 años es separado hace dos años aproximadamente el posee dos hijos varones adolescentes que están estudiando todavía y que viven con él.

El cliente vive en un barrio retirado a unos pocos kilómetros del centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación. Tiene casa propia que compró hace varios años ya que desde muy joven ha salido a trabajar y ahorro durante este tiempo para poder comprar su casa y montar su negocio propio.

Benito es propietario de una Despensa bien surtida que funciona hace mas de 9 años en su propio domicilio particular y que es atendido por él mismo, a veces por su dos hijos en sus momentos libre ya que ambos van al colegio y estudian.

Benito es una persona muy sacrificada, ya que luego de haberse separado tuvo que sacar solo adelante a su familia. Benito hoy está solicitando un nuevo crédito pues desea compra una motocicleta que lo ayudará a agilizar su movilización ya que vive en un barrio retirado de la ciudad y todos los días va al mercado de la ciudad a hacer algunas compras por lo que necesita una movilidad que lo ayude a facilitar su tarea.

loans.use: Purchase of a Motorcycle

loans.name: Comite Tembiapora Group

texts.en:
This group is currently in its sixth loan cycle. It has 17 members, 2 of whom are new. The members are engaged in various activities including the selling of food, drinks, a small store, a hairdresser, as well as the selling of clothes, among other things.

The group has good relationships and respect among its members. It is also worth noting the on-time payments and assistance to group members at their meetings. In summary, it is a very progressive committee.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 40 years old, married and has three children between ages 15 and 19. She went into business selling charcoal and chapati, a kind of flatbread. in 2000. Every day, she works from 7 a.m. to Noon at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Zainabu has applied for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shean

texts.en:
Mrs. Shean U., 46 years old and widowed, sells groceries. She has been selling groceries along Tonle Sap Lake since 2000 and earns around US$3.33 per day. Her business depends on Tonle Sap Lake. She has two children, one of whom is married. Ms. Chenglean Phon, her eldest daughter, is 23 years old and raises pigs, earning about US$2.50 per day. Together they live in Anlong Somor Commune, Siem Reap Province.

Mrs. Shean is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase groceries and pig food. The loan will generate more profit and help to better sustain her family. Her daughter, Ms. Chenglean, is pictured.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and pig food

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en:
Amrah A. is 34 years old.

Amrah is a cattleman, and has been in this business since 2002. Before that time, he used to help his father in his field. Because he had been trained by his father, after he served in the army, he purchased cattle to raise. Currently, he has one cow with calf. The business is quite stable and generates the primary income for the family.

Now, Amrah is planning to purchase three calves and fodder. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1000 USD. This is the first loan for Amrah and he promises not to let down those who have trusted and supported him.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurn C. P. is a villager in Taing Chrey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is farmer who owns six hectares where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Chham Sophal, is a fisherman who makes a small income to support the household. Mrs. Soeurn C. P. is 26 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the other is too young for school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn H. is a 56-year-old villager in Ream Ankdeouk Village in Takeo Province; she is married to Keo Phorn, and together they own and operate a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Because their field is far from irrigation sources, Mrs. Sorn H. is seeking a loan to buy a water pump to make her fields more arable. Mrs. Sorn H. has three children, one of wH. is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her fields

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Don Gonzalo  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar y hecarle el piso a la vivienda), trabaja como Auxiliar de Emfermeria desde hace 18 años, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 5 añitos y la niña 2 añitos, su esposa trabaja  como docente, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar, ellos son una familia humilde que a pesar que los dos trabajan devengan salarios bajos, es por esta razón que solicitan este crédito para ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda;es un hijo muy responsable de sus padres, siempre esta al pendiente de lo que ellos necesitan, vive en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea. Don Gonzalo es un profesional  con alto espiritud de superación personal y laboral,  responsable,  que ama su trabajo y se siente orgulloso de ayudar a los enfermos que asisten al Hospital a pasar consultas, su sueño es estudiar el proximo año,  tener estabilidad, salud  y una vivienda  con mejores condiciones para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is requesting his sixth loan to invest in improving his home (replaster his walls and put in a new floor). He has worked as a nursing assistant for the past 18 years and has two children, ages 5 and 2. His wife is a teacher, and together they share household expenses. They are a humble family, and even though they both work their wages are low, which is why they are requesting this loan so they can keep on improving their home little by little. Gonzalo is a very responsible son to his parents; he's always providing them with what they need. He lives in an urban son in Nueva Guinea. Gonzalo has strong desire to better himself personally and professionally. He is responsible man who loves his job and feels proud to help the sick people he cares for in consultations at the hospital. His dream is to go to school next year and have stability, health and a home with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replaster the walls and put a new floor in his home

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Assanatou D.  a 30 ans, mère d’un (1) enfant, elle réside avec son époux et leur enfant à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assanatou D. est une enseignante de profession, en parallèle avec sa profession elle dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où elle mène cette activité d’achat et de vente  d’articles divers (Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Cheew Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, etc) il y a maintenant dix (10) ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association de femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC), tous correctement remboursés.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 5 cartouches de  différentes sortes de Cigarettes,  1 carton du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de Cheew Gum, 20 paquets d’allumette, etc.  Madame  Assanatou D. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée des voisins.
Elle achète ses marchandises auprès des commerçants grossistes de la place avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assanatou D. is 30 years old and the mother of one child. She lives with her husband and their child in Wayerma II, a popular neighborhood in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Assanatou D. is a trained teacher who also runs a small shop outside her home, where she's been reselling various articles (cigarettes, candies, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, etc) for ten years. She's much in demand thanks to the quality of her products. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with other women of her neighborhood, she's now seeking her fifth individual commercial loan (PIC loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems. With this new loan, she intends to buy 5 cartons of diverse brands of cigarettes, 1 box of tea, 1 sack of sugar, 10 packs of candies, 10 packs of chewing gums, 20 packs of cigarettes, etc. Mrs. Assanatou D. sells her products for cash or on credit to a clientele of neighbors. She purchases the goods she retails from wholesalers in Sikasso. With this loan, she anticipates turning a monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca. US$ 160), to be mainly used to help with the family expenses and to repay the loan. The remainder will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various items (cigarettes, chewing gum, sugar, etc)

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is 37 years old and she has lived in the village of Cabisera 14-16 (Ilagan) since she was born. Her husband and two children happily live there.  Her husband, Orlando, is a corn and rice farmer in their village. Her children are Jessa, 10, who is currently in grade five; and Jhondel, 13, now in the first year of high school. Leonora hopes to support the education of her two children through the assistance of her husband and support coming from her snack-vending business. 

She cooks banana cue and soups for her neighbors. The snacks are sold easily in an hour even when she does not go house to house. She would like to expand this into selling soft drinks and cooking the famous “pansit” (soft noodles in the local language). Thus, Leonora wanted a business loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 as additional capital for her vending business. “I must strive harder in battling with life’s difficulties,” Leonora added.

loans.use: For additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Amys Lucila

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua Amys Lucila M. es una dama muy trabajadora como toda mujer nicaragüense el cual ha dedicado sus esfuerzos a su negocio de venta de tomates en su propia localidad donde se desempeña.

Hoy en día la razón por la cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los tomates. Es de importancia destacar que ella requiere de dicho crédito por lo que se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio que tanto le ha costado mantener.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Managua, Amys Lucila M. is a very hard-working woman (like all Nicaraguan women) who has dedicated her efforts to the sale of tomatoes. She runs her tomato business in the market. She decided to seek the support of Ceprodel in order to receive a loan to purchase tomatoes. It is important to emphasize that she seeks this loan to allow her to benefit greatly and be able to move forward with her business, which she has invested so much into.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Brudit Jeanina

texts.es:
Brudit es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Brudit es soltera, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Brudit vende condimentos como canela, clavo de olor, comino, que ofrece a las tiendas. Además Brudit trabaja provenido alimentos en diferentes proyectos.
Brudit necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, pimienta y clavo de olor.
Los sueños de Brudith son que sus hijos sean profesionales y compra un terreno para la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Brudit is a member of the communal bank of Paloma. Brudit is single and she is 35 years old. She has 2 children. Brudit sells seasonings such as cinnamon, cloves and cumin which she sells to stores. As a matter of fact Brudit is in charge of providing food for different projects. Brudit needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles), which she will invest in buying cinnamon, cloves and pepper. Brudith’s dream is for her children to become professionals and buy property to build a home on.

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cinnamon, cloves and pepper to sell

loans.name: Leleo

texts.en: Leleo F., 47, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.  SPBD loans are Leleo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase more tools & equipment, weed killer, and chemicals

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розие 44 года, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России., а Розия занимается предпринимательством и продает ткани. Ассортимент тканей включает в себя все ценовые категории: от дешевых до дорогих. За товаром ездит на оптовый китайский рынок раз в неделю. А постоянное место для торговли арендует в центральном универмаге города. Розия собирается закупить оптом ситец и велюровую ткань и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Roziya is 44 years old, she is married and has 2 children. Her husband is working in Russia and Roziya is an entrepreneur and sells fabrics. Her fabric assortment includes all price categories from cheap to expensive. She travels for her products to a wholesale Chinese market once a week. Roziya rents a permanent sales location at the central department store in the city. Roziya plans to purchase chintz and velour fabrics and this is why she has put her application on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chintz and velour fabrics

loans.name: Trojes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Trojes” se encuentra representado por el señor Víctor y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se dedican a actividades comerciales como ser la venta de helados, comida, F., verduras frescas y artesanías, pero una mayoría de los miembros del grupo se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros debido a al gran demanda que existe dentro de la ciudad y sus alrededores. El destino del financiamiento es para la mejora de sus herramientas de trabajo ya que los alrededores de la ciudad no cuenta con buenos caminos y es necesario contar con un buen vehiculo para conseguir pasajeros, las socias dedicadas al comercio necesitan el financiamiento para estocar mejor sus puestos de venta y para la compra de insumos para sus productos terminados. En lo que respecta a  experiencia  los miembros del grupo trabajaron con anterioridad en grupos solidarios por lo que saben que se necesita responsabilidad, unión y cumplimiento en los pagos para contar con la confianza de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The Trojes group is represented by Victor and made up of 13 members who are engaged in commercial activities such as selling ice cream, flowers, fresh vegetables and handicrafts, although the majority of the members work in public transportation, due to the great demand for this service in the city and the surrounding areas. The purpose of this loan is to improve their equipment, because the areas around the city do not have good roads, and it's necessary to have a reliable vehicle in order to secure passengers. The members in sales need financing to stock their businesses and to purchase materials for their finished products. Regarding experience, the group members have worked in other solidarity groups, and therefore know that they must be responsible and work together, and make their payments in order to earn the trust of our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric A. is thirty-nine years old, married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. All are currently in the primary school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busy business centres in the region. His wife trades in vegetables.

Eric trades in roofing sheets and sells in a shop by the roadside. He buys packets of roofing sheets from big shops in nearby towns such as Kumasi.

Eric has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure roofing sheets in large quantity. He is hopeful to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy roofing sheets in large quantity

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es: La señora Francisca Antonia M. , tiene la edad 63 años , habita en el barrio las conchitas , ubicado en el departamento de Masaya , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ella tiene tres hijos , ya todos casados , agricultores , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder comprar un terreno , para heredar a sus tres hijos , desde hace 20 años doña Francisca se dedica a la agricultura inicio el trabajo agrícola , con sus propios esfuerzos .Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha para vender a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracia Afodenic por los beneficio de mejora para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Antonia M. is 63 years old, and lives in the neighborhood of the shells, located in the Masaya department. She lives with her husband, who she helps with household expenses. She has three children that are already married and are farmers. She plans to improve their living conditions and to buy land to pass on to her three kids. Twenty years ago Mrs. Francisco began working as a farmer and has since been dedicated to agriculture, all through her own efforts. With the funding obtained she will buy fertilizers and inputs to apply to her crops, and to be able to have a better harvest to sell for a better price in the market. She thanks Afodenic for the profits made from crop improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inputs and fertilizers to apply to crops.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene venD. chicharrón seco y también tiene un puesto D. dulces, su esposo es empleado D. una chicharroneria. 
Vive en la Zona D. Bajo Irpavi D. la Ciudad D. La Paz en casa Alquilada
Requiere el crédito para capital D. trabajo (compra D. dulces y chicharrón seco)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la sexta vez que requiere el apoyo D. kiva las ganas D. superarse le dan la oportunidad D. poder acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Irene sells dried pork rinds and also has a sweets stand. Her husband is an employee of a pork rind manufacturer.

She rents a house in the in Bajo Irpavi zone of La Paz.

She requests a working capital loan for the purchase of sweets and dried pork rinds.

This is the seventh time that she has requested a loan from field partner IMPRO and the sixth time she has requested the support of Kiva, who have given her the opportunity to improve her life and gain access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food and sweets to sell

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Evelia del Socorro J. B. tiene 46 años de edad. Es cliente de Fundación León 2000. Es madre soltera pues ella tiene la función de ser madre y padre de sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Y ambos dependen de ella. El espíritu con que ha salido adelante con sus propios medios es importante.su actividad economica es la venta de cosmeticos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y con la ayuda de una prima obtuvo la mercadería, para su negocio. En la actualidad ella continúa con esta actividad ubicada en su vivienda y algunas veces que ofrece sus productos a otros lugares. Con este préstamo lograra realizar un pedido de cremas, perfumes, talcos, cremas faciales y pintura de labios. Por lo que ahora sueña con establecer su propio negocio en el mercado donde obtendría más clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evelia del Socorro J. B. is 46 years old. She is a client of Fundación León 2000 and a single mother who has the job of both mother and father for taking care of her two dependent children. Mrs Evelia has been able to get ahead on her own and for eight years has made a living selling cosmetics. She was able to obtain her merchandise with help from a cousin. She sill sells cosmetics -- mostly from her home but sometimes in other places. With this loan she will be able to fill orders for creams, perfumes, talcs, face lotions, and lipstick. She hopes to establish a shop in the market where she could get more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen C. F. tiene 52 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este negocio lo inicio por su hija porque ella le ayudo a conseguir los productos en precio mucho más accesible al inicio fue un poco difícil pero con la experiencia que logro adquirir salió adelante. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrento como fue el comunicarse con sus clientes, ya que en su mayoría eran jóvenes, y esto se le dificultaba, pero con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo lo adecuado. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Tomasa del Carmen C. F. is 52 years of age. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise. She has engaged in this business for more than 17 years. With a lot of effort she has succeeded in keeping it going.

This business began through her daughter, who helped her get products at a good price. At first, it was a little difficult, but with the experience she succeeded in acquiring she got ahead. She confronted challenges as she communicated with customers since most of these were young people, and this was difficult for her, but with the passage of time she learned to adapt. Her biggest dream is to improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Gusti Ayu Suci - (-) is a 31-year-old woman living in the town of Tegal Cangkring - Mendoyo.  Gusti Ayu Suci is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by DINARI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Daya Pertiwi (DNR.M-0589).  

Gusti Ayu Suci is married and has 2 infant children.  To make a living, Gusti Ayu Suci owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Gusti Ayu Suci has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 250.000 IDR a month from these activities.  

In 2008, Gusti Ayu Suci joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Gusti Ayu Suci is now requesting a loan of 1.200.000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.  This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Gusti Ayu Suci plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

 About DINARI: 

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. 

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu I. es una persona trabajadora y entusiasta, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y 1 hijo menor. Ella se dedica a preparar tortas y bocaditos para eventos especiales, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él  se dedica a manejar su motocarro . Marilu es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Águilas”, desde hace tres años, en donde ha demostrado ser una socia puntual en todo momento. El primer préstamo que recibió  fue de 300 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió para comprar materiales de decoración para tortas. 
Con este préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará otro motokar, ya que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marilu I. is a hard-working and enthusiastic person. She is 44, the mother of 3, 2 of whom are adults and 1 is a minor. She works making sandwiches and appetizers for special events with the help of her husband. He drives her motokar. Marilu has been a member of the community bank “Las Aguilas for the last 3 years. She has shown herself to always be a punctual member. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of cake decorating supplies. With this 1200 loan of new soles, she will buy another motokar since that will allow her to increase her business .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new motokar

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
SANTOSA PAULINA J. A., (la ubicaremos entada en la fotografía), tiene 35 años de edad, es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora al igual que sus 8 compañeros que integran el grupo “Sembrando Esperanza” quienes residen en el distrito de Carabayllo.

La Sra. Paulina, hace 13 años, se dedica la venta de  chocho, que es una comida típica de la Sierra del Perú, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a las calles con sus baldes de comida y se dirige a los mercados y lugares con  afluencia de público para ofrecer el “ceviche de chocho”

Con su trabajo, cubre todos los gastos de su casa, puede mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos, les da lo necesario pues no puede ofrecerles mucho ya que por mas que trabaja no es mucho lo que gana, lo poco que puede ganar en sus ventas lo ahorró y pudo adquirir un pequeño terreno, donde ha podido levantar una casita de madera, como ella llama su chocita.

Le gustaría mucho, ganar lo necesario para  poder arreglar su casa, darles más comodidades a sus hijos, ahora pasan muchas necesidades por la época del frío ellos no tienen una vestimenta apropiada.

El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en comprar insumos  para la elaboración del “ceviche de chocho” y para la venta de chicha de jora.
texts.en:
Santarosa Paulina J. A., (sitting in this photograph), is 35 years old. She is a very humble and hard-working person, just like her 8 fellow team mates who make up the group "Sembrando Esperanza" ("Sowing Hope") and live in the Carabayllo district. For the past 13 years, Mrs. Paulina has worked selling chocho a food typical of the mountain region of Peru. Every day, since very early, she goes out on the streets with her buckets of food and heads for the markets and places with high influx of people to offer them "ceviche de chocho". With her work she covers all her household expenses, supporting her two small children. She gives them what they need since she cannot offer them much more. In spite of her hard work, she does not make much money and the little she makes she has saved to acquire a small plot of land, where she has made a small wooden house, as she calls her "chocita". She would like very much to make the money necessary to fix her house, and to make her children more comfortable because they are in need because of the cold season and their lack of appropriate clothing. The loan requested will be invested in buying ingredients to make the "ceviche de chocho" and to sell chicha de jora (a maize-based drink).

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in ingredients and merchandise

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: La señora Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.Otilia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que tuvo que esforzarse bastante en su camino D. vida, pero las ganas D. salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados, hoy en día venD. sus productos D. catálogos D. las diferentes líneas como: Unique, Esika, Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará productos D. belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes D. uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Otilia, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir D. muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Otilia belongs to the Communal Bank “La Primavera” [“The Spring”], located in the District of Moyobamba, Province of San Martin, Department of San Martin. She is married, 59 years old, and is a mother to 3 children, all of which live independently. Otilia is a hardworking mother and has struggled greatly in her life, however, her drive to get head has given her good results. Currently, she sells different brands of products from a catalog, such as Unique, Esika, and Avon, and feels very happy about what she has accomplished.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will purchase beauty products to have in stock, such as: perfumes and colognes for men and women, creams, powders, lipsticks, and nail polishes; she will also purchase a display case to show her products. Because of Otilia’s maturity she is an example to follow for many of the women who have started businesses and hope that with perseverance they will reach their dreams. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for having helped her start up her own business, and for helping other women grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Apal's Group

texts.en:
Apal is the leader of this group. Having reached the age of 58, Apal can surely consider herself a happy woman as she has raised five children. All of them, except one son, already have their own families and live separately. Her eldest son is 40 and the youngest daughter is 24.

Nevertheless, Apal and her husband have preferred a shed and a busy daily routine of looking after cattle rather than a comfortable living room where they could sing a lullaby to their grandchildren. Always used to hard work and the smell of cattle, Apal and her husband are still working. They keep their own household. They are occupied with livestock raising and milk sales. These have been the main source of their sustenance for forty years.

Raising cattle has allowed them to successfully bring up the children not depending on government allowances or benefits. Selling milk alone provides them with a monthly income of $40. Whenever meat is needed, they always have cattle available for their needs.

Apal has applied for this loan and hopes that by means of this loan, she will be able to buy a milk cow and sell more milk. Her immediate plans are to conduct some repair work at home and see her son married. Apal has three partners: Jenishai, Tolkunai and Burulkan. Jenishai, 34, has three children. To provide for the family, her husband works as a carpenter. Jenisha, in her turn, trades in clothing. Jenishai learned to sell clothes from her sister. Now she has become an independent entrepreneur. Jenishai needs a loan to purchase goods. Tolkunai, 34, has three children. Tolkunai manufactures traditional items at her house and sells them in the capital. Her husband is a welder. Making national articles brings her $120. Tolkunai wants to sell more articles, so she has applied for the loan to purchase more fabric and threads. Burulkan, 49, has two daughters. Both of her daughters have married and live separately. Burulkan’s husband is engaged in trading in cattle, mainly sheep. Burulkan sells women's gowns. Burulkan hopes to obtain this loan to purchase goods. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and sell more milk.

loans.name: Daysi Esther

texts.es:
la sra. Daysi Esther F. tiene 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de adornos para casas como ser personajes tallados en madera, alcancillas, casitas de barro, barcos, ollas de barro etc.
tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, las ventas son buenas ya que esta ubicada en el mercado nacional de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, este mercado es transitado por muchas personas las cuales le compran sus adornos, las personas le compran su producto porque vende barato y el acabado de los adornos es muy bueno.
ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar adornos navideños, como ya casi estamos en navidad las personas compran muchos adornos para sus casas. las ventas mejoran en esta epoca.
texts.en:
Daysi Esther F., 56, sells home decorations like wooden carvings of people, piggy banks, earthenware houses, boats, and earthenware pots, etc. She has been doing this type of work for many years. Sales are very good because she in located in the National Market in the city of San Lorenzo. This market is well traveled by many people who buy her decorations. People buy her products because she sells them cheaply, and the finishings on the decorations are very good. She is asking for the loan to buy Christmas decorations. We are almost at Christmas time, and people buy lots of decorations for their houses. Sales improve in this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Christmas decorations

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee is requesting its third loan. This group is made up of very hard working women, many of whom are single mothers. 

In this group, the loans are used for the individual businesses of the members which include: the recycling of paper; selling coal and plastics; buying ingredients for baked goods and pastries, such as the Paraguayan national “empanada”; fruits and vegetables to sell in their stores; the sale of cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos and deodorants; the sale of candy; the sale of fabric for tailoring clothing, bedsheets and towels, skirts and shorts; the sale of herbs and remedies; and the sale of sausages and sweetmeats. 

One of the women in this committee, Juliana P., is 48 years old and has a remarkably inspiring story of her entrepreneurial success. She has three children, and is a single mother. She buys charcoal, and every morning loads it up on her cart to deliver around her area. She comes back home at lunch and then sets out in the afternoon to pick up recycling and sort it to sell. She is very patient and works hard to make a living to support her children.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Pouv

texts.en: Mr. Pouv P., 30, works as a professional journalist in the private company located in the middle of Siem Reap province. Pouv P. is married but has no children. His wife, Sok Phary, 27, sells a few groceries in her own store in front of her home. This couple currently lives with their parents, who are used-goods sellers. Because this family’s house is located along the lake in a good location for fishing, Pouv P. needs a loan of $800 to buy nets and traps to begin fishing. With the rest of the loan he will buy more grocery inventory for his wife to sell. The loan will provide him with additional income to ensure that his family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps, and grocery inventory

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly A. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Merly owns and operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for almost two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Merly is now requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Leodegario

texts.en:
Leodegario C. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 56 years old. Leodegario is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Leodegario owns and operates a business of providing jeepney services to local community members (a jeepney is a small bus). Leodegario has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $140 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Leodegario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Leodegario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his service. 

Leodegario is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. This will be his 2nd loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.es:
Pelagia es socia del Banco Comunal Granito de Mostaza.
Pelagia es casada, tiene 41 años y 5 hijos, Pelagia viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales que comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, en algunas oportunidades vende panes típicos.
Pelagia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Pelagia sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Pelagia, 41, is a member of the Granito de Mostaza (Little Mustard Seed) communal bank. Pelagia is married and has 5 children. She travels to the various markets to buy cereals that she sells in the city of Ayacucho; sometimes she also sells typical bread. Pelagia needs a 1000 sol loan to buy cereals. Pelagia dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Genalyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Genalyn owns & operates a business selling both food & daily use products like personal products such as shampoo and more in the local community. Genalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Genalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Genalyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Genalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem has owned a car repair shop in his village for the past 8 years. He's 30 years old, single and lives with his mother, and he's the only provider for her. He's specialized in repairing the bodies of cars and he's very talented at his job. He's well-known in the whole region. 

Today, Kassem is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more tools and spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen G. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2007, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chheng Hong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
These fourteen people are villagers in Doung village in Takeo province and all make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Chheng H. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members.  They will each use their loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chheng H. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family and on the side she is a weaver in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so Mrs. Chheng H. decided to seek a loan to buy more silk for weaving. She is a widow with a child who is enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Vecindad De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
Nelly M. integrante de la Asociación Comunal Vecindad de Alto Lima que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Alto Lima, tiene 44 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, indica que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de su hermana y porque realmente necesita el dinero. 
Ella vende comida hace dos años, este negocio fue transferido por su hermana, con el crédito tiene planificado comprar víveres al por mayor como la papa, el fideo y arroz, adquiere su insumos de la ciudad de La Paz, zona El Tejar, como el negocio tiene mucho movimiento cuenta con la ayuda de sus sobrinas.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: atención de tienda, cerrajería,  servicio de amplificación, venta de ropa, joyería, venta de repuestos de máquina.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Nelly M. is a member of the Communal Association “Vecindad de Alto Lima” (Neighborhood of Alto Lima), which is part of the Alto Lima Community Center. She is 44 years old and a resident of the city of El Alto. Nelly says she joined Pro Mujer because her sister invited her and she needed the money. She has been selling food for two years and took over the business from her sister. Her loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk such as potatoes, noodles, and rice. She obtains her supplies in the city of La Paz, El Tejar District. Her business generates a lot of traffic, so she has the help of her nieces.

The other members of the Association engage in business activities such as managing grocery stores, providing locksmith services, renting out sound equipment, selling clothing, selling jewelry, and selling machine parts. They all need a loan to acquire merchandise supplies, and raw materials according to their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries for preparing meals

loans.name: Sendrida

texts.en: M. Sendrida is a hard-working businesswoman and resident of Kakoba Central Cell, Kakoba Division, Mbarara Municipality. She is married and blessed with three children. She runs a retail shop and has been in her business for over five years. She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as salt, soap, flour, rice, sugar, etc. Her future hope is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as salt, soap, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jazmines De Los Lagos Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Jazmines de Los Lagos” y es la 2º vez que se publica en el sitio de Kiva. Estos socios pertenecen a la ciudad de Temuco y se dedican principalmente a negocios de carpintería, arreglo de bicicletas, costuras y venta de almuerzos, ropa usada, papas fritas y cigarrillos.

La socia entrevistada fue Liliana, quien es la secretaria del grupo. En la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, al centro, a la derecha del hombre con chaqueta azul y tiene el pelo corto. Ella se dedica a la venta, puerta a puerta, de ropa interior y de vestir para niños y adultos,. También se dedica  a la repostería, pero solo por encargos, como por ejemplo tortas, kuchenes, etc.

Cuando viaja a comprar su mercadería a Santiago, aprovecha de llevar para vender queso, harina tostada y merquén, para de esta manera aprovechar sus contactos y aumentar sus ingresos.

Liliana invertirá este préstamo en quesos y en la ropa de moda esta temporada.

Su meta es arrendar una tienda, en donde pueda vender ropa de niño y adulto, y su gran sueño es ser enfermera, lo que estudiaría sin dudar si tuviera la oportunidad.

Lo que más le gusta a Liliana de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es la unidad del grupo y la relación con la Asesora, lo que la hace sentir importante y valorada.

Liliana tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 4 viven con ellos, por lo que se siente muy bien, apoyada y acompañada.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Jazmines de Los Lagos”, and this is the second time they have had a loan published on Kiva. This communal bank comes from the city of Temuco, and the members dedicated themselves primarily to the businesses of carpentry, bicycle repairs, sewing, preparing lunches, selling used clothes, selling French fries, and selling cigarettes. The group member we interviewed was Liliana, who is the bank’s secretary. You see her in the picture in the center of the second row with short hair, to the right of the man with the blue jacket. Liliana dedicates herself to door-to-door sales of undergarments and clothing for children and adults. She also makes desserts by special order, things like cakes and pastries. When Liliana travels to Santiago to purchase merchandise she makes the most of her trip by bringing items from Temuco to sell in Santiago. She brings cheese, wheat products, and spicy peppers, thereby taking advantage of the contacts she has in Santiago and increasing her earnings. Liliana will invest this loan in cheese and in clothes that are in fashion for this season (fall/winter). Her goal is to rent store space to establish her clothing-sales business, and her big dream is to be a nurse – she would, without a doubt, study to be a nurse if she had the chance. The part Liliana likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the group unity and their relationship with their loan officer, a relationship which makes them feel important and valued. Liliana also feels very much supported and accompanied by her seven children, four of whom still live with her. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing and cheeses

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es:
Doña Aditza es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, es una mujer de pocos recursos económicos, pero si con muchos deseos de trabajar desde hace varios años logro su negocio de venta de ropa como: camiseta, camisola, ropa interior de mujer y hombre, el cual vende ambulante.
Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, y aunque su salario es bajo es un trabajo fijo. Su casa es pequeña aun de tablas ya muy viejas, su piso de suelo, pero no ha hecho las mejoras por falta de dinero ya que lo que presta invierte más en su negocio para poder ganar dinero y ayudar a su familia.
Lo que espera en un futuro poder reparar su casa.
Con este financiamiento comprara: bóxer, biquinis, tobilleras, camiseta para varón entre otros para seguir vendiendo
texts.en:
Aditza is a very hard-working woman; she has two children. She is very low-income but very eager to work. Several years ago she set up a clothing sales business; she sells t-shirts, nightgowns, women’s and men’s underwear door-to-door. Her husband is a security guard and even though his salary is low the work is permanent. Her house is small and still made of very old boards; her floor is dirt. She hasn’t made any home improvements because she has lacked funds to do so because what she borrows she prefers to invest in her business in order to earn income to help her family. She hopes in the future to be able to make home improvements. She will use this funding to buy: boxer shorts, bikinis, ankle socks, men’s undershirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Deborah A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to sell.  Deborah is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a police man. She has two children who both attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda tiene 50 años de edad, ella vive en su casa propia con dos de sus hijos pues es viuda y sus otros hijos son mayores y están ya independizados. Hace más de 5 años se dedica en la venta de comida, ofreciéndolo en el exterior de su casa. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y trabajo pudo instalar cabinas para ofrecer el oficio de Internet, negocio el cual su hija se hace cargo. El platillo que prepara Lucinda, son anticuchos, panchos, entre otros, alimentos que son cocinados a la parrilla y que son del gusto de la mayoría de la gente. Desde entonces trabaja durante las tardes hasta las altas horas de la noche, horario el cual los clientes más consumen éstos alimentos, además tiene la elección de utilizar el servicio de Internet. De esta manera ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete en ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is 50 years old, and lives in her own home with two of her children (she's a widow). Her older children are grown. For the last five years, Lucinda sells food right outside of her home. With great effort and hard work, she was able to build Internet cabins, a business her daughter manages. At her food stall, Lucinda makes snacks, and cooks hotdogs and other food items on the grill. She starts work in the afternoon, and does not stop until late at night because this is the best time for selling food. Because her clients also enjoy the convenience of having Internet access close by, Lucinda's business is booming. This is Lucinda's first loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to make all her payments on time. With the loan, she will buy ingredients with which to prepare food.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients

loans.name: Katerine Yuliana

texts.es: Katerine  tiene 21 años de edad, ella vive en la casa de su cuñada. En el distrito de la Tinguiña casa de material noble de un piso. Katerine se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, se inicio ayudando. Ella es una persona muy joven con muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio propio. Con el dinero que solicita realizara algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Katerine is 21 years old and lives in her sister-in-law's home. It is a one-story house made of solid materials, located in the district of La Tinguiña. Katerine's work is selling beauty products. She began as an assistant. She is still very young and has many dreams and goals. One of them is having her own business. With the funds she is requesting, she will make some personal purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal purchases

loans.name: Paugata

texts.en:
Paugata T. is 74 and married with 8 children (ages 28 - 45).  She owns a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members.  Paugata has 4 years of experience in this business.  Paugata needs a loan of WST$2900 to buy laufala (plant fibres) and decorations for mats.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.


In 2007, Paugata joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Paugata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy laufala (plant fibres) and decorations for mats

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María S. G. tiene ya mas de 3 años dedicándose a la venta de de ropa usada y zapatos, este negocio es su fuente de ingresos a parte su marido la trabaja en maquiladora para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión de ropa para la temporada de frio y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María S. G. has been selling used clothing and shoes for more than 3 years. Her income from her business along with her husband's income from work in an assembly plant covers the family expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, since right now she doesn't have enough money to invest in clothing for the cold months and she wants to be prepared.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Agnes Wairimu

texts.en:
