Agnes has been selling clothes in Naivasha for five years now. She is 23 years old, married to James Macharia and they have one child. 
She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan well and on time. She plans to use this cash to buy more clothes to sell. Agnes hopes to open a shop for selling clothes instead of selling from her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Riyozat

texts.en: I. Riyozat is 47 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Riyozat dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her family. Riyozat asks for a loan of 5000 somoni in order to buy more calves to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Elvia Ramona

texts.es:
Elvia de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. Tiene un puesto de venta de comida rápida. 

Para tener una mejor economía ya que su esposo es albañil y tiene 5 hijos que todavía son pequeños comenzó con un pequeño puesto de venta de “pripitas” es una comida rápida hecha con los intestinos de la vaca, poco a poco incremento sus ventas  e incremento su comida con “corviches” comida rápida hecha con plátanos y pescado. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días haciendo comidas rápidas.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, arena y bloques para mejorar su negocio ya que es de tablas y otra parte para su casa. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener una finca con muchos animales y vegetales para pasar su vejez.
texts.en:
Elvia, 46 years, old, lives in a suburban area called Fortin, which is characterized by its trails and mountains. She has a fast-food stand.

In order to have a better financial situation, since her husband is a brick layer and she has five children who are all still small, she started with a small stand selling "pripitas," which is a fast-food made from cow intestines. Little by little she increased her sales and expanded her menu to include "corviches," a fast-food made with plantains and fish. She is now working from 8 am to 6 pm every day, making fast-foods.

With this loan she wants to buy cement, sand, and bricks in order to improve her business since it's unfinished in another part of her home. In the future she wants to improve her home and have a farm with a lot of animals and vegetable where she can spend her older years.

loans.use: Cement, sand

loans.name: Regina Maruja

texts.en:
Regina is a member of the Communal Bank group "Great Power" located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and the department of Puno. She is 44 years old and married with three children. She has a primary school education.

Regina has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, to increase the amount of merchandise in her business, which consists of the purchase and sale of "chuños" (dehydrated potatoes).  Regina sells them in the nearby city of Juliaca. 

She is now asking for a loan for 500 PEN, to increase her inventory and sales.

Her dream is to have her children study and attain their higher education degrees.  Her favorite part about working with the Communal Bank is its loan terms and the savings.

loans.use: Increasing her business buying and selling "chuños" (dehydrated potatoes)

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr: Monsieur sidi D. est un habitant de Bambilor. C’est un jeune célibataire de 26 ans qui s’active dans l’élevage de poussins  et le commerce de marchandises diverses depuis 2006. Monsieur D. a pour objectif de se procurer des revenus pour faire face à certaines dépenses. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis avril 2010. Il emprunte un montant de 500000frs prévu d'une part pour l'augmentation de ses sujets et d'autre part pour l’achat  de quelques  marchandises diverses pour les besoins de son commerce  dans le cadre des préparatifs des fêtes  de tabaski. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en: Mr. Sidi D. lives in Bambilor. He is a young, single man of 26 who has had a business raising chickens and selling various other merchandise since 2006.  Mr. D.'s objective is to earn enough revenue to be able to pay for his expenses. He has been a member of the Bambilor fund since April, 2010. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, part of which he will use to increase his livestock and the other part will be used to purchase some of the general goods he needs for his business in preparation for sales related to "tabaski" (a large holiday in Senegal) celebrations. This loan will enable him to increase his revenues.

loans.use: To grow his funds

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Calera Santa Rosa del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, la zona está situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maracuyá, el ya tiene más de 14 años en este negocio y durante todo este tiempo se ha valido de esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia. Pedro gusta mucho de su trabajo y debido al tiempo que lleva laborando en esta actividad el  conoce bastante del manejo de cultivos.

El desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente comprar algunos fertilizantes, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro, 49, is married and lives with his family in Calera Santa Rosa, Olmos district, located in Lambayeque province over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small field where he grows passion fruit.  He’s been in this business for over 14 years and all this time he has relied on this activity to support his family.  Pedro enjoys his work very much and due to the length of time he’s been doing this work he is quite knowledgeable about crop care.

He wants to provide maintenance to his crops so needs to buy some fertilizers.  To reach this goal he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his passion fruit crops.

loans.name: María Orfilia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
Aquí encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene seis hijos,  4 de ellos ya son mayores de edad y las últimas son dos niñas de 13 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Tres de sus hijos viven con ella.  Su marido es maestro zapatero.

Tienen junto a su esposo un taller de zapatería en el cual arreglan, elaboran y venden calzado de todo tipo, trabajan de lunes a sábado desde las 8 am hasta las 18h00. Los zapatos elaborados los compran en Guayaquil y lo que es materia prima la compran en Quito, nos cuenta que lleva en su taller por 13 años y que siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos elaborados y materia prima para la fabricación de los mismos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal. Su sueño es tener un local  separado del taller para vender los zapatos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'La California' community bank meet in the Nueva California district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet 47 year-old María.  She is married and has six children from this relationship.  Four of her children are already grown up and her two youngest are girls aged 13 and 10 who are in school.  Three of her children live with her.  Her husband is a master shoemaker.  

María and her husband have a shoemaking workshop in which they mend, make and sell all kinds of footwear.  They work from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  They buy their pre-made shoes in Guayaquil and buy their raw material in Quito.  María tells us that she has had her workshop for 13 years and it has always done well.

This loan will be used to buy pre-made shoes and raw materials for making shoes.  This is María's third loan cycle with her community bank.  Her dream is to have premises separate from her workshop where she can sell the shoes they make.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and shoes

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pan, la socia elabora pan y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de Urcos, a la vez tiene su negocio de pasamanería donde vende shampus, jaboncillos, pilas, baterías, linternas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar instrumentos musicales ya que su pareja tiene su propio grupo musical llamado Los Delfines del Amor y mediante este préstamo ella puede ayudarle a su esposo y también solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms. Ana Cecilia.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling bread.  She makes bread and sells it as a traveling saleswoman in the plaza of Urcos.  Ana Cecilia also has a pasamanería (variety of small items) store where she sells shampoos, soaps, batteries, flashlights and other items.  She has had this business for several years, and she is happy because through this business she makes ends meet for her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy musical instruments because her partner has his own music group called Los Delfines del Amor.  Through this loan she can help her husband, and she is also asking for the loan so she can buy supplies for her business.

Ana Cecilia is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments for her husband's band and buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny G. Jr. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 35 years old. Danny is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Danny owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Danny has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 25000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Danny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Danny is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Lucilita

texts.en:
Lucilita Z. is a married woman who lives in Tak-an, Danao City, Cebu. 

She earns her living by operating three business ventures: hog raising, general store and livestock. 

Her husband, Emmanuel, who is 51 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 17 years old and is currently going to school.  

Lucilita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lucilita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs and stocks for the general store so that she can continue to save up for her child's education and for future home repairs. 

Lucilita Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase feed, medicines and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment to repair cars

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sweets, firewood, beverages, bread, gas and others.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa, 43, is widowed and lives with her eight year old son in Hentii, Mongolia. Her son attends a local primary school. In 2009 she began using her car as a taxi, then bought a new car with the money she made from this business. Her business has become more stable and now she has regular customers. She supports her family with the income she makes from taxi driving. Bolormaa is a hardworking, single mother who says: "I recently upgraded my car and I feel much better now as a taxi driver. I will do the best I can for my son." She is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase tires for her car and to pay it off in full.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her taxi

loans.name: Rudasingwa

texts.fr: Rudasingwa M. est commerçante dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Elle a 38 ans, elle est veuve, née a RDC, et elle a 2 enfants entre 17 ans et 19 ns, et aussi 5 personnes en charge.  Tous ses enfants vont à l’école, et elle a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des arachides et des petits poissons pour les revendre dans son commerce.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’élever ses ventes dans son marche, et aller ou vient ses produits (Tanzanie, Uganda) pour bénéficier de plus.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande distributrice des marchandises dont elle vend pour le moment, et dépasser le niveau de détaillant, et devenir grossiste.  Pour sa vie, elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille, scolariser ses enfants, ainsi tous les enfants a sa charge.
texts.en: Rudasingwa M. is a merchant in the Rubavu sector. She is 38 years old, widowed, was born in the Democratic Republic of Congo, has 2 children who are 17 and 19 years old, and also takes care of 5 people. All of her children attend school, and she finished 2 years of secondary school. This loan is her first with ACB (one of Kiva's field partners), and she is going to use it to buy peanuts and small fish to resell them as part of her business. Her strategy to increase her business is to raise her sales volume at the market and to travel to where her products come from (Tanzania and Uganda) in order to make larger profits. She would like to become a large distributor of the goods she currently sells, and to move beyond the retail level and become a wholesaler. As for her life, she would like to improve her family's standard of living, and educate her own children as well as all of the other ones in her care.

loans.use: To buy peanuts and small fish for resale

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en una casa propia en Pimentel, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, caracterizado por su playa, la que es muy concurrida en época de verano.

Se gana la vida desde hace quince años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, Felipe cría a su ganado y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Felipe desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de su ganado y venderlo a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old, single, and has two children. He resides with his family in their own house in Pimentel, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. This area is known for its beach, which is very crowded during the summer.

Felipe has earned his living by raising and selling animals for the past fifteen years. He keeps the animals in pens located behind his house. Felipe raises his animals until they have reached the proper point of development. At that time, he offers the animals for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where he lives.

Felipe wants to acquire balanced feed to improve the diet of his livestock so that he can sell them at a better price. To achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr.Bayarsaikhan, a 35-year-old taxi driver, lives with his wife and three daughters in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest daughter attends primary school, while the second one attends a kindergarten and the youngest one stays at home in her mother's care.

Bayarsaikhan has been operating a taxi business for seven years, while his wife looks after the children. An experienced taxi driver, he likes his job and earns around 300 USD a month. During the past seven years he has managed to buy a family car and a small family house from his savings. Bayarsaikhan is now requesting a loan to renovate the house where they live. The loan will enable him to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, paints, and plasters.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, paints, and plasters to renovate the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving modern Afghani carpets.

loans.name: 2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Đắc is 53 years old, married and has two children who are no longer living at home. She lives in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years Đắc has operated a food stall from which she sells vegetables. The main hardship Đắc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Đắc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is now the leader of a three-member group, the 2.10.1.2 Nam Ngan solidarity group. Đắc has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and is now requesting another loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

With her profits Đắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Chean

texts.en: Chean, aged 60, is a rice farmer. She is a widow who currently lives with her daughter who works in the tobacco factory in Kompong Cham Province. Chean sells a few produce goods in her small store in front of her home. Chean’s daughter is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling to her workplace because she doesn't have her own vehicle. To solve the problem, Chean has requested a loan to buy a second motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.name: Digna Fidela

texts.es:
Digna Fidela tiene 38 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Sofía, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz, frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terrenos.

Le gusta dedicarse por completo al hogar.
texts.en:
Digna Fidela is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The October 27th Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Sofia, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank is composed of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Digna is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. She buys her supplies in Ventanas each month and sells her products at the fair in the same location.

Digna is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. The challenges she faces include pests that can attack her crops. Her dream is to buy plots of land.

Digna enjoys spending all of her time at home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Mamary

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamary  est un homme marié de 32 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni.
Après les études secondaires sanctionnées par un diplôme en comptabilité, Mamary est resté pendant des années sans emploi. 
Il a tenté plusieurs activités notamment la commercialisation des boeufs, des moutons et  des chèvres mais sans réussite, il décida finalement de s’intéresser aux activités de volailles.
Avec une expérience de 3 années il maîtrise son activité qu’il a appris auprès d’un de ses amis.
Pour bien entretenir ses poules, Monsieur Mamary  décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter?  1 tonne de céréales pour leur nourriture, 2 cartons de médicaments et 200 poussins pour préparer la relève. Il est à son quatrième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et les trois prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.  Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako ( capitale de la république du Mali.)  Les œufs sont vendu à des acheteurs professionnels (Boutique, Alimentation et restaurant). et à la maison. Après leur pontes, elles sont vendues au marché et dans des restaurants. Avec ce près, Monsieur Mamary compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 500 FCFA.
 Avec ce bénéfice il compte élargir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mamary is a 32-year-old married father of two and lives with his wife and children in his dad's house in the Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni region.
After finishing secondary studies and receiving an accounting degree, Mamary has gone several years without a job.
He tried several jobs such as selling cattle, sheep, and goats but with no success, he ultimately decided to sell poultry. 
With three years of experience, he is becoming an expert at his job which he learned from one of his friends.
To take care of his chickens, Mamary decided to take out a loan through Soro Yiriwaso to purchase: 1 ton of grain for feed, 2 cartons of medicine, and 200 chicks. He is on his fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso and his three prior loans were all repaid in full. He buys his supplies in Boubouni and in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). The eggs are sold to professional buyers (shops, food industries, and restaurants) and to home consumers. After they are laid, the eggs are sold at the market and in restaurants. With this loan, Mamary hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,500 FCFA.
With this profit, he hopes to increase the size of his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and chicks.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie, 41 years of age, is married and blessed with one child. She's into livestock business, particularly hog raising.  She's been in this business for almost four years. Her net income every three months is 20,000 PHP. She has also been selling vegetables in their village for almost three years and she has a net income of 5,000 PHP monthly. She's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase sacks of feed for her hogs.

Lailanie would like to continue requesting loans from Kiva lenders and ASKI so that she can work towards her goals.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed for her hogs

loans.name: Nateku

texts.en:
Nateku is 48 years old, married to Toyoto, and has been blessed with children.

Nateku is a livestock trader. She sells to butcher men and the Kenya Meat Commission. She has been doing this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES17,580 per month. She was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer.

Nateku is applying for her second loan of KES50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more livestock, like two cows, ten goats and others. She will use the anticipated profits to establish a dairy farm.

She hopes to have a big dairy farm and to be supplying milk to the surrounding markets.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Ailyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Aifai

texts.en:
Aifai is 39 years of age and married with six children. She owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Aifai needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 230 talas or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Aifai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aifai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Muema

texts.en:
For the last 11 years Muema has been practicing farming in Kibwezi town. He is 27 years old and married to Winfrint. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, who is also a KADET client. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He intends to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers and pay for the farm labor.

In future Muema hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es: Neyda tiene 30 años, se destaca por ser una mujer valiente y luchadora, es casada y madre de dos niños de 7 años y 4 meses de nacido, por quienes desea dar los cuidados necesarios ya que son aún muy pequeños. Juntos habitan en casa de su suegro y junto a ellos conviven en armonía. De ama de casa a microempresaria ha logrado Neyda en la vida, ella se dedica en la venta de muebles al por menor, pues se encarga de comprar dichos muebles en las carpinterías a un precio bajo, y del que son llevados hasta su casa, lugar donde ha montado un local para su negocio. Desde entonces, sus clientes eligen la calidad y el diseño que más les guste y el sistema de pago lo realizan cada semana, quincena o mensual, de acuerdo a las posibilidades de su economía. Tiene tres años ejerciendo esta actividad y con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado generar ganancias y con ella pudieron brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Manifiesta que le gusta su trabajo, pues lo considera muy divertido, además que trabaja a lado de su esposo e hijos. Como mujer empresaria, ve conveniente que temporada del año es que tiene más ventas y que no, por ello es que es muy ahorrativa para tener un respaldo económico.  Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con el ritmo de trabajo para así poder cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará muebles, sillas, cómodas, asimismo refaccionará el local de venta para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neyda is 30 years old and considers herself a brave and spirited woman. She is married and a mother of two children, ages 7 and 4 months, for whom she wishes to provide all necessary care, as they're still very young. They live together happily with her father-in-law.

In her life, Neyda has gone from housekeeper to small business owner, selling furniture in installments. She arranges to buy the furniture pieces from carpenters at low prices and then have them taken to her house, where she has established a space in which to run her business. From there, her customers chose the quality and design of their preference and pay in weekly or monthly installments, depending on their economic ability. She has been doing this for three years and with the help of her husband she has succeeded in turning a profit with which they have been able to provide a better quality of life for their family. 

She says that she likes her work, as she considers it very entertaining and it also allows her to work with her children at her side. As a businesswoman, she has experienced the high and low times for sales throughout the year. As such, she is very thrifty so as to maintain a financial cushion. This will be her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [MFP; Kiva field partner] and so she hopes to continue her pace of work so she can make all her payments. With this loan, she will buy furniture, including chairs and chests of drawers and will refurbish her sales room so as to offer greater comfort to her customers.

loans.use: to buy furniture, including chairs and chests of drawers and to refurbish her sales room so as to offer greater comfort to her customers.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson is 31 years old and still single. He lives in a village with his beloved parents who are now old and infirm. He aims to earn more income to satisfy their needs and save for their future. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport in their village to earn income. He has been in this business for more than one year and usually earns profits of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. 

He wants to ask an additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy gasoline, wheels and spare parts for his motorcycle transport to provide better service. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will increase his income and save for his future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts for his motorcycle transport

loans.name: Shokirchon

texts.ru: Шокирчон возраст 42 года, женат, имеет 4 детей. Он честный человек. Он 17 лет занимается  куплей и продажей скота. У него в обороте 3 голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота. В бизнесе ему помогает жена. Шокирчон трудолюбивый, вместе со своей семьей он  построил дом, но средств для его ремонта не хватает, и  он запрашивает у  вас займ на сумму 8000 сомони для  установки окон и дверей, для ремонта и других нужных средств. Получение займа поможет его семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Shokirchon is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He is an honest person.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for 17 years.  He owns three heads of cattle and two heads of small livestock.  His wife helps him in this business.  Shokirchon is a hard-working person and built a house together with his family, but does not have enough funds to make repairs to it.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni to install windows and doors, to make repairs and for other necessary supplies.  Obtaining this loan will help his family budget.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Gulkaiyr's Group

texts.en:
Gulkaiyr is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old and divorced. She is bringing up two children by herself: her daughter studies at school and her son is a baby. Three years ago, with an initial investment of 7,000 soms, Gulkaiyr started to take orders for sewing clothes, pillows and blankets. In this way she earns money to meet her family’s needs. Her monthly profit is about 15,000 soms.
  
At the moment, Gulkaiyr’s business runs well and she plans to open a sewing workshop. With money received from the loan, she plans to purchase sewing machines for the sewing workshop. 

In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen was born and lives in Geghamavan village in the Sevan area with his wife, daughter and parents. Armen is 26 years old and has been engaged in animal breeding and bee keeping businesses. He keeps cows, pigs, sheep, turkeys and chickens.
 
Armen also produces and sells cement blocks for construction, but his main income is from his farming. Armen’s parents and wife help him to sell meat, milk and honey in their regional markets.
 
Armen has received loans from Nor Horizon three times and has never delayed his repayments.
 
Armen asks from Kiva 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase the number of his bee families.

loans.use: To increase the number of his bee families.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, D. 34 años, es una mujer  buena, amable, trabajadora y muy luchadora. Es madre soltera D. dos hijos D. 13 y 2 años, ellos son su motivo D. inspiración y esfuerzo a diario para poder brindarles lo mejor en educación y alimentación, elL. vive en casa D. su madre a lado su hermana y su padre. El trabajo D. Elizabeth consiste en L. venta D. golosinas y otros productos más en su kiosco ubicado en un colegio D. un Asentamiento Humano D. L. ciudad, lo hace recién hace tres meses y trabaja soL. en este negocio. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que tiene tiempo disponible para poder realizar múltiples actividades en su hogar, solo venD. en las horas punta del horario escolar, en las entradas, recreos y salidas D. los turnos del colegio. Por otro lado tiene un negocio en su casa D. venta D. abarrotes que le ayuda su madre, le esta yendo muy bien y espera poder seguir haciéndolo bien como hasta ahora. Este será el séptimo préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura D. avanzar con su negocio o trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas D. cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para vender en su kiosco, entre las cosas que comprará están, gaseosas, caramelos, galletas, golosinas y mas, ya que desea implementar su negocio para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Elizabeth, 34, is a good woman, kind, hardworking and determined. She is a single mother of 2 children, 13 and 2 years of age. They are her inspiration and motivate her to work hard every day to proviD. them with the best in education and food. She lives in her mother's house with her sister and her father. Elizabeth sells candies and other products in a kiosk located in a school in a poor neighbourhood of the city. She has only been doing this for the last 3 months and she works alone. What she likes about the work is that she has time available to take care of the many household chores. She sells only at school peak hours at the entrances, during breaks and changes in shifts at the school. She  also has a buisness in her home selling groceries which her mother helps her with. She is doing very well and hopes to continue doing as well as she is now. This will be her 7th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that financial supprot will be available as she will thus feel secure moving forward with her business or work. On the other hand, she agrees once again to make her repayments as with the other loans she had. With the amount requested, she will buy products to sell in her kiosk such as soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, candies and more as she wants to implement her business so as to have more products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has ten children.  Seven of his children are currently in school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his business, which sells matresses. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mattresses for resale, and it will help John to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. John hopes that in the future he will be able to become a mattress supplier for the entire eastern Uganda region. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mattresses for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children; four attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other coconut retailers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business in the market.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale and establish a vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale and establish a vegetable stall

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells sheabutter and banku (a dumpling-like product often used in soups) at Ankwanda near Elmina.   

Ama has been selling banku for 30 years. She uses her income to provide for herself. 

Her loan will be used to buy maize for the preparation of the banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for the preparation of the banku for sale.

loans.name: Clarisse Anto

texts.fr: Clarisse Anto est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Clarisse Anto a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris la couture. Clarisse Anto est mariée à un certain Christian. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leur unique enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Clarisse Anto exerce depuis une quinzaine d’années, la couture dans une région du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Clarisse Anto vend des fournitures de couture. Clarisse Anto achète ses produits au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Clarisse Anto contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Clarisse Anto sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Clarisse Anto is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at the primary grade level and learned how to sew. She is married to a man named Christian. They have a child in school and in their care. The couple live together with their only child and jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered.

To support herself and her child, Clarisse Anto has been sewing for about fifteen years in her region in Benin. On the side, she sells sewing supplies. She purchases her supplies in Benin. Thanks to the revenues this business generates, she is helping with the different family expenses. 

To satisfy the needs of her burgeoning customer base, Clarisse Anto is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a third time. The first two loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy an embroidering machine and some sewing supplies

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en:
Douaa is a 34-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and two working siblings. Her father is their main income provider and fulfills their needs.

Douaa started her own home business as a private teacher in 2005 and looks to further improve her work. She also has a parallel job at a local company.

Today, Douaa would like to borrow $2900 from Kiva’s partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laptop in addition to an ipad in order to enhance her teaching abilities and gain added students.

In the future Douaa plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and an ipad for her work.

loans.name: Victor Santiago

texts.es:
VICTOR SANTIAGO tiene 63 años de estado civil Soltero vive tiene 4 hijos pero no viven con el. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

VICTOR SANTIAGO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Víctor Santiago is 63 years old and single. He has four children but they do not live with him. He lives in Cantón Ventanas, located in Los Ríos province.

The communal bank, called 14 de Diciembre, comprises fifteen members from Cooperativa San José and is located in the San Vicente de las Lomas area which belongs to Ventanas Canton. They work in the farm performing various tasks, such as planting corn.

Víctor Santiago is a farm worker and plants corn. He buys his products with Ventanas (a unique loan which uses a group guarantee but is an individual loan with a savings component) and later sells them in the local marketplace and fairs nearby.

He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and urea to plant corn. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to increase his income and provide for his family. His dream is to buy a plot of land to build his own home. He enjoys watching television in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a fish vendor for nine years now. She sold it around neighbors and locals in her community.  She lives in the town of Baclayon. She is 58 years old, married and has five grown children.   Her husband is fisherman. His catch has two purpose. First,  for family consumption and second, a source of income.

 She would like to avail loan at CEVI, in order to boost her livelihood.
Teodora has  requested a  loan which will be used  to  purchase fish and foam(fish storage).
in that way, she could sold higher volume of fish and attract potential customers.
 In the long run, she could now able to save half of the profit for future use and the other half is for expansion.

loans.use: to  purchase fish and foam(fish storage)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO improve on business

loans.name: Françoise

texts.en:
Born on April 2, 1977 in Aného in the county of the Lacs, Miss E. Françoise is single without children. Because of lack of funds, she abandoned her schooling at the secondary level and engaged in the business of selling colorful traditional wrap around fabrics (pagnes). With an enterprising spirit and strong ethics, she manages to turn a profit from her activities.

She is asking today for a first loan of $600 to allow her to establish a permanent stock of pagnes-fabrics to avoid running out of stock. The realization of that project will increase her income and contribute to her empowerment.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 02 avril 1977 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mademoiselle E. Françoise est célibataire sans enfant. Par manque de moyen, elle a abandonné ses études au cours secondaire et s’est lancée dans le commerce de tissus pagnes. Ayant un esprit d’entreprenariat et dotée d’une bonne moralité, elle arrive à bien rentabiliser ses activités. Elle demande aujourd'hui un premier crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de faire un stock permanent de pagnes afin d’éviter les ruptures de stocks. La réalisation du ce projet augmentera ses revenir en de son épanouissement.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of traditional wrap around fabrics

Achat et revente de tissus pagnes

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
Mr. M. has dedicated himself to selling sheets, bedspreads and quilts by catalogue. He also holds a steady job, but his salary is not sufficient, and his wife underwent a costly medical procedure. "I need your help to continue supplying my business. I have been blessed with good sales, but I need a loan of $800 to keep it up."

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. M. se dedica a la venta de sabanas, colchas y edredones por catalogo además tiene su empleo pero su ingreso no es suficiente, por si fuera poco su esposa lleva un tratamiento medico costoso. "Necesito de su ayuda para seguir surtiendo la mercancía gracias a dios he logrado realizar buenas ventas, este seria por la cantidad de $800.00 dlls

loans.use: Buy sheets, bedspreads and quilts to sell.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Ms Abigail has owned her hamburger and fast food business for more than two years. The business is the family's income. Abigail is a single mother of two children, both of which are in school. She asks for a loan of 1,200 dollars to purchase a car, allowing her to make her business purchases, transport the goods home, and deliver them to residences.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Abigail tiene ya más de 2 años con el negocio de hamburguesas y comida rápida. Este negocio es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando. Ella necesita un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para comprar un carro y poder salir a realizar sus comprar del negocio y así transportar su mercancías hasta su casa .y hacer entregas a domicilia.

loans.use: To purchase a car for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cabbages for sale.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
My name is Maria H. and I sell cosmetics such as: creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc. I have been selling for 1 year because I lost my old job and in my city it is very difficult to find a job, my goal is to be able to increase my product offering so that I can sell more and be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria H. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos para dama como ser cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, actividad que realizo hace 1 año ya que perdi mi trabajo anterior y en nuestra ciudad es dificil conseguir un trabajo en una empresa, mi meta es poder tener muchos productos para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy inventory for my business (deodorants, creams, toothpaste, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise for a larger profit margin.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen A. from a small, lush, green town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. Currently, only three kids attend school while the others are done with their studies. My husband is a painter and one of my sons has had a vegetable business for past six years and we need a loan to expand it.

I have few friends who all are my loan group members and require loans. They are Samina Bibi, Sumaira Bibi, Sughran Bibi and Shaheen Bibi. All of them have vegetables business and need loans to improve and expand them.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Five years ago, Andrea started her business of selling rotisserie chicken and barbecue on Sundays. When her husband lost his job, she started selling rotisserie chicken in a small restaurant, and with her profits, she helped with her family's expenses. She later noticed that no one sold barbecue in her area, and with the goal of satisfying Sunday tradition, she bought a better assortment of meat, studied the process of making barbecue, and learned it. Now she sells rotisserie chicken during the week and barbecue on Sundays. Everyone in the area has tried her exquisite and delicious barbecue.

Nevertheless, this is the moment for Andrea's business to grow. This is why she is requesting a credit of $475, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. She will purchase a new large rotisserie, chairs and tables, and pots and pans for her kitchen so she can make her products more quickly and sell them in less time. With your help, Andrea will be able to progress with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Andrea empezó hace 5 años con el negocio de venta de pollos asados y Barbacoa los domingos, cuando su esposo se quedó sin empleo, comenzó con la venta de pollo asado en un asador pequeño y con las ganancias ayudaba al gasto familiar. Después se dio cuenta que nadie vendía barbacoa en su colonia con el fin de satisfacer esta tradición de los domingos, se surtió de carne e investigó el proceso para elaborar barbacoa y aprendió. Actualmente entre semana vende pollo asado y barbacoa los domingos, en su colonia todos han probado su exquisita y riquísima barbacoa.

Sin embargo es momento de que el negocio de Andrea crezca. Es por eso que actualmente está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, para comprar asador nuevo grande, comprar sillas y mesas, además de una batería de cocina, para así poder elaborar los productos más rápido y vender más en menos tiempo. Con tu ayuda Andrea podrá sacar adelante su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, tables, and pots and pans for her kitchen

loans.name: Ramona's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Ramona is 39 years old. She is married with three children, ages eight, ten, and sixteen. She and her husband also take care of another child who is nine years old.

Ramona owns a small shop, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190.00 from her sales.

Ramona has already successfully completed a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She would now like a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling charcoal and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Thierno Omar

texts.fr:
Thierno Omar S. has been a shopkeeper for ten years in Thiès. He sells foodstuffs and would like to build his capital in order to diversify his products. He is a married father of two children, and his ambition is to open other stores in different areas. He needs working capital in order to keep up with the fast turnover of his supplies.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Thierno Omar S. est commerçant depuis 10 années dans la ville de Thiès, il fait du commerce de denrées alimentaires, et voudrait renforcer son capital afin de diversifier ses produits. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants et affiche l’ambition d’ouvrir d’autres boutiques dans des zones différentes. Il a un besoin de fonds de roulement du fait de la rotation rapide de ses stocks.

loans.use: Obtaining working capital to increase his product supply

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel S. is a gentleman resident of the municipally Cinco Pinos of the city of Chinandega and works very hard in the agriculture business. He is the father of a family with two sons for which he has the responsibility to provide food, education and a decent roof over their heads. For this reason he has decided to invest in the reconstruction of his home which has suffered many damages due to natural disasters. Upon having started the reconstruction and not having enough financial resources, he has decided to lean on Ceprodel for the receipt of a loan to be able to continue with the improvements. For this reason he is confidently waiting for the approval of the loan so that he can continue with his arduous efforts to improve his home.

It is very important to note that through this loan he will be able to achieve his dream of having a proper home where he can house and develop his children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Israel S. es un caballero originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica muy esforzadamente a la labor de la agricultura. Es padre de familia con dos hijos a los que tiene el deber de brindar alimentación, estudios y un techo digno donde vivir. Por esta razón es que ha decidido invertir en la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ya que actualmente ha sido muy lastimada por los fenómenos naturales y al haber iniciado en parte con la reconstrucción y al faltarle el recurso económico ha decidido apoyarse de Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos para continuar con la reconstrucción de la vivienda. Es por esto que muy confiadamente espera en esta aprobación para continuar con su ardua labor de la mejora de su vivienda.

Es de suma importancia destacar que gracias a estos créditos logrará alcanzar el sueño de su el cual consiste en tener un techo digno donde poder habitar y desarrollar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Geysel Verónica

texts.es:
Geysel is a young college student who is 23-years-old. She lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood, and she is single.

Geysel is one of the young people who has difficulty obtaining a college education because of economic limitations. This is why she works as a cashier during the day and attends classes at night. She puts a lot of effort into her studies, and this is why she would like to buy a computer with this loan to be able to do her school work.

She hopes to finish college soon, to become a professional, and to be a worthy person in society.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Geysel es una joven estudiante universitaria de 23 años de edad. Habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, es soltera.

Geysel es uno de los muchos jóvenes con dificultades para poder estudiar una carrera universitaria debido a las limitaciones económicas, es por eso que Geysel por el día se desempeña como cajera, y por la noche acude a la universidad, le pone mucho empeño a sus estudios, es por eso que con el préstamo comprará una computadora para poder hacer las tareas de la universidad.

Espera poder terminar su carrera, y llegar a ser una profesional, y una persona de bien para la sociedad.

loans.use: To acquire a computer for her studies

loans.name: Deborah Ndagire `s Group

texts.en:
N. Deborah leads a group of four women. She has been a member of MCDT since 2002 and has received 10 previous loans. For the past three years, Deborah has owned and operated a profitable used-clothing business. Three times a month, she goes out early in the morning to the local market, a large one in Kampala town, to buy used women’s clothing. She then resells blouses, skirts and other articles at a stand outside the market near her home in Ndeeba, a suburb within the city limits of Kampala. She works six days a week, from 10 a.m. until evening, and reports that she has about 10-15 customers each day. Evenings are her busiest time. She decided to sell clothing because it's an easy way to make a living. Her goal is to continue in this business, but her primary challenge is buying enough clothing to resell. With a new loan, she will be able to buy more clothes and see her business grow.

Deborah is a 42-year-old married mother of five children, ranging in age from 12 to 22. All of her children are in school; the eldest is a student at Makerere Univeristy.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell in a local market

loans.name: Sheyla's Group

texts.en:
Sheila and Leticia are members of the Gratitud Village Bank. Sheila is a single, twenty-five-year-old computing student who helps her boyfriend at an Internet center of ten computers at his house, where they also sell candies. Leticia is a married, thirty-year-old mother of two children; she sells catalog cosmetics to her friends, relatives and acquaintances in addition to her household duties and chores.

Shelia and Leticia each is seeking a loan of 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in cookies, snacks, gum, cream and perfume. Each dreams of doing well with her business; Sheila hopes to have children one day, and they both dream of seeing their children grow up to become professionals.

loans.use: To invest in supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Abou Niassa

texts.fr: Abou Niassa D. est un Maréyeur de profession mais il gère un poulailler depuis quelques temps. Marié  et  Père de 3 enfants il a une expérience de plus de 2ans dans le secteur de l'aviculture. IL demande ce prêt pour acheter de l'aliment pour la nourriture  du volaille
texts.en:
Abou Niassa D. is a fish trader by profession but he has managed a poultry farm for some time. Married and the father of 3 children, he has had more than two years experience in poultry raising. He is requesting this loan to buy chicken feed for his poultry business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of chicken feed

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en: This group is called God Help. It members include Kadiatu K. (left) and Charles B.. They have businesses in Makeni. They have been receiving loans from SMT for more than two years now. Through these loans they get from Kiva (through SMT), these entrepreneurs are able to remain in business and sustain themselves. However, they still need new loans to enable them to enhance their businesses. They are thus requesting a loan of Le 1,600,000. Kadiatu, 37, is the leader of the group. She was born in Magoreh village, seven miles from Makeni. She is married and has five children. Her husband is also a businessman. Kadiatu has sold dried fish for the past 10 years. She buys fish in a village called Tombo which is about 10 miles from Freetown. With this loan, Kadiatu is expecting an increase in her profits, which will enable her to provide better for her children.  One of the great challenges Kadiatu faces as a dried fish seller is that they sometimes unknowingly buy a basket of fish that is mixed with some rotten ones. And when this happens, they have to throw away the rotten fish, which causes losses in her business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Mukima

texts.en: Mukima has a very big family: she has 6 kids! Her husband left to go to Russia to get a better paying job. So Mukima had to do something to support her family and help her husband. She started with buying cattle, mostly cows, fattening them and selling them at the markets. She has been doing this for more than 10 years already and by this time, she has become really good in this. Now, in these days, everything is so expensive and to buy more cattle, she needs more money, so she decided to borrow money to expand her business.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoang Thi A. is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in the Nghi Loc district, in Vietnam. She joined TYM in 2005. She currently runs a beauty salon. This business developed well and brought for her family a stable income.

Mrs. Thi is requesting a loA. of $950 to purchase more tools for her beauty salon.

loans.use: Purchase tools for beauty salon

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua todos los viernes, sábado y domingo desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada la señora Sebastiana R. se levanta para preparar los deliciosos nacatamales que son vendidos en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes.

Es importante señalar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera y ha tenido vasta experiencia en la preparación de los nacatamales. Para llevar a cabo su negocio de venta de nacatamales ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de su materia prima para la preparación de los nacatamales tal materia prima es el arroz, el maíz, las papas, las verduras y sobre todo el cerdo para destazarlo. Con el crédito que solicita se beneficiará tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, every Friday, Saturday and Sunday, very early in the morning Mrs. Sebastiana R. gets up to prepare her delicious tamales that are sold in her home which is where she attends to her clients. It's important to point out that she is known for being an excellent cook and has vast experience in the preparation of the tamales. In order to carry out her tamale business, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy materials she needs to make them like rice, corn, vegetables and most importantly, the pork that will be shredded. With the loan she is requesting, both she and her family will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Nèkè

texts.fr:
Né vers 1979 à Kocoula Sous Préfecture de San (région de Ségou), Monsieur Nèkè D. est un  monogame résidant avec son épouse et leurs 2 enfants à Wayerma I  un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Neke D. n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école très tôt il entreprena les activités génératrices. Après  s’être éssayé à beaucoup d’activités sans succès, il décida de faire son job  l’activité blanchisserie depuis maintenant  sept (7) ans. Il mène son activité au carrefour de la Rue Pekin de son quartier où il dispose son atelier de blanchisserie. Pour sa dextérité et sa ponctualité il est très sollicité et apprécié de tous ses clients qui se cessent  d’augmenter.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant dix (10) mois dont il est à son premier prêt individuel. Il sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter un (1) fer électrique et une (1) moto Jakarta pour pouvoir récuperer et livrer les habits de ses clients qui  sont un peu loin de son atelier.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 135 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born around 1979 in Kocoula in the sub-prefecture of San (region of Ségou), Nèkè D. lives in a monogamous relationship with his wife and their two children in Wayerma I, a populous neighbourhood of the city of Sikasso in Mali. Nèkè D. did not have the opportunity to go to school: he worked from a very young age. For seven years he has been offering laundry services, a business he started after a number of unsuccessful attempts at other work. His business is located at the corner of Pekin Road in his neighbourhood. Because of his dexterity and punctuality, he is popular with all his customers and continues to attract more clients. Ten months ago, in order to satisfy his customers, he decided to join the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso. This will be his first individual loan. He is asking for this loan to buy an electric iron and a Jakarta motorbike in order to pick up and deliver the clothing of those customers who live far from his workshop. With this loan, he expects to make 135,000 FCFA monthly with which he will increase his business, contribute to the household expenses, pay the interest on the loan.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric iron and a Jakarta motorbike

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap M. is a villager from Prey Tom Nub village in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who owns land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She currently faces a problem because she does not have enough money to grow cassava on her field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy cassava seeds to plant on her field. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

Mrs. Sopheap M. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Yan Oeun, is a construction worker. 

Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds

loans.name: Yawa Esther

texts.fr: Yawa esther  habite le quartier d’agbalepedo, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle a pour activité le commerce de pagnes, elle le fait de façon ambulante et ce depuis 1995, elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de chez wages, c’est por cela qu’elle sollicite de wages encore un deuxième crédit pour acquérir en gros des pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Avec le surplus de revenu qu’ele gagne elle aide son mari qui est un chauffeur dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
Yawa Esther lives in the Agbalepedo district. She is married and the mother of three. Her work involves commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth), which she has been selling door-to-door since 1995. She has already been the recipient of a loan from WAGES. This is why she is again requesting from WAGES a second loan for acquiring pagnes wholesale. She is married and the mother of three children. With the extra income she earns, she helps her husband (who is a driver) to cover day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagne cloth

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls. She says her sons are learning trades and that one of her daughters is in the senior high. However, the other daughter dropped out of school due to a teenage pregnancy.
 
She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern region of Ghana. The major occupation of the inhabitants, the men in particular, is farming. Most of the women, however, are involved in trading activities and palm oil production. Her husband is a palm nut farmer.

Grace is involved in palm oil production. She buys palm fruits from the local farmers and nearby farms. She says she also harvests some of the palm from her husband’s farm. Grace distributes her oil to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. She wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk so that she can produce the oil in bulk and distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in business for six years and hopes to improve her living standards and give her children the best of support that she can.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly V. was born in 1967 and is a resident of the Banteay Meachey Province in Cambodia. She is a good homemaker who cooks delicious meals and cares for her three children, all of whom are single and still live in the family home. Besides her housework, she also plants vegetables on her one hectare of farmland located in the village. Her husband works with her in planting them. Since the vegetable growing is the family's main source of income and they would like to expand their business, Ly V. has requested a loan to buy a plot of land for growing crops and to buy more fertilizers. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Coronacion

texts.en:
Coronacion G. is 26 and has three children. Her husband, Joey, is a driver. She sells fish - such as milk fish, tilapia, shrimps, and prawns - in the town market of Hamtic, to help support the needs of the family. 

She started her business when she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in 2000. Her membership has really helped her because she was able to provide a tricycle (a bicycle with a sidecar) for her husband from her income. She also purchased furniture and utensils for the house and has been able to save money toward the education of her children.

She applied for this loan to buy more stock so as to increase her income. She dreams of selling to the vendors in the market from her own stall someday.

loans.use: To buy fish for retail sale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa H. se dedica a su ardua tarea de venta de ropa el cual atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas en su localidad siendo este su negocio que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia.

Actualmente ella requiere de la compra de la ropa para continuar en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Ms. Teresa Hernandez works very hard in her clothing sales business. She works every day in her community starting very early in the morning because this business allows her to support her family. At the moment she needs to purchase clothing to continue her business so she has turned to CEPRODEL to request a loan so her she can get ahead with her business which really needs this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing Sales

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
MARIA R. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA” vive en el Asentamiento Humano José Olaya. Jr. Los pinos Nº 183, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 26 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es moto taxista (transportista).

           Se inició en el negocio de venta chupetes (helados de hielo), refrescos, gaseosas y el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar insumos para preparar los chupetes.

Hoy ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de los chupetes ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos.

Ella esta agradecida con Manuela Ramos, es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de mujeres, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Maria R. M. belongs to the community bank, "Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza" ["Our Lady of Hope"]. She lives in the settlement of José Olaya. Jr. Los pinos Nº 183 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 26 years old, has 1 son, and her partner is a taxi driver. She began with the business of selling "chupetes" (popsicles) and soft drinks. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy ingredients to prepare the popsicles. Today, she has progressed with her family, and the popsicle business has improved. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of soft drinks and a showcase to display her products. Maria is grateful for Manuela Ramos, an NGO that supports a great deal of woman with small loans that allow the women from this region to begin or improve their businesses. And, "I am happy with that help," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and a showcase for her products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica M. is a widow and has six dependants. She received schooling through the junior high level. Veronica sells plastic products such as bowls and other home utensils in Agona. She has been in this business since 1996. Veronica uses her income to feed her family. She will use the loan to buy more plastic products to sell. Veronica plans to reinvest the new profits into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic products

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.en:
The women in this group are tight-knit and sell a variety of products. Some women sell clothes and cosmetics, while others have food stores. One woman cleans homes, while others sell bedspreads and pillows. Most of the members just started their businesses less than five years ago and are looking to grow their businesses. These businesses help them to earn enough money to pay off their loan. The majority of these women have previous experience taking out loans.

There is considerable competition in all of their markets, but their dedication to their businesses will allow them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To further their businesses

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Liz pertenece al grupo LOS ANGELES que esta ubicado en la colonia María Isabel en el Municipio de Valle de Chalco una zona semi urbana. Del Estado de México, Liz  vende productos de papelería frente a una escuela con su triciclo todas las mañanas antes de que los niños entren a la escuela,  por lo  cual ella tiene que trasladarse desde su casa a la escuela muy temprano empujando su triciclo. Ella   esta pidiendo este préstamo  para comprar  más productos de papelería (cuadernos, lápices, colores) ya que se acerca el nuevo ciclo escolar y necesita surtirse por que es, cuando todos los niños necesitan nuevos útiles,  y para Liz una oportunidad de generar mas ventas y obtener ingresos que le ayudaría con los gastos de escuela para sus 3 hijas  y apoyar a su esposo en estos gastos, por que el cuenta con un trabajo que es de temporada, cubriendo  necesidades básicas  y con el trabajo de ambos darle a sus hijas una preparación académica mayor, a la que ellos tuvieron.


El grupo  esta formado por 12 integrantes (de izquierda a  derecha):



Maricarmen Domínguez                         Venta de Uniformes
Avelina Pérez M.                      Venta de Corsetería
María del Rosario C. C.                   Venta de Dulces
Ivett Sarai Guzmán G.                      Abarrotes
Rosa Lorena García M.                Costurera
Refugio Beatriz R. Fernández         Venta de Ropa
Lucia Gabriela Juárez Jiménez              Venta de dulces
Julia López Q.                              Venta de Antojitos
María Luisa Ramírez M.                Reparadora de Calzado
Agustín Domínguez M.                    Venta de discos
Marco Antonio Juárez C.              Verdulería
texts.en:
Liz belongs to the Los Angeles group, which is located in the María Isabel colony in the Valle de Calco municipality, a semi urban area in the state of Mexico. Liz sells paper products with her tricycle in front of a school every morning before the children enter the school. To do so, she has to go from her house to the school very early pushing her tricycle. She is asking for a loan to buy more paper products (notebooks, pencils, colors) because the new school cycle is approaching. She needs to stock up for when the children need new supplies. This is an opportunity for Liz to generate more sales and get income that will help her husband with the school expenses for her three daughters.
