Her husband’s work is seasonal, and it covers basic needs. By both working they can give their daughters greater academic preparation, like they had. The group consists of 12 members (from left to right): Maricarmen Domínguez Uniform Sales Avelina Pérez M. Corset Sales María del Rosario C. C. Sells Sweets Ivett Sarai Guzmán G. Groceries Rosa Lorena García M. Seamstress Refugio Beatriz R. Fernández Clothing Sales Lucia Gabriela Juárez Jiménez Sells Sweets Julia López Q. Sells Appetizers María Luisa Ramírez M. Shoe Repair Agustín Domínguez M. Sells Disks Marco Antonio Juárez C. Vegetable Market

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Yésica Maydana

texts.es:
La señora Yesica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Derecho 5 Nivel), vive en la Torres de San Carlos Puno.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de zapatillas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de zapatillas, juguetería y utensilios de cocina, los cuales los compra en Arequipa, Tacna y los vende en el mercado de Puno.

Su deseo es poner una  tienda para vender juguetería y ropa de niños.

A ella le gustan la unidad en las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Doña Yésica, aged 27, lives with her partner and her three children. She studied law at the university until level 5. She lives in the neighborhood of Las Torres in San Carlos de Puno. She is a member of the Communal Bank "3 De Mayo II" (May 3rd II) located in the district of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno.

Yésica has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy slippers.

Now she applies for a loan of 2300 nuevos soles to buy slippers, toys and kitchen utensils in Arequipa and Tacna, which she will sell at the market in Puno. Her desire is to open her own store and sell toys and children's wear. In her group she likes the savings and the unity with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy slippers, toys and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita G. is from the village of Buenavista. She is 42 years old. Anecita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns & operates a vulcanizing shop business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Anecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn V. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 39 years-old and married with two school-aged children. Roselyn owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products and viand in the local community. Roselyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Roselyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roselyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Roselyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Xiomara B. de 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, casada y con 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos estudian.  Su esposo  trabaja como jardinero y lo hace independiente, pues tiene clientes que lo llaman para hacer su servicio de jardinero. El negocio de la señora Xiomara es la venta de cosmético, anteriormente tenia una pulpería pero el margen de ganancia era bajo, el cual opto por cambiar de venta y le va mejor en los cosmético, son siete ciclo en Afodenic el cual invertirá con este préstamo, en la compra de cosméticos variados para sastifacer la demanda de sus clientes, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena, los productos son accesibles de precios. Como objetivo es ampliar su negocio, hacer mejora  a su casa, como ayudar a sus dos hijos menores en la educación. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad de poder incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su nivel de vida, ya que solo mediante el financiamiento logR. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Xiomara B. is 38 años years old and lives in the neighbourhood Laureles Sur in the capital of Managua. She is married and has four children: two now adults and two who study. Her husband works independently as a gardener and has clients who call him for his gardening services. Xiomara's runs a business selling cosmetics. Previously she had a grocery store but the margin of earnings was low, which is why she opted to change businesses and she is doing better with cosmetics. This is her seventh cycle with Afodenic, and she aims to invest this loan in purchasing a range of cosmetics to satisfy the demand of her clients. She sells her products for cash and two-week credit at accessible prices. Her goal is to enlarge her business, improve her house and help her two younger children with their education. She gives thanks to Kiva for the opportunity to increase her sales and improve her quality of life, as it is only through financing that she is able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a range of cosmetics to meet demand

loans.name: Mary Galla A

texts.en:
Mary Galla A Ca¤ete is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 39 years old. Mary Galla A is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Galla A owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mary Galla A has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 12,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mary Galla A joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Galla A has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Galla A is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mary Galla A from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201030012) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA, a Kiva field partner.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phố Chờ 1 nhóm 02 (2).

T. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business selling soft drinks in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $147 a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used, as before, to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her fourth loan from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201030006) is a 69-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20201030009) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201030008) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201030010) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T.  Nguyễn Thị (20201030012) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phố Chờ 1 nhóm 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại nước ngọt trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T.  kiếm được khoảng 2.600.000 VND.  Vào 2007, T.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201030006) là 69 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20201030009) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201030008) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


4.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201030010) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Arturo Ramon

texts.es:
En la foto puedes ver  a la señora G., esposa del cliente. Ella tiene 50 años y vive en Paraiso de la flor, una zona marginal de guayaquil. Cuenta con un negocio que brinda lavanderia, planchado y tintoreria de ropa con un horario de 8 de la mañana a 7 de la noche pero una de sus tres lavadoras esta dañada con este prestamo espera poder adquirir una nueva maquina cuyo precio es de $ 550,00. Ella cobra 0,90 por cada 12 piezas y asi atender a sus  clientes fijos que van desde 15 a 20 diarios desde hace 5 años.
En el futuro su meta es comprarse un taxi y retirarse del negocio.
texts.en:
In the photo you can see Mrs. G., the wife of the client. She is 50 years old and lives in Paraiso de la flor, a zone on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has a business that offers washing, ironing and dry-cleaning of clothes. She works from 8 in the morning to 7 at night but one of her three washing machines is broken. With this loan she hopes to get a new machine which costs $550. She charges $.90 for every 12 pieces of clothing and attends to her permanent customers who have been coming to her every 15 or 20 days for the past 5 years. In the future her goal is to buy a taxi and retire from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a washing machine

loans.name: Cruz Mayita

texts.es:
Cruz Mayita Peñafiel forma parte del Banco Comunal Los Claveles que se reúnen en Portoviejo, Provincia de Manabí, aquí encontramos mujeres de diferentes edades juntas han  formado una gran confraternidad  y se apoyan para  que todas las socias  queden bien con los pagos a la Fundación Espoir.

Conversar con la señora Cruz fue muy agradable, ella está dedicada al comercio desde hace ocho  años  tiene un negocio de comida rápida  en un área recreativa  y muy concurrida  por grandes y chicos en la ciudad de Portoviejo;  Cruz se ha enfrentado a grandes desafíos en la vida pero ha logrado cosas buenas, todas las mañana se despierta muy optimista con el objetivo que le va ir bien en su negocio. Nuestra socia está casada desde hace algunos años y cuenta con el cariño de sus 9 hijos, el esposo se dedica a otra actividad pero le  acompaña y ayuda en el negocio.
 
La jornada empieza desde muy temprano en casa de Cruz  pues tiene que preparar los alimentos para tener todo listo  a las  cuatro e instalarse en su carreta  para atender a los clientes que llegan al lugar a saborear sus delicias como son las  empanadas y corviches elaborados a  base de verde, queso y pollo,  ella no descansa hasta terminar con todo lo preparado para esa tarde y noche por lo que regresa a su hogar a partir de las 8 de la noche. Este negocio es la pasión de Cruz no ha pensado cambiarlo y muchos menos dejarlo, con el ha logrado  dar estudio y estabilidad a su familia.

En esta ocasión Cruz está solicitando un crédito con el que va a  comprar sillas, mesas y productos como queso, plátanos y más para la elaboración de sus delicias.
texts.en:
Cruz Mayita Peñafiel is part of the communal bank, Los Clavelas, that meets in Portoviejo, Manabí Province. Here, we find women of all ages who together have formed a sisterhood and support network so that all the members meet their payments to the Fundación Espoir.

Speaking with Cruz was very pleasant. She has worked for eight years in a business selling fast food in a recreational area that is popular for both old and young in the city of Portoviejo. Cruz has met with great obstacles in her life, but has achieved good things. Every morning, she wakes up optimistic with the motivation to do well with her business. Our member has been married for many years and provides care for her 9 children. Her husband works in another job, but he helps with the business.

The day starts very early in Cruz’s house. She has to prepare the meals to have everything ready at four and prepare her cart to attend to customers who come there to savor her delicious foods such as empanadas and corviches made with green plantains, cheese and chicken. She doesn’t rest until she has finished all the preparation for the afternoon and night, when she returns home after 8pm. This business is Cruz’s passion. She has never considered changing it or leaving it. That which she earns gives her family stability and pays their studies.

Today, Cruz is asking for a loan with which she will buy chairs, tables and products such as cheese, plantains, and more to make her delicious offerings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables and products such as cheese, plantains, and more ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita G. is from the village of Cugman, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old.  Mercelita is married and has seven children. To make a living, Mercelita owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Mercelita has been involved in her business for over one year and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mercelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 
--------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Cugman, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 24 años es una joven muy alegre y sincera, vive en la casa de su madrina y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.Empieza a trabajar visitando a sus clientes en sus mismas casas, así realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza, es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con la ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En su barrio es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar, por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen dinero  para pagarle, pero ella siempre se las arregla para que le paguen el dinero  completo de  todas sus ventas. Para el futuro  espera aperturar  su tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender con  comodidad y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa.Este es su  primer préstamo con  MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otros préstamos, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos, para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Diana is a happy and sincere 24 year-old lady. She lives in the godmother's house and it is her dream to create a good future. She started to work visiting her customers at home selling beauty products. She is a very persistent and convincing saleslady, reason why she finishes her cosmetics sales rapidly. She is well-known in her neighborhood and people know that her products are excellent. What she likes the most about her work is to give advice to her customers about what fits their faces the best. She has been doing this for the past 2 years and the most difficult part for her is collecting as her clients not always have the money to pay, but she always manages so she receives all the money for her sales. For the future she wishes to open a cosmetics store where she can sell comfortably and without having to go from door to door. This is her first loan with MFP, she wants to make her business grow therefore she plans to repay punctually in order to have access to other loans. She knows that she can count on the support of her community bank. With the eight hundred soles requested, she will buy more cosmetics to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn M., 29, is married and has one child living at home to support. She lives in Takeo province. Lorn is a professional tailor, making $2 USD each day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses, and makes approximately $2.50 USD per day. Lorn M. would like a loan of $700 USD for her husband to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Termitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal TERMITAS está conformado por 10 clientes, 7 mujeres y tres varones, el 70% D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana, que están ubicados antes D. llegar a la zona Valle Hermoso  y también por el Hospital San Gabriel, el 30% las socias viven por Escobar Uría, a tres cuadras D. la parada del microbús D. la línea 15. se dedican a la venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, cosméticos, costura D. ropa y otros, pese a tener actividades muy distintas se conocen muy bien entre sí asistieron a todas las charlas y escucharon con atención porque la mayoría ingreso por primera vez a un banco comunal.

La Sra. Lourdes Representa a su banco en  el cargo D. Presidenta del banco se dedica a la costura D. ropa, edredones, cubrecamas, en su propio taller D. la ciudad D. El A. cerca D. la avenida cívica, cuenta con esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. insumos (tela por rollo, esponja, algodón, store). Vive en la zona Escobar Uría con sus familiares, no tiene esposo, es madre soltera y ella sola mantiene el hogar.
 
Ha sido elegida por su gran capacidad D. manejo D. personas y D. conocer a todas sus compañeras, responsable y dinámica desD. el inicio en las capacitaciones brindando su apoyo a todas sus compañeras coordinando en la conformación del banco 

La Sra. Maria Socia que asume el cargo D. Tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. comida y refrescos  a pedidos para las instituciones públicas y privadas se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años en su propio domicilio el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. víveres por mayor  para sus pedidos. Casada con el señor Javier que trabaja D. Medico General en el hospital Holandés  D. la ciudad D. El A., tiene 2 hijos.
 
El Sr. Hernando, Ha sido elegido como Secretario, por su desenvolvimiento en las relaciones públicas dentro y fuera del grupo, dinámico para la redacción y coordinación, es chofer D. Radio taxi (propietario)en empresa "GOLD" D. la zona Tembladerani, también se dedica al negocio D. alquiler  D. Radios D. Comunicación, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. equipos D. Comunicación(radios y otros). Casado con la señora Sidney que es una ama D. casa y atienD. a sus dos hijos menores D. 12 años.

Todos los socios son personas responsables y trabajadoras, el destino del credito lo utilizaran para el incremento D. capital D. trabajo y compra D. mercaderia.

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank, TERMITAS, is maD. up of 10 clients: 7 women and 3 women. 70% of the members live in the zone of Villa Copacabana, which is located in an area before arriving in the zone of Valle Hermoso and also near the San Gabriel Hospital. The other 30% of the members live around Escobar Uria, three blocks away from the line 15 bus stop. They make a living by selling food, clothing, and cosmetics, and sewing clothing, among other things. Despite performing different activities, they know each other very well and attend all of the meetings, listening with great attention because the majority have joined a communal bank for the first time. Lourdes represents her bank as its president. She makes a living by sewing clothing, comforters, and bedspreads in her own workshop in the city of El A., near Civic Ave. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years. This loan will be used for the purchase of supplies, such as rolls of fabric, sponges, and cotton. She lives in the zone Escobar Uria with her family. She does not have a husband, is a single mother, and maintains her home by herself. She was elected because of her great capacity for managing people and getting to know all of her partners. Responsible and dynamic since the start of training, she has been providing her support to all of the members that make up the bank. Maria occupies the position of the bank's treasurer. She makes a living by selling food and drinks by request for public and private institutions. She has been doing this activity for 5 years in her own home. This loan will be used for the purchase of wholesale supplies for her orders. She is married to Javier, who works as a primary care physician in the hospital Holandes, in the city of El A.. The couple has two children together. Hernando was elected secretary of the bank for his development in public relations, within and outsiD. of the group. Also, he is dynamic in writing and coordinating. He is the chaffeur of Radio taxi for the company "Gold" in the zone Tembladerani. Additionally, he earns money renting out two-way radios. He will use this loan to purchase communication equipment (radios and others). He is married to Sidney, who is a housewife and takes care of their two 12-year-old children. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people and will use this credit to increase their working capital and for the purchase of merchandise. They are very grateful for Emprender and Kiva, for providing them confidence through this loan grant.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 44 años, vive en su casa propia con la compañera de su vida, Marcela de 34 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos: Lidia, Michael, Mariela, Gilberto y Dalicio.

Desde hace 10 años, junto a su esposa y sus hijos cultiva achote, frutas cítricas, café, plátanos, palta y piña en sus terrenos propios. Esta actividad es muy rentable porque les permite hacer crecer sus bienes al tener varias casas y chacras. Él quiere ser un buen ejemplo para sus hijos y vecinos: “yo quiero que mis vecinos digan, toda esa cosecha, esa cantidad de terreno tiene Elvin, cómo si antes no tenía nada, mira cómo a crecido y sigue creciendo, nosotros también trabajemos para tener como él, así quiero que hablen” manifiesta.

Adicionalmente, tiene un vivero donde cultiva plantas de café, tanto para sus chacras como para la venta, por lo que obtiene ingresos extras.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre se compromete a ser puntual en cada pago, pues de alguna manera quiere agradecer a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de crecer económicamente, además le gusta trabajar en su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar 200 plantas de frutas cítricas (naranjas, mandarinas) y decenas de injerto de palta.
texts.en:
Elvin is 44, and he lives in his own house with his 34 year old life partner, Marcela. They have 5 children: Lidia, Michael, Mariela, Gilberto and Dalicio. For 10 years, together with his wife and children, he has been growing “achote” (annato, a spice), citrus fruits, coffee, bananas, avocados, and pineapples on their own land. This activity is very profitable because it allows him to make his assets grow to have various houses and farms. He wants to be a good example for his children and neighbors. “I want my neighbors to say, ‘All of this harvest, all of the land the Elvin has, when before he had nothing. Look how he has grown and keeps growing. We also are working to have what he does.’ That is how I want them to talk,” he says. Additionally, he has a nursery where he grows coffee plants for his farms and for sale. This gives him extra income. This is his fourth loan with MFP. As always, he promises to be punctual with every payment. He wants to somehow thank the people who give him the opportunity to grow economically. He likes working in his communal bank. He will use the 2,000 PEN that he is now requesting to buy 200 citrus fruit plants (oranges and tangerines) and dozens of avocado grafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy citrus plants and avocados

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Mrs. Nourn P. is a villager who lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Trork Ou, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, her husband sells fish, and owns a motorbike to transport the fish to sell and earn a living. Since her husband's business is doing well, she wants to expand it.
 
Mrs. Nourn P. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy more fish to resell. With this loan she hopes to earn additional income, so she can improve the living conditions of her family. Mrs. Nourn P. is a mother of three children, one of whom supports the parent's businesses, another one is a student in the local school, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is from the village of Goin, Liloy. She is 55 years old. Juliana is married and has 8 school-aged children.  Juliana owns & operates a clothing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from providing new clothing services to local community members. Juliana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Juliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Juliana has successfully repaid her first loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Juliana is requesting a second loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Faiba

texts.en:
Faiba sells jewelry to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for more than ten years now. With this trade she assists her husband in running the home in areas like feeding, clothing and buying school books for the children.

Faiba needs additional capital to invest in her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 140,000 to enable her to purchase jewelry in bulk. This will enable her to meet the demand of her customers.

39-year-old Faiba is married and has five children; her youngest child is 8 years old and is doing fine. She says thank you to lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cement

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos A. Mena  es un señor de 36 años de edad la cual vive con su hijo  en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.
	 
Desde muy joven don Carlos se ha dedicado a la ganadería, de esta forma ha mantenido a su familia. Comenta que tiene ya muchos años de estar en este proyecto por lo que ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda y la instrucción adecuada. Dice que se siente muy orgulloso ya que ha visto como poco a poco ha salido adelante.  

Don Carlos desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢654,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro mil colones) para comprar más terneros y poder hacer crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso y  así poder ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y ofrecerle a sus padres quienes se encuentran ya muy ancianos las mejores condiciones de vida

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Esta muy agradecido con las personas que hacen posible este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Carlos A. Mena, 36, lives with his son in a community called Hernández which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is notable for being a mountainous area with vast scenery; it is quite humid and is situated along the highway that runs very close to the country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are cattle-raising and farming, specifically basic grains, tubers and oranges. Carlos has raised cattle since he was a young man; this is how he has supported his family. He has been in this project for several years now so he has learned everything about the care it needs and he’s had all the adequate training. He says that he is very proud because he has witnessed his gradual progress. Carlos would like a 654.000 colon loan to buy more calves so that his business may grow because he wants to be a successful micro entreprneur in order to help his family get ahead and provide his parents, who are of very advanced age, with better living conditions. Carlos is a member of the “Unidos por un Desarrollo” (United for Development) communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 1st loan and he hopes to grow both personally and economically with it. He is very grateful to the people who make this type of project possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For double purpose cattle.

loans.name: Juana Lissette

texts.es: Juana Lissette tiene 39 años, su actividad económica es una abarrotería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar el sustento diario a su familia, ella ha sido una madre responsable y disfruta realizando su trabajo, ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran todos están menores de edad. Inicia sus labores desde las 8 Am hasta las 6 Pm pues también asiste a un colegio para ofrecer sus productos a menores de edad que asisten a este centro. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, bolsas, pan, galletas y gaseosas. Sueña con tener un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and has been running a small grocery store for more than eight years. She has always worked to provide for her family and is a responsible mother who enjoys her work. She has three young children. She begins work at 8:00 am and works until 6:00 pm. She also helps out at a school in order to be able to offer her products to young children who also help. She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory items, such as sweets, bags, bread, cookies, and soft drinks. Someday she would like a lot on which to have a home built.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Née en 1979, A. Delphine est mariée à AGBOGBE Evarice et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Delphine  vit avec sa famille au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Delphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis près de douze ans. A côté de cette activité, Delphine vend des tissus et divers autres produits dans son atelier situé à son domicile. Delphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Delphine a déjà obtenu deux prêts à ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Delphine désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et compléter le stock de ses produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus. C'et donc pour une satisfaction de sa clientèle et un accroissement de son revenu que Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Delphine A., who was born in 1979, is married to Evarice Agbogbe, and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Along with her family, Delphine has lived in the Fidjrossè area of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, for the last 10 years or so. Together, the couple meet the various needs of the family. Delphine did not go to school, but she learnt how to sew. She has been a seamstress for almost twelve years. In addition to this activity, she sells fabric and various other items in her workshop which is located in her home. Delphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has already obtained two loans from ALIDé and has fully repaid both of them. Delphine wants to increase her working capitol and add to her inventory, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and to increase her revenue. She is asking for a third loan in order to satisfy her customers and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and boxes of thread

loans.name: Julia Mariana

texts.es:
Julia de 52 años, , vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un restaurante a lado de su casa, comenzó a trabajar con alimentos desde los 18 años. 

Ella tiene un restaurante con varias mesas y sillas, pero le costo mucho tiempo tenerlo asi, desde los 18 años empezo a vender "chuzos" (palillos de carne), con esfuerzo y dedicacion pudo obtener dinero para poner un pequeño puesto de comida, ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 11h00am y los fines de semana desde la mañana hasta las 22h00pm. Sus dos hijos le ayudan a cocinar y repartir la comida. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, granos para su restaurante ya que necesita mas viveres para poder hacer mas comidas, en el futuro quiere expandir su negocio y poder repartir a empresas sus comidas.
texts.en:
Julia is 52 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (where informal vendors live). She has a restaurant alongside her house where she began to serve meals 18 years ago. Julia's restaurant has some tables and chairs but it took her a long time to make it so. Eighteen years ago, she began serving “chuzos” (strips of meat on a stick). With effort and dedication, she earned enough money to put together a small post to serve meals. Now she works from 7:00am until 11:00am, then on weekends, from morning until 10:00pm. Her 2 children help her cook and serve the meals. With this loan she wants to buy rice and grain for her restaurant, since she needs more basic ingredients to be able to prepare more meals. In the future, she wants to expand her business and be able to supply meals for enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bUYING RICE AND GRAINS TO PREPARE MEALS TO SELL

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Herminda tiene 40 de edad, reside en el municipio de San Rafael de Oriente, Departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija, ella vende tortillas de maíz.
El negocio de venta de tortilla lo inicio hace 9 años, por la necesidad económica después que falleció el compañero de vida, trabaja todos los días de 8:00am- 4:00pm, ella esta solicitando un préstamo para compra de maíz, cal, gas, esto le permitirá con la continuidad del negocio y mejorar los ingresos.
Las aspiraciones son mantener el negocio para generar ingresos, cubrir los gastos económicos de la familia.
texts.en:
Herminda is forty years old and lives in the municipality of San Rafael de Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and lives with her only daughter. She sells corn tortillas. She has been selling tortillas for the past nine years. She needed to do this to support herself after her life partner died. She works each day from 8:00am until 4:00pm. She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn, lime and cooking fuel. This will allow her to continue with her business and improve her earnings. In the future she hopes to maintain her business in order to have an income to use to cover the economic expenses of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, lime and cooking fuel.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mary Love

texts.en:
Mary Love P. is from the city of San Roque, Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old. Mary Love is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Mary Love owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport, "habal-habal", services. Mary Love has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mary Love joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Love is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mary Love from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Leyla Mercedes

texts.es: Leyla Mercedes tiene 60 años, su actividad es una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues ha demostrado ser una excelente cliente. Ella ofrece productos como sal, azúcar, aceite, jabón y refrescos, hace mas de 6 años que tiene este negocio, inicio con un carretón en el que proporcionaba la venta de chancho con yuca y lo realizaba en las calles razón por la que su hija le propone instalar una pulpería en su casa y así nace el establecimiento. Ahora el financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Leyla Mercedes is 60 years old. She runs a "pulpería" [a small grocery store] located in her house. She has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time, so she has demonstrated that she is an excellent client. At her store, she offers products like salt, sugar, oil, soap, and soft drinks. She has had her business for more than six years. She started with selling pork and yucca from a street cart, and when her daughter suggested that she open a pulpería in her house, her store was born. This loan is to buy a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her small grocery store

loans.name: Joan Cheongetich

texts.en:
Joan has been selling fish in Naivasha town for the last five years. She is 49 years old and married to Michael Ndirangu. They have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more fish to sell.

Joan operates a food stall on the side. In the future, she plans to expand it so that it can cater to many people.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Cruz Seisy

texts.es: Cruz Seisy F. D. A. D. 61 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. platillos típicos tales como: yuca frita, tamales D. elote, pupusas y otros más. Así mismo cada mediodía ella elabora tortillas las cuales comercializa con sus vecinos. La señora Cruz vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Debido a que la casa D. cruz, lugar en el cual se encuentra su negocio, está cerca del Instituto Salvadores D. Seguro Social D. la colonia Atlacatl, ella posee muy buenas ventas ya que cada tarD. muchos D. los empleados y pacientes D. dicho hospital consumen D. los platillos típicos que ella elabora, lo que incentiva a Cruz a seguir adelante con sus ventas. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar: arroz, frijoles, maíz, algunas verduras y otros productos más, así mismo desea comprar cilindros D. gas propano para contar con una pequeña provisión.
texts.en: Cruz Seisy F. D. A. is 61 years old and sells traditional dishes such as fried yucca, corn tamales, pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and more.  She also makes tortillas at midday which she sells to her neighbors.  Sra. Cruz lives with her husband and three children who are in school.  Because her home, which is also the place her business is located, is close to the Institute of Social Security of the Atlacatl colony, she has very good sales and every evening many of the employees and patients in the hospital consume the traditional dishes that she makes, which incentivizes Cruz to continue pursuing her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, corn, some vegetables, and other products.  She also wants to buy propane gas cylinders to have a small supply available.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food preparation.

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es:
Francisco Fernando B. C.  tiene 29 años. Es casado  vive con los hojas y la esposa, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Francisco pertenece a la Ventanilla Dole ubicada en el recinto del mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría al cultivo de banano esta ventanilla tiene 16 miembros.

Francisco trabaja en la agricultura siembra banano en una hacienda que arrienda,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener una casa para los hijos.
Le gusta trabajar y caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Francisco Fernando B. C. is 29 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife in Cantón de Ventanas in the Los Ríos province. He has three children.

Francisco belongs to the Dole community bank located in the district with the same name and belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo. It is a group that works with fast-growing crops, and the majority of them work with bananas. This group has 16 members.

Francisco works in agriculture growing bananas on rented land. He does his shopping in Guayaquil and sells from his home and at the Ventanas market.

He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to expand his business. The loan will help him economically with purchasing what he needs. His dream is to have a house for his children. He likes to work and go walking with his family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand his business

loans.name: Mujeres Del Universo Sf Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Mujeres del Universo SF. Está ubicado en San Martin Texmelucan en el Estado D. Puebla  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Anabel S.R es la presidente del grupo. Tiene 45 años, no estudio pero tiene su negocio D. venta D. ganado.  Ella se dedica a comprar y acabar D. criar borregos, vacas y chivos, los venD. en diferentes poblaciones desD. hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para compra D. otros borregos y alimento. Sus clientes son el público en general.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada con muchas ganas D. sobresalir. Quiere este crédito para la compra D. alimento y otros borregos ya que debe D. tener en buen estado a sus animales para ofrecer ganado D. calidad.
texts.en: This group is called Mujeres del Universo SF. It's located in San Martin Texmelucan in the state of Puebla. The group consists of 10 members. Anabel S.R. is the president of the group. She is 45 years old and has no education, but has a business selling livestock. She works buying and raising sheep, cows, and goats. She has sold them in various areas for 15 years. She is seeking this loan to purchase more sheep and food. Her clients are the general public. In applying for this loan she feels very enthusiastic and is eager to succeed. She wants to buy sheep and food because she needs to have animals in good condition in order to sell high quality livestock.

loans.use: Purchase sheep and food

loans.name: Esther Marujita

texts.es:
Esther de 45 años, vende comida en la tarde, vive con su esposo e hijo en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

Empezó ha vender comida para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su día de trabajo comienza en la mañana cuando comprar todos los víveres para preparar la comida, después de tener todo listo inicia la preparación de los platos en primer lugar la sopa, después el segundo que es el palto fuerte y el jugo. A partir de las 12h00 comienza a vender a $ 1.60 c/u. Poco a poco ha variado los platos para sus clientes con ayuda de su hijo. La comida la realiza en la cocina de su casa y la vende en la parte delantera donde tienes mesas y sillas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas para readecuar su casa para tener más espacio para el negocio. En el futuro quiere darle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Esther is 45 and lives with her husband and child in Suburbio de Guayaquil, she sells food in the afternoons. The area is notable for the fact that a majority of its residents are merchants. She began selling food as a way to help her husband with household expenses. 

Her workday begins in the morning when she buys the ingredients to prepare the food. After gathering everything she begins by making soup, then the main course and juice. Starting at noon she sells these for $ 1.60 each. Little by little and with her son's help she has varied the menu. She prepares the food in her home's kitchen and sells it in the front of the house where she has tables and chairs. 

With this loan she wants to buy cement and paint to remodel the home to make more space for the business. She hopes to give her son a better future going forward.

loans.use: Cement, paint

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar B. is from the village of San Jose. He is 49 years old. Oscar is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Oscar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

Oscar is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
Marysol tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona situada en la región Piura a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para solventar la economía de su hogar.

Marysol desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marysol is 48 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Marysol has a small grocery store in her home.  She offers her customers essentials and groceries.  Her customers prefer her business because she always offers quality products and provides a good service.  Her business helps her household financially.

Marysol would like to expand her business, acquiring more products so that she can satisfy her customers' demands.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her grocery store which is located in her home

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegra en compañía de ella, su esposa y su pequeño hijo; juntos buscan que progresar cada día. Este laborioso  hombre se desempeña como chofer de un vehiculo de  transporte publico, desde hace 3 años. Trabaja todos los días, durante las mañanas y obtiene regulares ganancias por este trabajo que considera algo arriesgado por los constantes accidentes de transito que hay en la ciudad. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se desempeña en la tienda de venta de comestibles que tiene su suegra en su casa; le ayuda durante 3 veces a la semana, sobretodo en las noches que debe cargar cajas de cerveza. Lo que no le gusta de esta actividad es que muchas veces no puede salir por no descuidar el negocio familiar; pero esta muy satisfecho con las considerables ganancias. Como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar su propio negocio de venta de comestibles. Es el  octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiete quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Wilder tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de comestibles que necesita para surtir mejor su tienda, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilder is 32 years old. He lives in his mother-in-law's house along with her, his wife and young son. Together they strive to make daily progress. Wilder has worked very hard for three years as a public transportation driver. He works every day in the morning and earns a steady income doing what he considers a dangerous job due to the constant traffic accidents that occur in the city.  In conjunction with his job in public transportation, he also works three nights a week in a grocery store that is attached to his mother-in-law's house where he mainly stocks crates of beer. What he does not like about this job is that it prevents him from going out, as he cannot neglect the family's business. However, he is very content with the considerable earnings. Being a very enterprising man, in the future Wilder plans to open his own grocery store. This is his eighth loan through MFP and he is committed to making the payments on time so as to not jeopardize the trust of those who made possible the loan that will allow him to continue working and progressing.  Wilder plans to use the requested loan to purchase the necessary amount of groceries to better stock his store. In this way he hopes to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase goods to stock his store.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena P. is from the village of San Antonio. She is 45 years old. Nena is married and has 5 school age children. To make a living, Nena operates a food sector business where she sells a variety of different kinds of fresh fish in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,500 PHP from PMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & be used towards working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Nena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Madrilyn

texts.en: Madrilyn V. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 50 years old. Madrilyn is married. To make a living, Madrilyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Madrilyn works hard to help improve her family's living conditions. Madrilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madrilyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Madrilyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social-performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also offers savings, insurance, and training programs that are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is a widow from Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has four children. For the past 10 years, she has been selling soap as a way to support her family. She wishes to expand her business with her loan. The money will be used to purchase more soap for sale and also to diversify her product range. Her added earnings will be reinvested in her business for further growth in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more soap

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es: Alejandro 41 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es el servicio de moto taxi, Don Alejandro inicio este negocio como chofer a un amigo, pero con el paso del tiempo Alejandro logro obtener unos ahorros y con un financiamiento pudo comprarse su propio moto taxi. Actualmente el ofrece sus servicios en su propio moto taxi, la mayoría de sus clientes no se quejan de Alejandro. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos y pintarla.  El sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 41 years old and has one dependent child.  He has worked a long time with Fundación Leon 2000.  His business involves providing motorcycle taxi services.  Don Alejandro started in this business by working as driver for a friend.  As time passed, he acquired some savings which he used, along with a loan, to buy his own motorcycle taxi.  He currently provides his service through the use of his own vehicle.  Most of his customers have no complaints.

The reason for this loan is to buy parts and paint his vehicle. Alejandro dreams of improving his home.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy spare parts & have his vehicle painted

loans.name: Angelina's Group

texts.en:
Angelina A. is from the village of Esperanza West. She is 58 years old and the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Angelina A.'s Group.

Angelina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $114 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Angelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Los Arcoiris De Atoto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Los Arcoiris de Atoto" debido a que en las epocas de lluvia en ese municipio se pueden apreciar perfectamente varios arcoiris de distintos tamaños al mismo tiempo. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. La señora Rocio C. tiene 43 años, estudio hasta la universidad, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres. Ella se dedica a un negocio de lavanderia que inicio desde hace 6 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en productos como shampoo, detergente, suavitel, bolsa etc. para su negocio de lavanderia. Al solicitar este prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al credito piensa establecer su lavanderia en un local independiente a su casa por la gran demanda que tiene gracias al servicio que ofrece y sus precios accesibles, sus clientes la recomiendan ampliamente por su buena atención y magnifico trabajo. La señora también espera ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida y seguirles brindando educación a sus hijas con las ganancias que obtenga para que logren cumplir sus sueños y una vida más estable. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien en la foto se llama Anabel C. y Veronica R.
texts.en:
This goup is called "Los Arcoiris de Atoto" (Atoto Rainbows) because in the rainy season several rainbows are perfectly visible at the same time in this town in Hidalgo, Mexico.  The group is comprised of 11 members.  Mrs. Rocio C. is 43 years old and has a college education.  She is a merchant and has two adult daughters.  She has a laundromat that she set up six years ago for which she is requesting a loan to buy laundromat supplies such as detergent, softener, bags, etc.  

She is very excited about the loan because it will allow her move her business from her home to an independent location.  There is a great demand for her services because she offers good prices.  Her customers recommend her services because of her attentiveness and wonderful work.

With her earnings she plans to offer her daughters a better lifestyle and education so they can realize their dreams and have a stable livelihood.

N.B.  The people barely seen in the photo are Anabel C. and Veronica R.

loans.use: To buy laundromat supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new carpet weaving frame and other equipments for her business

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen members. Mrs. Nan married woman was born in 1972 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Her husband, Mr. Ngin, who was born in 1964, works as construction worker. He can earn a small salary to help support his family. They have a child who is 3 years old.

Mrs. Nan is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and different vegetables. In order to improve her rice and vegetable field, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a water machine for supporting her farming crops.

loans.use: To buy a water machine for growing crops.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela G. comes from the village of Patriketi, Imereti Region. She is 29 years old, unmarried and lives with her parents and 25-year-old brother. 

Lela’s family earns a living with agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse, where greens and vegetables are grown. In the period of October-May the greenhouse is full of fresh greens. The end-product is sold to exporters of greens, who export to neighboring countries. In June-September the greenhouse is used for cucumber- and tomato-growing. Harvested vegetables are sold on the local open market by Lela. 

Also the family has put up an iron construction for a second greenhouse. With the requested credit Lela plans to purchase polyethylene materials to cover the construction and make it ready for the vegetable growing season. The other part of the loan will be used for purchasing fertilizers. 

When the second greenhouse is functional, the income of the family, which today amounts to 700 Laris per month, will double. This will allow them to improve their living conditions and also reinvest in the future for further development of the farm.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene materials for a greenhouse.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is 35 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 15 while the youngest is only 2. Sharon Rose's husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Sharon Rose is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Sharon Rose works hard to do her part in sustaining her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. Sharon Rose wants to earn more and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Dominga Concepción

texts.es: Dominga Concepción D. treinta años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hijo quien asiste a la escuela. Ella posee una  venta D. ropa y cosméticos en el lugar D. su residencia; últimamente su negocio ha sido más visitado por las  personas del lugar pues Dominga ofrece un servicio excelente y su mercadería la venD. a un buen precio, es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo y piensa que su motivación D. salir adelante es la que la impulsa a sobresalir; ella quiere mantenerse a la cabeza D. su competencia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar más mercadería ropa para dama y caballero, cosméticos y perfumes. Dominga tiene la esperanza que su trabajo le dará grandes frutos que le permitirán darle a su familia una vida plena con seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Dominga Concepcíon is thirty years old and lives with her life companion and her child who goes to school. She sells clothes and cosmetics from her home. Her neighbors frequently visit her business as she offers excellent service and sells the merchandise for a good price. She is devoted to her work and her desire to progress pushes her to succeed. 
In order to keep up with the competition she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will proviD. her with the opportunity to buy women’s and men’s clothes, cosmetics and perfumes. Dominga hopes that her work will give her great benefits such as allowing her to give her family a full life with economic security.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Solidario Restauracion Group

texts.es: Solidario Restauracion: Este Grupo esta conformado por tres señoras las cuales se dedican a la confeccion D. tejidos a mano doña Elva Marina es la lider D. este grupo tanto ella como las otras socias estan convecidas D. que nececitan mas capital para trabajar por eso estan solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos a mano.El sueño D. ellas es agrandar mas su negocio y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
'Restauracion' Solidarity Group

This group is maD. up of three ladies who weave products by hand.

Elva Marina is the leader of this group.  She and her fellow group members need more capital to work.  For this reason, they are requesting a loan to buy raw materials for hand weaving their products.  Their dream is to further expand their businesses and proviD. their children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw material for weaving

loans.name: Orlina

texts.en:
Orlina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for the repair and maintenance of her business motorcycle. Orlina has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Orlina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair and maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de 51 años es una mujer casada que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 18 y 24 en un barrio ubicado en el sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su negocio es la preparación de alimentos, especialmente de picadas, pasabocas y  deliciosos pasteles típicos de la región (amasijo en hoja de bijao a base de arroz verduras y tres tipos de carnes). Ella empezó su experiencia con la preparación de comidas rápidas para fiestas, como deditos de queso, y empanadas pequeñas en eventos especiales como primeras comuniones, cumpleaños de familiares y algunos amigos;  gradualmente fue creciendo y ahora trabaja con mayores resultados pues ha logrado una creciente clientela que planea ampliar,  inyectando un capital de trabajo proveniente de su credikiva, que es el primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará utensilios como una batidora y moldes, además de materias primas en mayor volumen para ahorrar en las compras y traducirlo en buenos precios de sus productos para su clientela. Su principal sueño es tener una casa de banquetes en un local diferente de su casa, donde todos la conozcan y logre  realizar sus eventos grupales y pueda a su vez ofrecer un servicio confortable que se replique. En la actualidad enfrenta un gran desafío que debe resolver prontamente para lograr cumplir su sueño de crecer  y es el de no tener un congelador para guardar los pasabocas,  lo hace en una nevera familiar y por eso debe preparar sus productos y venderlos rápidamente y esto le genera menos efectividad.
texts.en:
María (51 years old) is a married woman who lives with her husband and their two children, ages 18 and 24, in a neighborhood south of the city of Barranquilla.

Her business is food preparation, especially snacks, appetizers and delicious pastries which are traditional foods in this region (a mixture of rice, vegetables and three types of meat in dough, wrapped in "bijao" leaves). She began this experience by preparing fast foods for parties, like cheese straws and small empanadas for special events like First Communions and birthdays for family members and some friends. Gradually her business grew, and now she works with better results because she has a growing customer base that she plans to expand by injecting the working capital from her Kiva loan, which is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy equipment like a mixer and baking pans, as well as bigger amounts of raw materials to save on her purchases and translate those savings into good prices for her customers. María's main dream is to have a banquet hall somewhere in a different building from her house, where everyone will come to meet her and have their group events, and where she can offer comfortable service that she can replicate.

Currently she faces a great challenge that she must resolve soon in order to fulfill her dream of growing, and that challenge is that she does not have a freezer for storing appetizers. She keeps them in a family refrigerator, and because of this she must prepare and sell her products quickly, and this makes her work less effective.

loans.use: to buy equipment like a mixer and baking pans, as well as larger amounts of raw materials.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and married to Stella. They have 2 school-going children.

Charles has a retail shop that he has been running for 2 years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to add stock to his business. The anticipated profits will be used to cater to his family's needs. He hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tealeaves, cooking oil, etc. to add to his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making dishes or viands tosell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 39 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y su hijo de dos meses de nacido. Allí tiene un negocio de Papelería y miscelanea, que inició para apoyar con ingresos el bienestar de su hogar y hoy se ha convertido en su proyecto de vida. En su negocio Candelaria vende detalles para el hogar, útiles de papelería y otras mercancías.
