Su experiencia data desde el año 1996 en su antiguo barrio donde habitaba, y del que una vez posicionada, debió mudarse e instalar su negocio en un espacio de la nueva casa de su madre, donde le ha ido muy bien y ahora tiene planes de crecimiento, mediante financiamientos, como el credikiva, que es el primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará detalles para la temporada de amor amistad que se acerca y  es la época en que sus ventas repuntan todo el mes de Septiembre, por efecto de esta celebración. Candelaria vende en su negocio de contado principalmente, por eso sus cuentas por cobrar son bajas y este es el primer crédito que hace a una organización, con la cual iniciará su historial crediticio. Su sueño es tener una papelería de gran tamaño con servicios adicionales como fotocopiaje, transcripción de documentos etc; pero su gran desafío es cumplir con su sueño y por eso trabaja persistentemente con tal de alcanzar sus metas
texts.en:
Candelaria, 39, lives in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and her son, born two months ago. There she has a stationery store which she began in order to generate income to help with household expenses and that has now become her life’s work. 

In her business, Candelaria sells particulars for the home, stationary accessories and other merchandise. Her experience dates from the year 1996 in the old neighborhood she lived in and from which, once situated, she had to move to set up her business in a space in her mother’s new house. There, it has done very well. She now plans to expand through financing, such as this kiva loan, which is the first loan she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She will use the loan to buy particulars for the season of love and friendship that is approaching, which is the time when, during September, her sales begin to rise, due to the coming festivities.

Candelaria’s business sales are principally in cash, consequently her accounts receivable are low. This is her first loan request to an organization and with it she will initiate her credit history. 

Her dream is to have a large stationary store with additional services such as photocopying, document transcription, etc., but her great challenge is to fulfill her dream. For this reason, she is working persistently to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy particulars, such as home accessories, stationary and other merchandise for the coming season of love and friendship.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa was born in 1967. She lives in Luc Canh village. She has two children. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice but she sells vegetables in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has participated in SEDA. The last time, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is a 27 year-old woman and the mother of two school-age children from Baray district of Kompong Thom province.  San has run a small business as a seller for years. In front of her house, there are lots of mixed products that she sells to her customers such as canned foods, groceries, packaged food etc. From this business, she can earn around $2.7USD per day. San also relies on the income from her husband who transports firewood for selling. During the rainy season, this couple is concerned that they’ll face difficulties because they don’t have any animals for plowing their field, so they have to spend a lot of money to hire their neighbor’s animals for farming. So San is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva in order to buy a cow for plowing as well as for hauling the firewood.

loans.use: to buy a cow for plowing as well as for hauling  firewood.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used his previous loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.  With the increased stock of shoes, he was able to attract more customers to his business and earn more income.  He has grown his business and he has employed two people in his business. Joseph has requested another loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred has been  a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya for five years running, with his farming producing milk and eggs for the local markets. He is aged 36 and married with five children aged between 13 and 5 years.

Fred has made a loan request of 36,400 KES with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the cow will generate more income and enable the family to acquire more assets. He aspires to own five dairy cows of better quality and to be the main milk suppler in the area.

He says animal diseases are the main challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in  Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Jane has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, retail.

 Jane has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy rolls of clothing materials.  The main business challenges for Jane include transportation and defaulters .  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and to be a wholesaler.  

 Jane lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To  buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa, es una mujer casado de 58 años de edad, tiene  tres hijos mayores de edad,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de helados y refrescos de frutas tropicales.
Narcisa es una mujer  luchadora,  perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia.
Narcisa,  empezó su negocio en el año 2009 , gana semanalmente S/.100 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y 6 días a la semana. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Narcisa invertirá el crédito en el mejoramiento de su vivienda (  construcción de su habitación)  Su sueño de Narcisa es tener una casa mas grande  para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.

Narcisa vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 58, is married and has three grown children. She works making and selling ice cream and tropical fruit juices. She is a hardworking, persevering and responsible woman with a great desire to help her family get ahead.

Narcisa started her business in 2009 and makes PEN 100 weekly. She works about 8 hours a day, 6 days a week. With the PEN 2000 loan that she will receive thanks to Kiva, Narcisa will invest in household improvements (building a room). Her dream is to have a bigger house so that she can improve her quality of life. Her loan officer believes that she is an excellent client and will make her payments on time.

Narcisa lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Melvin Antonio

texts.es: Melvin de 28 años, labora como docente de educación Primarias en el Colegio Rafaela Herrera de Colonia La Fonseca  desde hace 7 años, donde es bien reconocido y apreciado por sus estudiantes, y por los padres de familia como un docentes de experiencia y con suficiente capacidad de brindar el pan de la enseñanza a sus educando,está solicitando su 5to credito  para invertirlo en mejoramiento de su casa de habitación repellandola para darle mayor durabilidad a las paredes y ademas mejorar la apariencia de la vivienda,  el tiene el apoyo de sus papá en los gtos del hogar,  y sus mayores sueños es darle a su familia un lugar digno y con un buen ambiente donde habiten siempre unidos y alegres como una familia estable.
texts.en: Melvin is 28 years old and has been working as an elementary school teacher in the “Colegio Rafaela Herrera” school in the La Fonseca neighborhood for the past seven years.  He’s well known and appreciated by his students and their parents, for being an experienced teacher, able to provide the bread of learning.  He is asking for his fifth loan to make some improvements to his home.  He wants to make some repairs to make the walls last longer and also to improve its appearance.  He has his father’s support for the household expenses.  His greatest dreams are to provide a dignified home and a good environment for his family, who is always united and happy as a stable family.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en: Majid, who lives in Nor Dvin village together with his wife, children and grandchildren, has been successfully managing his cattle business for 25 years.  With the help of this loan, Majid will be able to increase both his number of cattle and his income which, in turn, will improve his family's living conditions and insure a stable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Bienestar, es transportista tiene 3 combis, es socia de Finca desde hace 12 años.
A raíz de una accidente ella estaba muy desanimada y una amiga le invitó a Finca, ya pasaron 12 años y desde la fecha ella no se ha retirado, agradece mucho por todo el apoyo que le brindaron cuando mas lo necesitaba con mucho esfuerzo se pudo comprar 2 carros, y ahora trabaja con ellos, logró poder tener una buena estabilidad económica, he hizo muy buenas amiga en su banco, ella solo tiene una hija los demás son varones y con la ayuda de Finca le ayudo a poder educarla y ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en el titulo de su hija.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Bienestar” communal bank.  She provides transportation services and has three vans.  She’s been involved with FINCA for 12 years.

After an accident, she was very discouraged and her friend invited her into FINCA.  It’s been 12 years and she has not left.  She is very grateful for all the support they gave her when she most needed it.  With great effort, she was able to buy two cars and now she works with them and was able to create good financial stability.

She’s made good friends in the bank.  She only has one daughter; the rest of her children are boys.  With FINACA’s help, she was able to pay for her daughter’s education.  She will use the money from this loan to pay for her daughter’s title.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es: Marelith ,de 32 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, es casada con Hipólito quien es agricultor, vive  en compañía de su esposo y sus dos menores hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad , vive en su casa propia la cual construyó  con el apoyo de su esposo. El trabajo de Marelith, consiste en le venta de plátanos y frutas al por mayor y menor. Puesto que posee un terreno de 14 hectáreas donde siembra plátanos. Una vez cosechados son llevados a su puesto de venta en mercado de su ciudad. Tiene 04 años haciendo lo mismo, pero le valió para ser conocida en el rubro y ahora es una de las más grandes comercializadoras. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad de poder brindarles lo mejor a  sus hijos. Se siente cómoda con su actividad ya que lo conoce muy bien, pues viene dedicándose desde muy joven pues aprendió de su madre el oficio, nos comenta que tiene muchas ganas de seguir ampliando su negocio. Este será el préstamo numero 04 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe de la MFP. Por lo tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus miembros y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el préstamo solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en el mantenimiento de su terreno y la producción de plátanos que es su negocio, para ello contratará peones.
texts.en:
Marlith, 32, is an enterprising, charismatic woman who is married to Hipólito.  She is a farmer and lives with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 6, in their own house which they built together.  Marlith's work consists of selling plantain and fruit, both wholesale and retail.  She has 14 hectares of land where she grows the plantain.  She sells the produce at the market in the city.  She has been in this activity for four years and now with her experience is one of the largest merchants.  

What she enjoys about her work is that she is able to obtain an income that gives her the tranquility of knowing that she can provide her children with a better lifestyle.  She is comfortable in this business because she knows it well.  She learned the trade from her mother when she was very young.  She is determined to continue expanding.  

This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support and committed to paying back the loan on time.  She also likes her communal bank because she knows all the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive.  The 3,000 PEN loan will be used for land maintenance and plantain production, for which she must hire workers.

loans.use: To hire workers.

loans.name: Kamaladdin

texts.en:
Kamaladdin is a 54-year-old person who is engaged in agriculture. He lives with his wife and four children. He has been in his business for 13 years. When he started to work, he had 10 sheep on his farm. First he applied to VFAC for 1000 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to buy a cow and, to this day, he has finished and has 10 cows. 

Kamaladdin applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy 10 more sheep for fattening to sell at the bazaar. Kamaladdin is a hardworking and reliable person. As a result of his hard work, he has expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening to sell at the bazaar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Têko

texts.en:
Born in 1965 in Anfoin (in Lacs prefecture), Teko A. is married, the father of four children, and is responsible for one other person. As an unemployed accountant, he opened a shop selling frozen foods at the market in Adodessewa. His wife, who does not work, is unable to help him cover any family expenses. He would like to diversify by selling groceries, but he lacks the means. And so he is hoping for a loan of $1,000 to boost his business, to maximize his profit, and thus to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Têko est né en 1965 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants avec une personne à charge. Comptable en chômage, il a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits congelés au marché d’Akodésséwa. Sa femme qui n’exerce aucune activité , n’arrive pas à l’aider dans les charges de la famille. Monsieur A. Têko veut associer la vente des produits d’alimentation générale mais manque de moyens. A cet effet, il souhaite avoir un crédit de $1000 pour le renforcement de ses activités et réaliser un profit maximum pour subvenir au besoin de la famille.

loans.use: Sale of frozen foods and groceries

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.en:
Before opening his business, Guillermo worked in a restaurant where the menu offered ‘cabrito’, a dish made from young goat. While working there, he gained experience cooking cabrito which is a traditional dish in northern Mexico, especially in the area around Monterrey. Once he had mastered the technique and saw that his style of preparing the meat was popular with customers, he decided to open his own business selling cabrito. He now spends all of his time working in his business, and has been able to support his family. He has 3 children who are in school, and a wife who works with him in his business. Guillermo is requesting a $425 loan to purchase merchandise for his business. He plans to repay the loan in 6 to 12 months, and he hopes to continue to grow his business and to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo antes de iniciar su negocio, trabajaba de empleado en un restauran Que se dedicaba a la venta de cabrito y fue ahí donde adquirió experiencia para cocinar cabrito, es un plato típico del norte de México, especialmente de Monterrey. Cuando aprendió y vio que la gente gustaba mucho de su sazón, el decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de cabritos, ahora el solo se dedica a ello, y con esto a salido adelante con su familia ya que tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian y su esposa le ayuda a la venta de cabrito.

Guillermo esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 425 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y ofrece pagarlo en un período de 6 a 12 meses, espera su apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio y mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mrs Man S. is 21 and lives in Prey Veng in Cambodia. She sells vegetables and herbs at a market. She earns 15 dollars a day. Her husband is a farmer and a taxi driver. They do not have children. 
Mrs Man S. would like to purchase a car in order to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to do the same.

loans.use: To purchase a car to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida M., the mother of two children and a widow, belongs to the loan group Joyitas de Oro in Villa Tejada. She is an expert at knitting woolen articles, such as caps, shawls, and others. She has been doing this since she was 15 years old, learning the tradition from her parents and continuing the tradition. Frida takes her products to the city of Cochabamba, where she has a sure market. She also sells them on them on Garcilazo de la Vega Street in the city of La Paz, which is traditionally a commercial street, and also in the 16 de Julio Market. Since she works alone, Frida produces and sells at wholesale, at a minimum of a dozen. Frida lacks the money to increase her production, satisfy existing demand, and increase the variety of her products. She would like to do this to sell at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Frida M., madre de 2 hijos, viuda, pertenece a la asociación Joyitas de Oro en Villa Tejada, es experta en la confección de distintos tejidos en lana, como ser gorros, mantillas, chalinas y otros. Esta es una actividad que ella desarrolla desde sus 15 años de edad, aprendiendo de sus padres y continuando con la tradición. Frida lleva sus productos a la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde tiene ya un mercado asegurado, así también ofrece sus productos en la calle Garcilazu de la Vega de la ciudad de La Paz, una calle tradicionalmente comercial, y en la ciudad de El Alto vende sus productos en la famosa Feria 16 de Julio. Pese a que trabaja sola, Frida produce y vende al por mayor, minimamente por docena. Por tal motivo, Frida precisa de dinero para aumentar su producción y satisfacer la demanda existente, como también la necesidad de incrementar la variedad de sus productos, principalmente para la venta de fin de año.

loans.use: To increase production, satisfy existing demand, and increase the variety of products

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charo is a hard working and virtuous woman who works everyday to improve the quality of life of her home; and although there have been many financially difficult times as result of a robbery years ago, her optimism has helped her overcome them and start several businesses such as growing crops on her small farm and raising small farm animals to sell. All this has made her very happy as she’s been able to attain some financial stability and cover all the household necessities, thanks in part to knowledge she’s acquired since childhood. Her hard work has motivated her desire to buy more land to produce larger fruit crops. Charo has focused each and every one of her efforts towards this wish and she is conscious that with more effort and dedication she’ll make it a reality. She asks for a loan to buy more necessary products to guarantee a good harvest. With your collaboration, she’ll be able to fulfill her dreams in short order.

p>Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Charo, es una mujer esforzada y virtuosa que cada día se esfuerza por incrementar la calidad de vida de su hogar y aunque ha existido muchos momentos de carencia económica, producto de un terrible robo que sufrió hace años atrás, su optimismo la ha ayudado a superarlos realizando una serie de actividades; como el cultivo de diversos productos en su chacrita y la venta de los animalitos que cría; todo esto la ha puesto muy optimista porque ha podido lograr cierta tranquilidad económica que le permite cubrir las necesidades más necesarias de su hogar, gracias al conocimiento que fue adquiriendo desde niña. Su desempeño la ha motivado a tener un gran anhelo y es el de poder comprar mayor cantidad de tierras en el que pretende producir mayor cantidad de frutas.Doña Charo ha centrado todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos en este deseo y ella es consciente que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá hacerlo realidad; solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de más productos indispensables para una buen producción. Con vuestra importante colaboración ella podrá cumplir en poco tiempo sus anhelos.

loans.use: Injection of capital to optimize fruit production and raising of farm animals.

loans.name: Betilu

texts.es:
Betilu is 30 years old and has two small children, one is 5 years old and the other is 7. Since two years ago she has been a member of the Community Bank Azucenas. Betilu and her husband were born in Amazonas and Plura, respectively, and have come to Ayacucho 5 years ago to work. Betilu and her husband sell crockery and glassware. In the beginning they did not have much merchandise and sold as street vendors in the city of Ayacucho. They sold varied items based on seasonal demand. Currently she has a stall at the Galeria S. Rosa that she manages, her husband at times still sells on the streets. Betilu wishes to be able to rent a space that is centrally located and large to be able to have more customers.

Betilu needs a loan of 3000 soles ( approximately USD $ 1,025) that she will invest in the purchase of covered dishes, stemware, saucepans, tea pots, jars, glasses, cups, knives, mugs, porridge pots, ladles.

Betilu dreams of capitalizing her business, educating her children, owning her place of business, seeing her children become professionals and having a united family,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Betilu tiene 30 años y 2 hijos pequeños de 5 y 7 años, y es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas desde hace 2 años. Betilu y su esposo son naturales de Amazonas y Piura respectivamente y llegaron a Ayacucho hace 5 años por motivo de trabajo.

Betilu junto a su esposo vende locería y cristalería y al inicio tenían muy poca mercadería y vendían ambulatoriamente por las calles de la ciudad de Ayacucho; vendían productos variados de acuerdo a la demanda y estación. Actualmente tiene un puesto en la Galería S. Rosa que ella administra y su esposo algunas veces todavía vende por las calles. El deseo de Betilu es alquilar un local céntrico y grande, para poder tener más clientes.

Betilu necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de platos cubiertos, copas, ollas, teteras, jarras, vasos, tazas, cuchillos, tazones, mazamorreros, cucharones.

Los sueños de Betilu son capitalizar su negocio, dar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener un local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su familia sea unida.

loans.use: Betilu needs a loan of  USD $1,025 to buy inventory, such as covered dishes, stemware, saucepans, tea pots, jars, glasses, cups, knives, mugs, porridge pots, ladles

loans.name: Thi Sau

texts.vi:
Mrs. Sáu, 45 years old, singled with two children. One is working, the other is still in school. The whole family’s income is about 4USD a day. Not much for their hard work but there are always laughter in their small house. She has tried hard to bring education to her children. She used to borrow money from her siblings. All debts were paid off. She would like to apply for a loan with Binh Minh. The weekly repayments are convenient for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Sáu, 45 tuổi, không có chồng và có 2 con, 1 đã đi làm còn 1 thì còn đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của cả gia đình là 50000-70000đ/ngày. Dù cuộc sống còn vất vả nhưng trong căn nhà nhỏ bé luôn đầy ắp tiếng cười. Cô cố gắng vay mượn anh em để có tiền cho con ăn học, nay đã trả hết. Cô thích vay theo Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì hình thức trả góp hàng tuần rất thuận tiện.

loans.use: Nuôi lợn

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In L., 38, sells vegetables at the Chumpou Von market in Phnom Penh City. She earns about $4 a day and takes care of two children, one of whom is enrolled in school. The other one is just two years old. Her husband, Mr. Heang Buntheoun, drives a motorcycle taxi and earns about $2 a day.

In order to help her husband support their family, In is now asking for a loan of $500 to expand her vegetable business by increasing her inventory. She also plans to use some of the money to buy soil to fill her yard. She appreciates Kiva for their support and promises to be prompt in repaying her loan.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of vegetables to sell, and to buy soil to fill her yard

loans.name: Fatuma's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 36-years-old and is married with three children,;ages 16,12 and 7. Fatuma has been selling fish since 2003. She works from 10AM to 5PM and earns a monthly profit of $300.

Fatuma has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in cloth and soft drinks sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Redina

texts.es:
Redina has been a member of the communal bank "Azucenas" for three years. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and has two children. Redina sells footwear in the Chorro market, a job she has worked at for two years. She obtains her goods in the city of Lima. Before this, Redina sold groceries at markets, employment that she left behind because it didn't bring in enough income.

Redina needs a loan for 2000 soles ($725) which she will invest in purchasing men's and women's shoes.

Redina dreams of having a car to transport her goods to fairs and being able to send her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Redina es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas hace 3 años.

Redina es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Redina vende calzados en el mercado Chorro, actividad que realiza hace 2 meses, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima. Anteriormente Redina vendía abarrotes en las ferias, actividad que dejo de realizar porque no le generaban ganancias.

Redina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos importados de varón y mujer.

Los sueños de Redina son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos a las ferias y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase men's and women's shoes for sale in local markets.

loans.name: Nhum

texts.en: Nhum S. is an elderly widow living in Kampong Cham Province. She still farms the rice field that she and her husband used to own together. However, her labor alone barely earns her $1 per day. She has two children, both married, much to her personal joy. Her oldest, a mechanic at a high quality workshop, earns $300 per month and does much to support his elderly mother. She in turn wants to  care for him by taking out a loan to buy him high quality imported tools so he can continue to advance his career in this particular shop.

loans.use: To buy mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Senora Lidia Q. was born in the city of Ybycui in 1949. She has two grown up children, Jose and Maria Liz. Lidia has been married to her husband Anastacio Portillo for 30 years. He works as a shopkeeper.

Lidia works as a seamstress, and has been making clothing for children and adults for more than 20 years. She has been a part of the foundation since 2003, and thanks to the financial support she has been able to grow her business and invest in more materials to meet the requests of her customers.

La Sra. Lidia Q. nació en la ciudad de Ybycui en el año 1949, tiene dos hijos mayores, Jose y María Liz de 31 y 33 años respectivamente, esta casada con Anastacio Portillo, desde hace 30 años, quien es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la confección de ropas para pequeños y adultos desde hace más de 20 años. Opera con la Fundación desde el año 2003, gracias a la financiación pudo adquirir solidez en su emprendimiento y adquirió mayor cantidad de insumos para abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FABRICS AND ACCESSORIES FOR THE CLOTHING SHE MAKES, AS WELL AS REPAIR ONE OF HER SEWING MACHINES.

loans.name: Mariam's Wastara Group

texts.en:
21-year-old Mariam has been selling clothes (khanga & vitenge) and perfumes since 2007. She earns a monthly profit of $135 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga & vitenge) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Mashavu, who also has a business selling snacks, shoes and perfume.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her  stock.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel N. sells bags of sugar, bags of rice and gallon jugs of palm oil. She has been in this business since 2006.

Rachel lives in Okoko, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is 47-years-old and married with six children. She is requesting this current loan amount of $875 to purchase more bags of sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 47, is married and has seven children between the ages of 3 and 30. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1991. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making batik clothing

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem K. is 51 years old and married and lives in Prey Kla Thboung village in TaK. Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hun Kimchorn, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. They have four children who all work, three in a garment factory.

Because their house is so old, Mrs. Koem K. is asking for a loan to buy timbers to rebuild it.

loans.use: To buy timbers to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La profesora Ana Maria, soltera, con 2 hijos en union de hecho con el Sr. Efrain Laguna, sus hijos son estudiantes de secundaria, ella trabaja en el Instituto San Juan Bautista de Cuapa, con 21 años de servicio, esta solicitando su 10mo credito el que utilizara para la compra de terneros pues su comprañero tiene una finquita y le ayudara con el cuido de sus animales, estos animales son parte del patrimonio que desea dejarle a sus hijos en el futuro.   Durante sus creditos anteriores ha cancelado antes de la fecha esablecida, pues es una persona con mucha responsabilidad y esta catalogada como clienta con categoria "A".  Manifesto que confia cen AFODENIC ya que desde su inicio esta trabajando con sus creditos y siempre ha recibido excelente trato.  Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando para llegar a ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Professor Ana Maria is lives with her partner, Mr. Efrain Laguna, and their two children. Ana Maria's children are in high school, and she works at the San Juan Bautista de Cuapa Institute. Ana Maria has been working there for 21 years and now she's asking for a 10 month loan, which she'll use to buy calves. One of her colleagues has a small farm and Ana Maria helps care for the animals. She'd like to leave these animals for her children to inherit. Ana Maria has repaid her past loans in advance of the due dates, and she is very responsible. She is a category "A" client. Ana Maria says that she is confident in AFODENIC, and she has been working with the institution since it began, and has always received excellent service. Her greatest dream is that her children can keep studying and become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy calves

loans.name: Dilber

texts.en: Dilber Q. is 42 years old, she is single, and she is the only one who cares for her parents. Since her youth Dilber has been breeding calves. She learned it from her parents who are farmers but now are very old and need care. Dilber's dream is to become the owner of a big farm. Now Dilber wants to expand her business, and as her parents are getting older, she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle and provide for her parents better. She is requesting 1200 dollars for the term of 15 months in order to purchase more cattle. Dilber expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan pn time.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Usawa Group

texts.en:
Tatu S., age 46, is married with six children who age between 14 to 27. She also cares for four dependents of different relatives.  She sells concrete at Kisopwa. She started this business in 2000 and works daily from 8am until 5pm. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $45. 

This will be Tatu’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business by buying more supplies of stones and has repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for a seventh loan to increase her capital to buy more concrete and pay school fees. 
\t
Tatu will share this loan with her loan group, Usawa, which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Tatu is 1st on the left, second row..

loans.use: To buy more concrete

loans.name: Alvaro José

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León, el señor Alvaro C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras siendo su especialidad la venta de tomates el cual posee en su propio establecimiento que a pesar que no posee las condiciones necesarias por estar a la intemperie ha logrado salir adelante poniendo una sombría para cubrirse del sol y asi aprovechar sus ventas.

La razón por la cual el señor Alvaro ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio es gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado un total de 14 créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar satisfactoriamente. Hoy en día solicita el crédito para la compra de los tomates y de esta forma continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
In The Terminal Market, in the city of Leon, Nicaragua, Mr. Alvaro C. sells vegetables. His specialty is the sale of tomatoes. He has been successful with this, in spite of the fact that the selling conditions are not optimal. He has set up some shade to protect the merchandise from the sun, and this has helped him with his sales. One of the main factors in his success is the support he has received from the Ceprodel agency, which up until now has made him 14 loans, all of which have been repaid successfully. He now is requesting an additional working capital loan, to allow him to buy more tomatoes wholesale and thus continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Pablo Emilio

texts.es: El señor Pablo Emilio A. M., tiene la edad de 22 años habita en San José de los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su padres, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que el le apoya a su padres, el tiene una manzana de tierra la cual necesita trabajar, por falta de financiamiento no ha podido explotar esa tierra, su papá le esta apoyando con una parte pero no es lo suficiente para poder establecer cultivo , los planes hacia su futuro es poder cosechar pitahaya y cítricos ya que el con el financiamiento lo que va a cultivar es piña, lo cual necesita comprar todos los insumos agrícola para obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Pablo Emilio A. M. is 22-years-old and lives with his parents in San José de los ríos, in the Ticuantepe municipality. He hopes to improve the conditions of his home now that he supports his parents.

He owns almost two acres of arable land, which he has not been able to cultivate for lack of funds. His father helps him out as best he can, but his help isn’t enough to make a go of it.

His future plans are to grow citrus and dragon fruits, but he'll start with pineapples and use the money to purchase the supplies he needs to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farm supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Djiguisèmè (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djiguisèmè de l’association Djiguitougou sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Dar-salam1 de la ville de koutiala. (Région de Sikasso, république du Mali) 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage au lieu de travail.
Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  d’habits et comme activité secondaire la vente de légumes de toute sorte patate douce igname pomme de terre etc. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djiguisèmè a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de wax et des brodés en gros à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Quant aux légumes sont achetés et vendus  au marché et en ambulant au fur et à mesure, car ne pouvant être stockés longtemps. Les pagnes  sont vendus en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de koutiala. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice  de 120 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five women in the Djiguisèmè group from the Djiguitougou association are all married. They have an average age of 38 and an average of five children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Dar-salam1 neighborhood of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighborhood connections at work. They all sell clothing and have a secondary business selling all kinds of vegetables: yams, potatoes etc. They are very much in demand in this business. In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-increasing clientele, the Djiguisèmè group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution with whom they are requesting their third group loan. All their previous loans have been satisfactorily repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy bales of wax cloth and embroidered fabric wholesale in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). As for the vegetables, they are bought and sold at the market and door-to-door as and when, because it is impossible to stock up long term. The pagnes (decorated cotton fabric used to make traditional tunics) are sold retail at the Koutiala market for cash or credit. During this loan cycle, each member of the group expects to make a profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family and the remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and vegetables

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.ru: Жураев Уктамчон –мужчина 51 лет. Женат отец троих детей. У Уктама есть стадо мелко- рогатого скота, состоящее из 15 овцов и 6 козлов. Ему помогают дети. Старший сын находится, на заработках в Российской Федерации который помогает родителям высылая им деньги. Уктамчон также является членом дехканского хозяйства. Уктамчон получив займ хочет  расширить свою деятельность и увеличит свое стадо. Жена Уктамчона является домохозяйкой, в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи.
texts.en:
Uktamjon J. is 51 years old. He is married and the father of three children. Uktamjon has a herd of small livestock - 15 sheep and 6 goats. His children help him. The eldest son works in Russia and helps his parents by sending home money. Uktamjon is also a member of a small farm enterprise. He would like a loan to expand his activities and increase his livestock herd. His wife is a homemaker and works with wool in her spare time, kniitting various pieces of warm clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Livestock

loans.name: Belinda Walkiria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Belinda C. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace 5 años siendo este su ingreso con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en edad escolar y por ende debe de mantener sus estudios.

Con mucha necesidad ha llegado a Ceprodel debido a que requiere un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y una vez que los tenga ofertarlos para mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Belinda C. runs her small shop which she has had for 5 years. The income from her store is what she uses to support her family of two children. One of them is school-aged and she needs to pay for his studies. She has come to Ceprodel with great need and has requested a loan for the purchase of products to stock her shop, which she will then sell to improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo, la señora Juana M. habitante del municipio de Nagarote, a diario se dedica a su actividad de ganadería por medio de la crianza de cerdos siendo esta la actividad a la que se dedica de donde obtiene el ingreso para mantener a su familia.

Ella actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para invertir en su actividad tanto para la compra de los cerdos, alimentación y desparasitación. Es por esta razón que espera que Ceprodel le proporcione el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su actividad econoómica.
texts.en:
Juana M. lives in the municipality of Nagarote, and every day with a great deal of enthusiasm she works the farm raising pigs. She supports her family with the help of this business.

She has sought the help of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) so that she may invest in her business. She wants to buy more pigs, more food and veterinary medicines. She hopes Ceprodel will grant her the loan she has requested, to pull through with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and veterinary medicines.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor D. María R. D. T. D. 43 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Delgado, vive junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo. Ella posee un negocio en el cual se encarga D.  hacer comida para vender, así también comercializa ropa para niños y adultos. Flor D. María solícita un préstamo el cual le permita comprar más verduras, granos básicos para la elaboración D. los alimentos, así también desea comprar más ropa, D. manera que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es poder aumentar sus ventas y poder mejorar su económica familiar.
texts.en:
Flor D. María R. D. T. is 43 years old and lives in Ciudad Delgado with her three children and her husband. She runs a business making and selling food, and also sells clothing for children and adults.
Flor D. María is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase more vegetables and basic grains used in making her dishes, as well as more clothing so she can offer her customers greater variety.
Her greatest wish is to be able to increase her sales and improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, basic grains and clothing

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Gladis Vilma

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida
Gladis es casada, tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende condimentos diversos, cereales precocidos, productos que ella misma prepara en su casa. Además tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de menestras.
Gladis sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda mas grande.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of “Nueva Vida” Community Bank. She is married and has a booth at “Abril 12”, a market where she sells various spices/seasonings and pre-cooked cereals, products that she makes in her house. She also has a small cellar in her house.

Gladis is asking for a loan of$350 that will be invested in the purchase of “menestra”, a saucy lentil stew dish. Gladis’ dreams are for her children to be professionals and have a bigger booth.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Victoria es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Victoria es panificadora, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo en un horno alquilado, los panes los comercializa en el mercado central .
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener un horno propio y comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Lirio Communal Bank. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old and has 1 child. Victoria is a baker, a business which she runs with her husband in a rented oven. She sells the bread in the central market. Victoria needs a loan of 1200 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, butter, and sugar. Victoria's dream is to have her own oven and buy land to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is a 48-year-old fish vendor living on a small island named "Suba" in Talibon, Bohol. She has two children: one son and a daughter who are both studying in high school.

With this loan, Carmelita will be able to buy more fish from other fishermen to resell for income. The loan will also help a lot in buying a new boat.

Her dream for her children is for them to be able to graduate with whatever degree they want to pursue when they grow older.

loans.use: To buy more fish and a new boat

loans.name: Yudith Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora Yudith es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 01 hijo, estudio educación superior completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de verduras para venderlos en su puesto del mercado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganando vacuno para engorde, la señora también se dedica a la venta  de sombreros en el mercado. 

Su deseo es poner una tienda de productos veterinarios e implementar un laboratorio químico.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Lidia Rosa

texts.es: Lidia Rosa L. A. tiene 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad económica es la compra de mercadería en general. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue una necesidad primordial ya que tenía que alimentar a sus 2 hijos, por lo que no tenia ingresos suficientes para salir adelante. Por lo que decide iniciar a ofrecer a ciertos vecinos cosméticos, y poco a poco aumenta su mercadería con las ganancias que obtenía con este negocio y así logro comprar artículos como bolsos, calzado y ropa en general. Lidia ha sido una mujer que ha luchado fuertemente por sobresalir. Ahora solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en capital de trabajo. su deseo es que su hija logre finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lidia Rosa L. A. is a 38 years old, hard working, responsible woman. She is dedicated to the purchase of general merchandise, and has been in this business for about 18 years.

She started her business because she didn’t have enough income and had to feed her 2 children. She started by offering cosmetics to some of her neighbors and with the profits obtained, she increased the line of products to handbags, shoes and clothes in general.

Lydia is a woman who has fought hard to excel. She is asking for a loan that will be used as working capital. Her goal is for her daughter to graduate from school.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luon

texts.en: Mrs. Luon K. is a villager in Bakhong Khang Lech village in Takeo province and she is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Kheom Touch, is an ice cream seller who can make a small income to support the family. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his motorbike is too old and he needs to use a lot of money for fuel to support the motorbike so Mrs. Luon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband business. Mrs. Luon K. is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are all too young to work or study because they are at the age of 2 and 4 years old. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband business.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 28 years old and a single mother of one child, with other siblings to take care of. Sarah is a hard working and friendly lady. She has been in the business of selling ladies’ clothing from the Kazinga trading centre for eight years.

Her business challenge is the seasonality of her business, the expensive rent and the excessive dust from the murram road (gravel) where her shop is located. She is a friendly lady and knows how to present herself well. Sarah has a dream of opening a large boutique in the future, as well as to continue developing herself and having a good life together with her child.

This is Sarah’s first loan with her group, and she would like to use it to purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Sonia Cristina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito de Azángaro de la Región Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 03 hijos y estudió hasta el 4to grado de primaria.
Sonia Cristina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y seis meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de quesos en la mina la rinconada, paralelamente se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de cordero.
En la actualidad requiere de un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 (nuevos soles), para incrementar su capital de trabajo en la compra de quesos de paria y carne de cordero, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos, que será para el bienestar de su familia. 
Su  mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para salir adelante y progresar.
Referente a Manuela Ramos, manifiesta que le gustan las charlas y orientaciones que le dan en la reunión.
texts.en:
Sonia Cristina, 40, is a member of the “Punta Sahuacasi” communal bank which is in the Azángaro district in Puno region. She lives with her life partner and has three children; she completed fourth grade. Sonia Cristina has been working with Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year and a half. Her initial, 500 new sol loan, allowed her to buy cheeses from Mina la Rinconada. She also merchandises lamb meat. Currently, she needs a 1000 new sol loan to buy "paria" (a semi-hard, cow's milk cheese) cheeses and lamb meat in order to generate more income which will be for her family's wellbeing. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get ahead and progress. With regards to Manuela Ramos, she tells us that she enjoys the talks and training they impart at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lamb meat and cheese.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es:
Marjorie B. C., tiene la edad de 25 años, es casada, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para asistir una plantación de Ayote que tiene con su familia.El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitirle tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos.El esposo de doña Marjorie es quien está más al pendiente del cultivo del ayote, pero ella lo ayuda, sobre todo cuando es tiempo de cosecha.
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Marjorie B. C. is 25, married, and has one child. He is 5 years old, and he is her greatest priority. The loan that she wants is to help with the squash planting that she does with her family. It is to give the crop adequate maintenance, which will allow her to have better production. This way she will have greater income. Majorie’s husband is the one who is more involved with the squash crop, but she helps him, especially at harvest time. This is the first time she has had a loan with Fudecosur, and she is very happy with the simplicity of the loan. In the future she hopes to give her children and her whole family a better quality of life and economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help with squash planting

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Artemia C. is from the village of Clarin, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Artemia is married. To make a living, Artemia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Artemia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Artemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Artemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Artemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok N., 49, is married and lives with nine of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by five children working in garment factories and rice fields.

Sok N. would like to take out a loan of US$500; she plans to purchase rice which she will de-husk with the intention of reselling the de-husked rice and turning a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice which she will de-husk and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Popsicle sticks, fruit

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel P. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and is single. Noel operates a business providing photography services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Noel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 65,000 PHP from GDMPC. Noel is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his 14th from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela B. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Malabugas, Pasil, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living through her pig-fattening and net-working business.

Adela’s husband, Albeto, is a fisherman.  They have 3 children from 18 to 22 years old.  They are currently helping their father with the fishing.

Adela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the pig-fattening and net-working businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 4,800 from her business activities.

Adela is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations for her pig-fattening, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 13th loan, the amount of Php 15,000, which she intends to use on her pig-fattening and net-working business. Adela is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sofia Muthoni

texts.en:
Sophia is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. She operates a cereals stall in the Kangemi market. This is her primary business, which she has been doing for the last two years. Her clients are mainly people from Kangemi and its environs. The Kangemi area is pretty busy in terms of business and has a high population, most of whom are low-income earners.

Sophia stays at Kangemi together with her family. Her two children are pretty young; they are just starting school. Her husband, Isaac, is also doing a business. 

She was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET.  Sofia wants to add more stock of cereals like beans, soya beans, peas, green gram (mung bean) and others amounting to Kshs 30,000.

She hopes and desires to give her family a good life.

loans.use: To buy more cereals like peas, beans, green grams and others

loans.name: Gnilane Madeleine

texts.en:
Gnilane Madeleine N. is 28 years old, married and without children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Diamaguene 1 for two years and has always paid back her loans. She sells clothes, namely jeans, skirts and shoes.

Madame N. wants to use this loan to purchase more products for her shop. The revenues help her to improve the living conditions of her and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more products for shop

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
After working for years as a nanny, Guadalupe finally felt ready to go into business for herself when she discovered a program that helps to train and certify would-be daycare owners. In this comprehensive program, Guadalupe learned how to set up her business and manage its costs, and took classes about child development to prepare herself for the wide variety of children that she would care for. Upon graduation, Guadalupe transformed her home into 'My Little World Childcare'. 

Guadalupe’s daycare center is a ‘home away from home’ for the children, and she has tight bonds with the children she cares for. “I love celebrating their birthdays,” she says. “It’s beautiful to watch them grow up. I get to see them get their first tooth and learn how to walk.” Each day she tracks their eating habits, how they slept, and any unusual behavior, and makes reports to their parents. 

Guadalupe received a microloan from Opportunity Fund in 2007 to renovate her backyard and turn it into a better, safer play space for the children. She now has swing sets, a playhouse, and other toys, and the children spend time outside whenever possible. “If I had not received a loan from Opportunity Fund I still would have tried to make the safety improvements to my center, but they might not have been enough. I am afraid it could have been dangerous.” 

With a second loan through Opportunity Fund, this one for $8,000, Guadalupe will be able to purchase a computer to track her business expenses and a van to take the children on field trips to the nearby park and museums. She will also install a fence to separate her front yard from the street.

loans.use: Computer to track business expenses; van to take children on field trips; safety improvements to her childcare facility

loans.name: Ever

texts.en:
Ever Peter is currently in the business of selling maize flour and rice and is requesting a loan to stock cassava flour and more bags of rice to sell. Ever is 38 years old and is married, with a husband that is a policeman. She has 5 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cassava flour and more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Hermilo

texts.es:
El señor Hermilo M. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar más mercancía para su negocio.
Es solicitando un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda ya que actual mente su techo está en muy mal estado, quiere impermeabilizar antes de que empiece la temporada de lluvia.
Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que está obteniendo de su trabajo como gestor de cobranza de una mueblería.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermilo M. is grateful for the assistance he received from his previous loan, which was used to buy more merchandise for his business.

He is now requesting a home improvement loan. The roof of his house is currently in bad condition and needs to be weatherproofed before the start of the rainy season. Hermilo does not have the money needed to buy the materials and pay someone to make the repairs.

He plans to repay the loan with the income he earns working as a collection manager for a furniture store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to repair his roof

loans.name: Eliezer Enmanuel

texts.es:
El señor Eliezer Enmanuel D. C., es un joven de 24 años, que habita en el Barrio Las Enramadas, con su novia, tienen un hijo de 5 años que estudia el preescolar, es agente de ventas, y su pareja se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda, apoyándole en los gastos del hogar.

Trabaja en este rubro desde hace 2 años, sus ingresos son bastante limitados que no le han permitido realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de edificar su vivienda, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo y poder ofrecerles a su familia mejores condiciones que beneficien al desarrollo social de sus vidas, son una familia que comienza a edificar sus formas de habitad y sobrevivencia, por tanto esperan se les apoye a mejorar sus condiciones socioeconomicas y sobretodo poder ofrecerles a su hijo los recursos necesarios para desarrollarse en un ambiente mas digno.
texts.en:
Eliezer Enmanuel D. C., 24, is a young man who lives in the Las Enramadas neighborhood with his girl friend and their 5-year-old son who is in preschool. He is a sales agent and his girlfriend sells used clothing to help him meet household expenses. He has been in this line of work for two years but his income is quite limited. So much so, that he has been unable to afford to buy building materials and supplies to finish building his house. For this reason, wanting to provide his family with better living conditions that will promote their social development, and being a family that is starting to develop their style of living and surviving, they hope they will be supported in their efforts to improve their socioeconomic conditions, especially in order to provide their son with the necessary resources to develop in a more proper environment.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crossbeams, blocks, cement, labor

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira G., 58, resides in Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Thomas G., a Jeepney driver, and is the mother of five children.

Elvira operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family custom but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and food costs less than raw food. 

Elvira's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in gross sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Elvira dreams of giving all of her children a good, high-quality education through her hard work. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C. is from the village of Disud. She is 34 years old. Flora is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she has for sale. Flora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the third loan taken out by Flora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the town of Villa Rose, Cabarroguis Quirino. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Myrna owns and operates a jeepney transportation business. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it..

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase materials needed to expand services. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for repair and maintenance of the business vehicle. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: repair and maintenance of the business vehicle

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, un distrito pesquero que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Empezó vendiendo en un puesto ubicado en el mercadillo de su ciudad y luego decidió reinstalarlo en su domicilio, actualmente se vale de este negocio para brindarle a su esposo una ayuda con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes, ya que Luz siempre trata de brindarles productos de primera calidad y un trato amable. Actualmente ella ha pensado en ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es ver a los suyos gozar de una buena calidad de vida y de un futuro estable. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luz is a Mom, she is 44 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Pacasmayo, a fishing district belonging to the province of the same name and located in the region of La Libertad. It is located approximately two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital region of Lambayeque. She sells grocery store items from a store fashioned from a section in her house. She started out selling her products from a stand in a small market in the city but she later decided to relocate to her house. She invests her herself in this business to be able to help her husband support the family. Her business sees great support from her clients because Luz always provides them with top quality products and good client service. She is planning on expanding her business by increasing the variety of her products. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner). The loan of 1500 nuevos soles will help her reach her goal. Luis is a hardworking woman who is very devoted to her family. Her greatest dream is to see her family enjoy a good quality of life and to see them have a stable future. The people that know her consider her to be an honest and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items to increase the variety in her store.

loans.name: Ezekiel Kariuki

texts.en:
Ezekiel has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. He is 48 years old and married to Florence Njoki. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by his friend and this will be his second loan with KADET LTD. He has no other history with any other microfinance institution (MFI) and he paid his previous loan well and on time. He plans to use this cash as working capital for adding goat meat in his butcher shop, which is in demand in Naivasha town.

Ezekiel hopes to grow his butcher shop in the future and also open up a food stall, which he will run on the side.

loans.use: To buy more goat meat to sell

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en: Married to a fisherman and mother of two children, Dulce R. often dreamed of a better and quality standard of living. Both husband and wife are full of determination to save for the future of their 8 and 7 year old children. When she heard of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines, she immediately joined to have access to capital. With her previous loan, she bought additional fishing gear for her husband. She engages in fish vending. The income generated from their fish selling business helps in providing for their financial needs. The partnership of this couple works great so, again, she is applying for another loan worth PHP 25,000.00 pesos. She will use the funds from this loan for the construction of fish cages that her husband will maintain. They will buy materials such as fish nets, bamboo poles, and pay the labor costs for the assembly of fish cages and fingerlings to be place inside the cage. With the implementation of this plan, They will generate more profit and increase their income after only 3 months. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will continue to support in their business plan and support their dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishcages.

loans.name: Alicia Alexandra

texts.es:
Alicia Alexandra T. C. tiene 19 años. Es soltero vive con los papas vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos.  

Alicia pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Alicia trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas.
