Solicita el crédito para la compra maíz,  arroz y fréjol  . Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Alicia Alexandra T. C. is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  She has no children.

Alicia is a member of the Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración [New Inspiration Group] located in the Anchoveta neighborhood in the parish of Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo.  It is a group dedicated to short cycle workers who mostly grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The group has 13 members.

Alicia works in agriculture growing short-cycle corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She buys them in Guayaquil and sells them at a store near her home and in the market in Ventanas.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  This loan will help her economically be able to meet her needs.  Her dream to continue farming to make money and to purchase a car.  She likes to work.

loans.use: Purchase corn, rice, and pigeon peas

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank "Miraflores", located in the district of pilcuyo, in the province of Ilave, and the department of El Collao. She is 33 years old, and married with three children. She has a secondary school education. 

Vilma has a bakery. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, to buy consumables for her business, such as flour, lard, and yeast, to make bread. 

She is now asking for a loan for 500 PEN, to buy consumables such as lard and yeast.  Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is sharing the happiness.

loans.use: The purchase of consumables such as lard and yeast to make bread

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto tiene 54 años de edad, vive en domicilio propio con su compañera.
 Él se dedica a la talabartería desde el año 1996, dicha vocación lo heredó de su padre quien en tiempos de su niñez ya le enseñó los secretos de dicho arte y Ernesto le ayudaba en el trabajo.
Ernesto vende sus mercaderías por el interior del país, en su negocio le ayudan sus hijos, él es cliente excelente recurrente de la fundación y comenta que gracias a los préstamos que consiguió de la institución fue creciendo como microempresario. 
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de cuero ya que está teniendo mucha demanda de sus mercaderías y desea cumplir con todos los pedidos de su numerosa clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Ernesto is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his common-law wife. He has worked making saddles since 1996, and inherited this vocation from his father who taught him the secrets of the craft from a young age when Ernesto would help him at work. Ernesto sells his merchandise around the interior part of the country. His children help him at his business.

He has been an excellent client of the loan foundation and shares that, thanks to the loans he has gotten through this organization, he has been able to grow as a small-business owner. The loan he requests will be used to buy leather as demand for his products is currently very high and he desires to fill all the requests of his numerous customers.

loans.use: To buy leather

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion C., 55, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando C., A vendor and her business partner. At this time, Concepcion is working hard to be able to support her family financially, like their everyday expenses.

Concepcion operates a retailing business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php19, 000 loan. She will be use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Concepcion dreams to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen L. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old. Carmen is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Carmen is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.en:
Isabel, 29, is a member of the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Isabel is married and has two children. She sells candies, nuts, drinks and other snacks off a push cart on the street in Cuzco. She also is involved in the sale of beauty products from catalogs. She sells Avon, Dupre and Esika products and delivers them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in both her businesses.

She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in snack cart and beauty product sale businesses.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed lives in Khalilabad, a small residential area of Depalpur. Depalpur is a small city, located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for six years.
 
Her husband’s name is M. K. and he owns a mobile phone selling and repairing shop in the market. He can repair almost any kind of mobile set and also offers new mobile phones from different companies to his clients at competitive rates.
 
Naheed herself is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. All of them are studying except her eldest son, who left his education after matriculation and started helping his father in his business.
 
Naheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase new models of mobile phone sets. This will help him sell more and earn a larger income.
 
He has been doing this business for five years and Naheed is very confident that he will successfully be able to improve his business after the loan investment.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones for mobile phone selling business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine L. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members, her grandchildren.  

Christine has a retail shop business.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Christine sells her products in a retail shop.  Christine has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of biscuits, boxes of sweets, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and one liter jerrycans of cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through poultry farming and tailoring.

The main business challenges for Christine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and build rental rooms and also to start selling on wholesale only.  Christine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food school fees and medication

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of biscuits, boxes of sweets and one liter jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Mitze Marie

texts.en:
Mrs. Mitze Marie A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Mitze Marie is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Mitze Marie owns and operates a piggery and a farm for coco production. Mitze Marie has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In February 2011, Mitze Marie joined PMPC under Barangay Official Livelihood Assistance (BOLA) program to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mitze Marie is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her coco farm and feeds for her piggery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, repaying loans, and educating her child.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for coco farm and feeds for piggery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar sacos de abono y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar S. is from the village of Lawagan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 55 years-old. Pilar is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Pilar has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Pilar joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pilar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pilar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Pilar from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Houenoussou 2 Group

texts.en:
The 13 entrepreneurs in this group live in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou, Benin's economic centre.  They run similar businesses, and also arrange social events together. This is their first loan with ALIDE.

Hortance (with her hand raised in the photo) was born in 1979 in Cotonou. She moved to her current location 7 years ago, and now lives with her husband Geames and their five children, all of whom are in school.  Since moving to Cotonou Hortance has run a stall selling shoes and miscellaneous items. This loan will enable her to increase her stock of shoes from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim in the near term is to build her credit limit.

loans.use: to increase her stock of shoes

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Violeta P. works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy papaya, squash, ampalaya, etc., for her business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members. Mrs. Kong, born in 1961, is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

She and her husband, Mr. Sorm who was born in 1955, are farmers who own a 1.40-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice and winter melon. In order to support this farming, Mrs. Kong would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crops. Aside from farmer, Mr. Sorm also earned for living buy fishing. 

They have five children: three are farmers who support their parents farming, and the other two are students.

loans.use: To support farm crops.

loans.name: Sayan

texts.en:
Sayan is 31 years old and lives in Sinkor. She’s widow with three children aged ten to twenty years old. All three of them live at home and all are in school. 

Sayan has been selling oil for the past three years, although she doesn’t sell oil during the rainy season because there is no oil production. She says she started business with charcoal and then later oil.  Sayan says it helps her to earn her own money. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil. She wants to be a big business woman and earn her money.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Ul, aged 68, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has a child. She is engaged in grocery sales, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $4 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Ul and her husband have had these businesses. Ul is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase ducks to raise for resale. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Adjwoa

texts.en: Adjwoa  is married and has four children.  She makes Fante kenkey, fermented corn dough wrapped in banana leaves. She is also a fish monger at Elmina, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjwoa uses her income to assist her husband in paying the household expenses. Adjwoa will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize to produce kenkey for sale.  She wishes to reinvest the profit back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of maize to produce kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; El socio vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Juan; tiene 45 años de edad; la socia es conviviente; el socio tiene 6 hijos, el socio se dedica a la construcción, el socio trabaja como albañil y siempre esta tras de las contrataciones en las obras grandes, el socio desea invertir el credito en la compra de herramientas, el socio implementara sus herramientas de trabajo, el socio solicita el prestamo para comprar herramientas de trabajo para el uso diario en las diferentes obras en las que lo contratan.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Here is a member from the communal bank "Sr. de Tayancani". He lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

His name is Juan. He is 45 years old and he is married common-law. He has 6 children. He works in the construction sector, working as a construction worker. He is always in search for the large construction projects. He wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of tools. He will use his tools in his work. He requests a loan to purchase working tools to use daily in the various projects that he is contracted to do.

He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that has been granted to him. It will help him grow his business and improve the quality of his life. He is committed to making his loan payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase work tools.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.ru: Sevindj rodilas v 1974 qodu. Ona zamujem imeyet 2 detey. Sevindj uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda ,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kurici i utok dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva ptic dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Sevindj was born in 1974. She is married and has two children.  Sevindj has raised poultry for nine years.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy chickens and ducks to increase the number of birds she sells.

loans.use: to buy chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Ana es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una preciosa hija de tres años  de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y ropa en general. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6H00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupado, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que con la tienda lleva un año pero que en lo que es venta de ropa hace ya cuatro años y que poco a poco con ayuda de los créditos ella pudo poner su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en adecuar un local donde muy pronto va a poner otra tienda.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio, que su tienda crezca cada día más y que la otra sea mucho mejor
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Palabra De Mujer [Woman's Word] credit group meets every two weeks. The community is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ana is a founding member of the credit group and she likes it because its interests are lower than other lending institutions. She is 31 years old, married, and has a beautiful daughter who is three years old. Her husband works as a bricklayer.  

She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergent, as well as certain variety items, paper products and general clothing. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes later. Her husband helps her at work when he is otherwise unoccupied. She tells us that she has had the store for a year but she has been selling clothes for four years and little by little, with the help of the loans she was able to open her store.

She is going to use the loan to outfit a locale very soon in order to open another store.   
 
Her goals are to continue with her business and for her store to grow more every day and for the other one to be a lot better.

loans.use: to equip a locale for a store.

loans.name: Manzurakhon

texts.ru: Манзуракхон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 39 лет. Разведена. У нее трое детей. Она живет вместе с родителями. Манзурахон имеет среднее образование. Она более 15 лет занимается шитьем. В основном она шьет национальные платья. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Manzurakhon lives in Dushanbe. She is 39 years old, divorced, and has three children. She lives with her parents. Manzurahon has a secondary education. She has been sewing for more than fifteen years.  Basically she sews traditional dresses. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 27 years old, married, and has two daughters aged 6 and 13. He owns a small shop selling "unga" (flour), sugar, cooking oil, and rice to residents around his business. He has been running this business for a year and hopes to continue expanding it. Evans intends to use his loan to purchase a "posho" mill that he will use at this shop. 

This is Evans’ second loan with SMEP. He is a good client who pays back his loans on time. Evans hopes to own a wholesale business some day. He describes himself as extremely focused.

loans.use: to purchase a "posho" (cornmeal) mill to use at his shop.

loans.name: Nella

texts.en:
Nella is 52 years of age and married with one child. She owns and operates a business, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has 7 years of experience in this business. Nella needs a loan of WST 1250 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $129 per week) to improve her family's general living conditions.

Nella joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Nella's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 43 years old. He is a herder who feeds a number of cows and calves on his small farm. He lives with his son, daughter and wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Darkhan. Darkhan is the second largest city in Mongolia. Since 1976, he has been raising livestock and he has gained good experience. 
He keeps his cows' milk in a big freezer and sells it to the grocery stores which are located near his farm. Recently his freezer has broken and has not been keeping the milk safe. It is a critical problem for a farmer and he needs to solve it immediately.  
Therefore he is planning to buy a new stable freezer which can keep the milk safely. He needs the support of a loan to cover its cost. Enkhbold is taking a loan to buy a new freezer to keep his cows' milk frozen.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer to keep his cows' milk frozen.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María madre soltera, su hijo estudiante, mujer emprendedora, comerciante. Su proyecto incrementar sus ventas para así invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
 Inicio con fondos propios  en pequeñas cantidades de producto y vendiendo ambulantemente  ofreciendo a los clientes. a la actualidad  tiene su cafetín en el cual vende desayunos, almuerzo, refrescos entre otros productos.
Nuestro cliente está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, tubos pvc sanitario, tee pvc, inodoro, lava manos, piedrines, caja eléctrica,bloques,hierro, alambre duplo entre otros materiales para la construcción de un baño y cambio del sistema eléctrico de la vivienda. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento de nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is a single mother and her child is a student. She is an entrepreneur. Her project is to increase sales in order to improve her house. She began with her own money selling her products in small amounts on the street. Now she has a café in which she sells breakfast, lunch, drinks and other items.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, PVC pipes for the bathroom, tee PVC, toilet, sink, gravel, electrical box, blocks, iron, double wiring, and other material to construct a bathroom and to change the electrical system of the house. She is thankful to the communal bank for helping her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is a single woman, age 49, blessed with two children. 

For the last two years, she has been selling doughnuts to earn a living. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 

In the next five years, she wants to become successful in her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat and wheat flour.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has operated a house cleaning service for three years. She is a married woman. She has two children, both currently enrolled in school. Her other source of income is her husband's earnings. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge as low wages and her largest monthly expenses are rent and school fees. 

Joyce will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase roofing supplies for her home. Joyce wants to start her own business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficiency and flexibility.

loans.use: to purchase roofing supplies for her home.

loans.name: Almar

texts.en: Almar is 36 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines where he has been providing motorela or habal-habal services for five years. A new member of HSPFI, Almar is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia tiene una pequeña tienda de barrio. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar productos como ser: harina, azúcar, dulces, galletas y demás. Vive en casa en alquiler la misma queda ubicada en la zona  16 de febrero en la ciudad de El Alto; es divorciada tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que Virginia obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y por esta razón se lo trata de fondear a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Virginia has a small neighborhood store.  She needs the loan to increase capital and to buy products like flour, sugar, sweets, cookies, and others.

She rents where she lives in the 16 de Febrero area in the city of El Alto.  She is divorced, and she has one child.

This is Virginia’s first loan, and she is hoping to improve her family’s quality of life.  That is the reason she is trying to get a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, sweets, and cookies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Delmy Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Delmy tiene 38 años y vive la aldea de Monte Bello en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ella es casada y su esposo Mariano es un técnico dental. La pareja tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 19 años de edad. Delmy, su hija mayor y su esposo aportan económicamente a los gastos familiares. 

Delmy ha tenido su negocio por 16 años. Durante 2 años Delmy estudió en una escuela artesanal y allí aprendió a cortar y confeccionar ropa. Ella elabora todo tipo de ropa, cameras y cortinas. Su especialidad son vestidos de niña. Ella recibe pedidos de clientes que ya conocen bien a su trabajo. Ella labora 8 horas diarias para confeccionar los pedidos de sus clientes. 

Solicitó este crédito de L12,000 para la compra de telas, hilos, y la reparación de una máquina que no le está haciendo bien la puntada de costura. Ella espera hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Delmy is 38 years old and lives in the village of Monte Bello in the San Pedro Sula municipality.  She is married, and her husband Mariano is a dental technician.  They have two daughters aged 8 and 19.  Her older daughter and her husband contribute to the family finances.

Delmy has had her business for 16 years.  For two years Delmy studied at an arts college where she learned to sew and to make clothes.  She makes all types of clothes, bed linens and curtains.  Her speciality are children's clothes.  She takes orders from customers who already known her work well.  She works 8 hours daily to sew the orders for her customers.

She requested this loan of L12,000 for the purchase of fabric and thread, and for the repair of a sewing machine which isn't doing a good job making stitches.  She hopes to make her business larger.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread, and repair a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jackelyn Veronica

texts.es:
Jackelyn, se dedica al destazo de cerdos, viene acompañada de su esposo y tiene una niña de un año de edad, ella inició en el negocio por la ayuda que recibió de  su suegra, quien le enseñó el trabajo en la carnicería y hoy en día trabaja en conjunto con su esposo, lleva ya dos años de experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cinco cerdos cada uno por un precio de $100, esto le ayudará para mantener en la granja disponibilidad de animales y destazarlos en el momento necesario. Con las compras espera mejorar y seguir ofreciendo a los clientes costilla y carne de buena calidad.
Su aspiración es tener el negocio más grande, que espera conseguirlo dentro de unos años con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, con ello espera que su familia vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Jackelyn butchers pigs.  She is accompanied by her husband and her one-year-old daughter.  Jackelyn started this business with help she received from her mother-in-law, who taught her the work that takes place in a butcher shop.  Today she works with her husband and already has two years of experience.

Jackelyn is requesting a loan to buy five pigs, each one priced at $100.  This will help maintain the available number of animals she has on hand so that she can butcher them as needed.  With these purchases, she expects to improve and continue offering her customers ribs and meat that are of good quality.  

Her aspiration is to have a larger business.  She hopes to proceed for a few years with great effort and dedication in expectation that her family will live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy five pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is divorced and she has two children. She works as a food vendor and cooks a variety of food to sell at Ankwanda near Elmina.  Mary is responsible for the upkeep of her children.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for the food she cooks and sells. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save toward building a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make and sell food

loans.name: Durley Amparo

texts.es: La señora Durley Amparo a sus 39 años de edad trabaja como independiente vendiendo productos tales como bolsos, películas, juguetes y música desde hace un año cuando se quedo sin empleo y no contaba con ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo. Gracias a su negocio, ha sacado su hogar adelante, le ha podido dar estudio a su hijo y ha crecido como persona. La señora Durley Amparo necesita de la compra de surtido con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su hijo a quien sueña ver como profesional para que no pase por las dificultades que ella y su familia de bajos recursos han pasado.
texts.en: Durley Amparo is 39 years old, she is an independent retailer and she has been selling products such as bags, films, toys and music CDs for one year, after having found herself jobless and with no income to provide for her son. Thanks to her activity she has provided for her family, she has been able to pay for the education of her son and she has grown as a person. Durley Amparo need to buy various products in hopes of improving her sales and therefore her son’s standard of living: she dreams of seeing him become a professional, so that he will not have to face the difficulties that she and her low income family have been through.

loans.use: To buy toys, music and films.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, a 34-year-old married woman with four children ranging in age from 3 years to 10 years, describes herself as customer-friendly and passionate about her work. For the last five years she has been operating a retail stall located near a busy bus station where she sells clothes. Anna describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds.

Now requesting a loan for Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes, her business goal is to operate a bigger clothing retail business out of a permanent building within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: T_F_Katelepai_Margretluto Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 16 farmers in Teso District. She is 38 years old, is not married and has four children.

Margaret likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Margaret plans to use the profits from this coming season to buy a cow.

In total, Margaret’s group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan V. is 33 years old and is a mother of 3 children living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in the nearby garment factory and normally generates around $3/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, repairs tires in the village roadside and typically helps to contribute all the money to the household. Her children are students and assist their parents by cooking meals. V. hopes to use this loan to purchase an air pumping machine to help facilitate her husband's business to make more additional income. In the future, this couple hopes to make more money to open a simple vehicle repaire shop and to supplement their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase an air pumping machine to operate the tire repair business.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Mrs. Uch T. is a widow with one child. She is 47 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To make a living condition, Uch T. rents the different rooms of her house to the garment workers in her area, from which she earns five dollar a day. Recently, Uch T. has faced an increased demand for rooms and therefore is requesting a loan of five hundred dollars to build more.

loans.use: To build more rooms to earn more rental income

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat B., 37 is married and has 3 children. She has high school education. Mamlakat has been selling shoes for men for 5 years. According to her, before Mamlakat joined MicroInvest, she sold small quantities of shoes at various parts of town having no permanent place of business. Today, her business assets grew up to $800. By carefully investing the loaned funds, Mamlakat was able to establish a permanent place for her business at one of the central regional markets. Her husband helps Mamlakat in business. In the future, Mamlakat plans to purchase her goods from wholesalers directly instead of waiting for the local suppliers to deliver them. She also wants to increase the assortment of shoes in her store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобочонова Мамлакат- 37 лет, замужем, мать 3-их детей. Образование среднее. Вот уже 5 лет занимается продажей мужской обуви. По ее словам до того, как стала клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» ,продавала обувь в малом ассортименте в разных частях города без определенного место деятельности. Муж помогает жене в торговле. Сейчас ее активы достигают 800$ ,что говорит о том, что у нее увеличился товарооборот и что она очень целенаправленно использует каждые шаги кредитования. В настоящее время она продолжает эту деятельность в определенной точке в одном из центральных рынков области. В будущем она планирует ездить за товаром сама не ожидая поступления от местных поставщиков и увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: To increase assortment of goods

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: Mrs. Kol T., age 25, works with her husband, age 30, selling dessert in Phnom Penh City, where a number of people pass by, earning up to $35/day in revenue. They have two children: one who is a student and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand to sell the dessert in instead of paying rent  every month. This will lower their expenses in the long term, increase their margins, and raise income for the family. They plan to use the additional income to educate their children and raise their standard of living. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a market stall in order to stop renting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in wholesale products

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Rahim A. sells tangerines, bananas, lemons, oranges and apples at the central market in Khujand. He is married and has 4 children. His wife helps him in his business. Rahim purchases fruits by the box from wholesalers using all of his working capital. He earns a good profit daily and based on the findings of the loan officer his business has very high turnover. Because Rahim makes regular payments on his Kiva loan, the loan committee has decided to allow him to take out another loan via Kiva.

Rahim will use the parallel loan to increase his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Рахим, продает мандарины, бананы, лимоны, апельсины и яблоко на центральном рынке Худжанда на Панчшанбе . Он женат и имеет 4 детей.Его жена помогает продает вместе с ним.Он закупает фрукты ящикамии коробками у оптовиков . Закупку делает на все активы.Ежедневно он получает хорошую прибыль и по показаниям мониторинга кредитного офицера его бизнес в данное время имеет очень быстрый оборот. Так как он регулярно оплачивает свой текущий займ с КИВЫ на комитете было принято решение о повторном размешеннии на сайт КИВА.Сейчас он запрашивает параллельный займ на увеличение товарооборота.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en:
K. Zamira is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Zamira sells bread and rolls in the local market and has been in this business already for 13 years. Zamira's sales stand is located in a very busy place of the market, and both the buyers and the sellers of the market are Zamira's customers. As a result, the business provides a significant share of the family's income. 

Currently, Zamira needs a loan of US$800 for a 6-month term. With the borrowed money, she plans to purchase baked goods like bread and rolls for sale. Having proved herself as a reliable client of the loan organization, Zamira promises to pay the loan back in time and is thankful to everyone for support.

loans.use: Purchase of baked goods for sale

loans.name: Nevenka

texts.en: Nevenka is from Bjelovac, a small village near the town Bratunac. She was born in 1963 and she is married. Her husband works in a mine in Srebrenica. His monthly salary is 800 KM. They get additional money doing agriculture and livestock  farming. Nevenka wants to use this loan in the amount of 1000 KM ($775) for buying raspberry seedlings, string, compost and other herbicide preparations for raspberry cultivation. She wants to expand her raspberry production in order to increase her income for her family.

loans.use: Buying  raspberry seedlings.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 22 years old and works and lives with his family in the Bekaa Valley. He has three children and makes a living painting furniture. This is the second time Hussein has applied for a loan for Al Majmoua. He will use this new loan to buy supplies and materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy material for a furniture-painting business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Ms. Toscana has a small and cozy house but wants to improve her flooring and interior finishings. She needs a loan to buy floor tiles and to improve the appearance of her home. Her project will cost approximately $1,000. To improve her home and thus have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La Señora T. cuenta con una vivienda económica y comida pero desea mejorar los pisos de su casa al igual que los acabados interiores .Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar vitropisó y dar una apariencia mejor a su vivienda. Su proyecto cuesta aproximadamente $1,000 dlls. Para mejorar su vivienda y así tener un mejor lugar donde vivir.

loans.use: Floor tiles and finishing for the interior of the house

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mrs. Mach S. lives in Rolaing Chrey Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and grocer. In addition to these two business activities, she is a pig breeder. She now has insufficient money to buy pig food to feed her pigs, so she asked for a loan for this purpose. She is 48 and the widowed mother of three children. One of her children works in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the youngest child is studying in high school. Previously, Mrs. Mach S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy cows to work in her rice field.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Mr. Amancio V. is 38 years old and is single, he like all his family is from a city in the interior of the country. Until approximately 10 years ago, he dedicated himself to a small farm, in a moment where the money he was earning was not keeping up, he decided to seek out other options and he came to the central area of the city where he dedicated himself to the selling things in a traveling way, like all his brothers. Nowadays thanks to the loans that the Foundation has granted him he already has his own vehicle that is his principal tool for work and two times a week he travels to Chaco Paraguayo to sell his merchandise. The credit that he is requesting he will invest in the purchase of various foods like potatoes, tapioca, tomatoes, pumpkin, noodles, milk, juices, etc. In the future he wants to buy a vehicle with more capacity for cargo.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Amancio V. tiene 38 años y es soltero, él como toda su familia es de una ciudad del interior del país. Hasta aproximadamente 10 años se dedicaban a la chacra, en un momento dado como el dinero que ganaban no les alcanzaba decidió buscar nuevos horizontes y vino hacia el departamento central donde se dedicó a la venta ambulante, como todos sus hermanos.

Hoy día gracias a los créditos que la Fundación le ha otorgado ya tiene su propio vehículo que es su principal herramienta de trabajo y dos veces por semana viaja al Chaco Paraguayo para vender su mercadería.

El crédito que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de comestibles varios como papas, mandioca, tomate, zapallo, fideos, cañas, leche, jugos etc. En el futuro el desea comprarse un vehículo con más capacidad de carga.

loans.use: To purchase food like potatoes, tapioca, tomatoes, pumpkin, noodles, milk, juices, etc.

loans.name: At

texts.en:
Mrs. At P., 54, and her husband, Mr. San Thuy, live on an island in the Mekong River near Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have eight children, four sons and four daughters. Two of their children are married, one of whom lives in the family home. Two of their children are construction workers, one daughter is a weaver, and the youngest one is in school and weaves silk when she has free time from her studies.

Mrs. At has been a silk weaver for many years, a skill she learned from her mother. At also sells vegetables and fish in the village when she is free from her weaving business. Mr. Thuy has been a motor taxi driver for over twenty years. At sells her finished products to a reseller, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. The couple lives in an old house and needs some money to build a new house for their family. Thus, she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To build a house for her family

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin A. sells foodstuffs and fish out of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. Toyin lives at Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Toyin needs the loan amount of US$ 450 to buy a deep freezer so that she can add the selling of drinks to her business, so that she can cool the drinks for her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Hokéné

texts.fr: Née le 23/11/1986 à Aného, M. Hokéné est une célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Elle vit avec son enfant dans le quartier Forever à Lomé et travaille actuellement comme serveuse dans un bar de la place faute d’argent pour faire le commerce dans lequel elle excelle. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire des achats et la vente de produits cosmétiques et de chaussures pour reprendre son ancienne activité qu’est le commerce.
texts.en:
Hokene M. was born on November 23, 1986. She is single and is responsible for one child. She lives with her child in the Forever district of Lomé and is working as a waitress in a local bar to earn income to maintain her business, at which she excels. She is requesting this loan to purchase and sell cosmetic products and shoes to re-establish her former commercial business activity.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of footwear and underwear for re-sale

loans.name: Syeda Fayyaz Syed Mazhar Ali Shah Group

texts.en:
Syeda Fayyaz baji is 40 years old and lives Pakpattan, Pakistan. She owns a two-room, brick house. Her husband, S. M. A. S., is a homeopathic (treats illness with herbs) doctor. He has 4 years experience in this work. Fayyaz baji is a mother of six children: four daughters and two sons. Her sons are in kindergarten. All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Fayyaz baji’s husband has a good reputation in the community. Most of the people come to take medicine from him. Fayyaz baji helps her husband in the making of herbal medicines. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more herbs to make medicines. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Humaira baji requests a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Aqeela baji requests a loan to buy phones for her mobile phone shop. Sakina baji requests a loan to buy spices to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy herbs for herbal medicine recipes

loans.name: By God In Power Group

texts.en:
Zainab K. and Adama M. are two local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. They named their group By God In Power, a Krio phrase meaning “by the power of God.”  

They have received previous Kiva loans through SMT. Most recently, each of them received a loan of Le 500,000, which was a great help to Zainab and Adama. The loan enabled them to expand their businesses, make additional profits, and consequently improve the living condition of members of the group.  Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are each asking for Le 800,000. 

Zainab (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-seven years of age and was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone.  She is married to a teacher, and they have had five children together.  Zainab sells several items in a kiosk on Magburaka road in Makeni. Some of the items she sells include body lotions, cigarettes, biscuits, and Peak brand powder.  She has been in the business for over ten years now.

With this new loan, Zainab will expand her business. She will be able to buy items in bulk to add to her business. For example, she will now be able to buy one carton of cigarettes instead of one pack at a time.  She will travel to Freetown (240 miles r/t) to purchase these goods. 

Zainab thanks God that her business is doing fine. She will reinvest some of the income generated from the loan back into the business.  She will use the rest to take care of her children, specifically their education, food and clothing.

loans.use: Purchasing lotions, cigarettes, biscuits and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Wilson R.

texts.es:
El señor Wilson C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Tembladerani, en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Paola Mercado y su hijo.
El señor Wilson trabaja como empleado en una fábrica textil de esta ciudad, su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
Su vivienda, debido a su antigüedad y al deterioro necesita el cambio del muro lateral al vecino.
El crédito será destinado a la construcción del muro lateral de su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Wilson C. lives in his own home in Tembladerani, which is on the east side of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Señora Paola Mercado, and his son. Señor Wilson works as an employee in a textile factory in this city. His wife is a housewife. His house, thanks to its age and deterioration, needs to change the wall next to his neighbour. This loan would be used for the construction of the side wall of his home. This is the second time he has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis revealed that he is well qualified and able to have access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the cost of constucting a side wall of his house

loans.name: Nhep

texts.en: S., 29, has owed a plot of farmland in her village since she was single, growing rice as well as vegetables. She is married to Sopheap, age 29, and he makes a living as a domestic ox trader. He usually purchases oxen from the rural people to fatten them a while and re-sell at a higher price, and he has been doing this since 2003. The family lives in Svay Art Commune, Pursat Province. In order to make extra income for the family, S. has requested a loan of US$ 300 to supplement her husband's working capital.

loans.use: To supplement her husband's working capital

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana Jarquín Z. is 40 years old, married, no children. Her business is the sale of cosmetics such as perfumes, lotions and also foundation garments. She has had this business for more than eight years, which emerged from the desire to obtain business knowledge as well as to make a living. The goals of her business are to continue to invest in new merchandise for her customers. The loan is for working capital, since she has to obtain her products in the capital of Managua due to the more favorable conditions of the market there. The amount requested is C$5,000 for 7 months.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es: El señor Pedro José H. O. tiene la edad de 50 años, habita en la comunidad de la borgoña , el es soltero ya sus hijos son mayores y están casado , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que sus hijos a pesar que están casados viven con él , don José desde hace veinticinco años trabaja como agricultor el mayor problema que se le ha presentado es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio la actividad agrícola ya que una cooperativa estaba dando capacitación en la zona y el fue unos de los beneficiado  con tres manzana de tierras para cultivar , pero no le dieron los recurso para desarrollar la actividad agrícola , el solicita financiamiento para salir bien con su cosechas ya que en las anteriores tuvo perdidas por la falta de insumos necesarios para los mismo. Lo cual con esta solicitud va a comprar todos los insumos y fertilizante que necesite su producción.
texts.en:
Pedro José H. O. is 50 years old and lives in the community of La Borgoña. He is single and has grown sons who are married. His plan is to improve the condition of his house; though his sons are married, they still live with him. José has worked as a farmer for 25 years, and the biggest problem he faces is a lack of funding. He started farming because a cooperative was providing training in the area, and he was one of the beneficiaries, with three blocks of land to cultivate. They did not, however, give him the resources to develop his farming activities. He is seeking a loan so his crops will turn out well--he sustained losses in his previous harvests for lack of the necessary inputs. With this loan he will buy all of the necessary inputs and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to improve crop production

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de  femmes du village de  Téné (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali) qui se connaissent bien. Toutes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec des coépouses et autres parents. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi vendent des céréales. En plus de la vente de céréales, elles font également de  la couture dont certaines sont même  célèbres.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 125.000 FCFA pour le cinquième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de céréales (fonio haricot etc.) et du matériel pour la couture. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi vendent leurs marchandises au marché de Téné et environs, à San et même à Bamako. Quant à la couture elle est faite à la maison et les produits vendus sur place et aux forains venant d’autres localités.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser  150 000 FCFA. de bénéfice chacune au cours de ce cycle qui servira pour le remboursement du prêt et  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of women of the village of Téné (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) who know one another well. They are all married and average 42 years of age and 5 children. They live in traditional families with co-wives and the parents of others. The women of the group sell grain. In addition, they also sew, and some of them are even famous.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. Loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 125,000 francs for the fifth loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of grain (fonio, beans, etc.) and some sewing supplies. The women sell their merchandise at the Téné marketplace and surrounding areas, in San, and even in Bamako. As for the sewing, this is done at home, and the goods are sold locally and to fair vendors, who come from other towns.

With this new loan, the group members each plan to realize a profit of 150,000 francs in the course of this cycle. The profits will serve to make loan payments and to address typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and sewing supplies

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma Luz O. D. S. vive en Soyapango departamento D. San Salvador  junto a su esposo y dos hijas, Norma se dedica a la elaboración negativos para cuadernos, Norma tiene muchos clientes en la zona D. San Salvador, donD. ella distribuye todos los negativos que produce; pero a veces su producción no alcanza a cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes;  es por ello que  Norma solicita un nuevo crédito, para la compra D. suficiente materia prima, para la elaboración D. estos negativos; ya que necesita producir más para llegar a mas lugares con su producto y cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes. Cabe mencionar que Norma ya ha obtenido créditos anteriormente en los cuales ha sido puntual es sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Norma Luz O. D. S. lives with her husband and two daughters in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She operates a business making prints for notebooks. Norma has lots of customers in San Salvador which she sells all the prints that she makes and sometimes she can't keep up with customer demand. That's why she's applying for a new loan. She wants to buy enough of the basic materials she needs to make the prints. She needs to make more so that she has enough to meet customer demand. It should be mentioned that Norma has received loans before and she has always been punctual in repaying them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda Suárez Martínez tiene la edad de 73 años, su estado civil soltera. Doña Imelda tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Imelda es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Imelda inicio por cuenta propia, además lo mas efectivo para ella es la venta de casa en casa y además en su casa de habitación tiene ciertas prendas para que sus clientes lleguen a su vivienda y este ha sido una de las actividades que mas le gusta. Los propósitos de Imelda son de mantener a sus clientes y proporcionarle lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento que solicita Imelda es para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que viajar a León o Managua y así obtener la compra de la ropa favorable. El sueño de Imelda es de establecer un lugar que represente las condiciones necesarias para presentar sus productos.
texts.en:
Imelda Suárez Martínez is 73 years of age and her civil state is single. Doña Imelda has four children and they are all working. Imelda's economic activity is the sales of used clothing. Since three years ago she has been dedicated to this business. Doña Imelda began working on her own. The most effective thing for her has been making sales from house to house, as well as having a room in her house for certain articles of clothing so that her clients can come to her home, and this has been the activity that she likes best. Imelda proposes to keep her clients and provide them with what they request. The financing that Imelda requests is for working capital since she has to travel to León or Managua and in this way obtain the favored clothing. Imelda's dream is to establish a space with the necessary conditions for displaying her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Artesanas Beni Loma Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapeguà, en la Cñia Beni Loma  distante a 15km de la Oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Fundacion Paraguaya y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa.  Buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida, estas personas crecieron gracias a este programa.  

Necesitan esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivas microempresas y lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.

Todas las integrates se dedican a la artesania.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguà, in Cñia Beni Loma, a 15km distance from the Office of Carapeguá, some women with scarce resources learned of the program committee of Entrepeneurial Women of the Paraguay Foundation, and they decided to meet in order to receive information about the program. They are looking for a little more support in order to build their family income and improve their quality of life through loans, these people grew thanks to this program. They need a loan to invest in their respective micro-enterprises and sustainable growth that helps them grow as a group and individually. All of the members are dedicated to artisan work.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn, cloth, fabric, etc. (for weaving).

loans.name: Gerardo Andrés

texts.en: Mr. Gerardo is 22 years old, single and lives in the city of Carapeguá in the San José district.  He lives with his parents in their own home. After he finished high school, Gerardo started his own small grocery store, and with his income, he has been able to sustain the daily expenses of his family.  He has not been able to afford going to college, as it would require more money than he can save right now. With this credit, he will buy sugar and herbs.

loans.use: The purchase of sugar and herbs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria completa. Vive en la Comunidad de Chinchero Sector Central.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace muchos años en otro Banco Comunal, pero en este Banco desde hace 7 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc, para su tienda.

Su mayor  deseo es ampliar se tienda y surtida y también le gustaría dedicarse a la crianza de animales.

A ella le gustan las actividades que se organizan y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Mercedes Z. is a member of the “Cajas Reales” Microfinance Institute, located in the Chucuito district of the Puno province, department of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 3 children. She completed elementary school and lives in the Chinchero Sector Central Community.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for many years through another microfinance institute, but she has been a member of this institute for 7 years. She started her business with a 300.00 PEN loan, which she used to purchase provisions.

At this time, she needs an 800.00 PEN loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, and other products for her general store.

Her biggest wish is to expand her store and have it well-stocked. She would also like to raise livestock.

She likes her microfinance institute’s activities and the way it helps her save.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Griva

texts.en:
Griva E. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 55 years old. Griva is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Griva owns and operates a business that provides motorcycle-for-hire services to local community members. Griva is just starting this business.

In 2006, Griva joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Griva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Griva is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a cab to attach to her motorcycle to improve the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Griva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase side car for the motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian A. is married and has four dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. His wife is a petty trader.

Christian sells provisions and building materials at Kwamikrom, which he has done since 2002. Christian uses his income solely to pay for the financial needs of his family. He will use the loan to purchase more provisions and building materials for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Christian plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and building materials to sell

loans.name: Cinthia's Group

texts.es:
El comité “Renacer” cumple actualmente su 4º ciclo, sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa sin mayores dificultades. El nombre de las integrantes junto con sus actividades comerciales son las siguientes: 

Cynthia A.	Fabricación  y Venta de sábanas
Melania G.	Venta de cosméticos
Susana V.	Despensa
Patricia R.	Despensa
Rosalia S.	Lavandería
Angelina R.	Kiosko
Nery R.	Venta de embutidos
Emilce P.	Venta de mercería
Maria P. 	Venta de ropas
Felipa A.	Venta de articulos varios
Carmen Z.	kiosko
Maria M. 	Venta de comestibles
Dionisia C.	Despensa
Miriam Estela B.	Venta de ropas
Nilda Bolaño 	Venta de comestibles
Cipriana S.	Venta de lencería
Gilda B.	Venta de perfumes
Ramona R.	Venta de comestibles
Myrian I.	Venta de comestibles
Maria G.	Venta de comestibles


  Utilizan su crédito para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya están realizando. Entre las mercaderías a ser compradas citamos: compra de insumos para la fabricación de comestibles (harina , carne,  aceite, huevos, condimentos) compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra venta de bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, compra de artículos de ocasión como ropas, guantes, bufandas, gorras etc. redoblan esfuerzos tratando de mejorar sus ingresos y así poder ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena preparación académica y por consiguiente una buena opción laboral.
texts.en:
The “Renacer” committee is currently completing its fourth cycle. It’s members are already productive, which is why each one has developed her own microenterprise without major difficulties. The names of the members, together with their business activities, are as follows:

Cynthia A., making and sale of bed sheets Melania G., cosmetics sales Susana V., mini-mart Patricia R., mini-mart Rosalia S., laundry Angelina R., kiosk Nery R., sale of sausages Emilce P., sale of dry goods Maria P., clothing sales Felipa A., sale of various articles Carmen Z., kiosk Maria M., food sales Dionisia C., mini-mart Miriam Estela B., clothing sales Nilda Bolaño, food sales Cipriana S., dry-goods sales Gilda B., perfume sales Ramona R., food sales Myrian I., food sales Maria G., food sales

They will use their loan to promote and diversify the businesses that they have already established. The merchandise to be purchased includes: ingredients for making food (flour, meat, oil, eggs, condiments), milk, yerba, flour, salt, breads and vegetables for later sale, purchase of drinks such as soft drinks, soda water, beers, wines, purchase of second-hand goods such as clothing, gloves, scarves, caps, etc.

They are redoubling their efforts, trying to increase their income and, thus, offer their children the possibility of getting access to good academic preparation and, as a result, good options for work.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for making food (flour, meat, oil, eggs, condiments), milk, yerba, flour, salt, breads and vegetables for later sale, purchase and sale of drinks such as  soft drinks, soda water, beers, wines, purchase of  second-hand goods such as clothing, gloves, scarves, caps, etc

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 03 hijos, ella  estudio educación superior técnica, vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa  

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra la compra de lana acrílica de colores, repuestos para maquina de tejer. Ella elabora prendas de vestir de abrigo.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de lanas al por mayor en Puno.
A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina es a member of the Community Bank New Future which is located in the district of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She completed post-secondary technical studies, and she lives in Santa Rosa neighborhood.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for eight years. Her first loan was for 300 new Soles. She invested the money in her handicrafts business.

She is now applying for a loan of 600 new Soles for the purchase of colored acrylic wools and replacement parts for her sewing machine. With these materials she makes overcoats.

Her wish is to open a shop and sell wool wholesale.

She likes attending meetings and saving money.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of colored acrylic wool and replacements parts for sewing machine.

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael Velásquez tiene la edad de 67 años,  habita en el barrio las Enramadas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ellos tienen seis hijos todos independientes, desde hace 31 años don Pedro trabaja como agricultor ya que sus padres le facilitaron el terreno para poderlo a trabajar y mantener a sus hijos , le agradece a AFODENIC, ya que a través de los fondo KIVA, le han apoyado durante diez ciclos para obtener una mejor producción y realizar sus proyecto , antes de este apoyo a don Velásquez se le dificultaba vender su cultivo ya que este carecía de insumos necesarios y fertilizantes . Lo cual le afectaba económicamente y no le permitía avanzar. Comprara fertilizantes y aplicara  sus cultivos para mejorar la producción.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para aplicar al cultivo

loans.name: Maweno

texts.en:
Maweno M. is currently in the business of selling sugar, soap and bread at the shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of sugar to sell.  Maweno is 24 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Rebecca works to help her husband to provide for the family. She is a petty trader. She runs a provisions store. Her store is by the roadside in her community.

Rebecca procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pagnes to sell

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Claudia T. se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de alimentos que son preparados por ella misma para ser ofrecidos en su localidad.
Ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años y ha buscado la manera de cómo salir adelante desarrollándose en la venta de los alimentos. El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de la materia prima como lo es la compra de los frijoles por quintal y el aceite para dar lugar a la preparación de los alimentos.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Sra. Claudia T. is known for being an excellent cook. She has a small business selling prepared dishes to the local residents.

Claudia has been engaged in this activity for four years and has looked for ways to develop her food business and move it forward. This loan will be used to buy ingredients such as beans by the quintal (46 kg.) and cooking oil for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Marjesa

texts.en:
Marjesa M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Marjesa is married and has 3 school-age children.

To make a living, Marjesa sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marjesa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marjesa joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marjesa is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 39 years old and is married with three children who are currently in school.

John has been a professional carpenter for the past eighteen years now. Carpentry has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He owns a carpentry shop where he manufactures all kinds of furniture work.

John says that for lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers. This he said slows down his work because he necessarily has to wait for funds from his customers before any work could begin which delays most often.

John requests the loan to enable him procure useful working tools and materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, wood, etc., to improve his efficiency. He believes this will improve his income status to ensure a good living for his family. He would grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and materials like polish, glue, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok M., 48, is a rice farmer who lives in Takeo province. She typically makes about US$2 a day. She is married and has five children living at home to support. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches fish and sells them at the local market. On average, he makes US$3 of profit every day.

Sok M. would like to make a new investment selling grocery items. To start this business, she would like to take out a loan of US$500. She believes this business chance will allow her to make more income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: glasses, linen, clothes

loans.name: Flor De Vena Natividad's Group

texts.en: Flor De Vena N. is from the village of Tipan. She is 56 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC.
