While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Flor De V. is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a dressmaking business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Flor De V. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Flor De V. is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 18th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 60-year-old married man and father of 2 children. He has owned a car painting shop for the past 40 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, Nabil has been able to meet his family needs and raise his children to become mature and independent. 

Today, Nabil is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new air compressor needed for his business. This would replace his long used and inefficient one.

loans.use: To purchase a new air compressor

loans.name: Ayub Kanithi

texts.en:
Ayub Kanithi N. operates a hardware shop at Muguga trading center. The shop is strategically situated along the busy highway. He has been doing this as his primary business for the last two years now.

Ayub is 25 years old, married and a father of one child. His wife Jacqueline is a business woman.

Ayub learned about KADET through some friends who were already members. He will be accessing his second loan with KADET and has not borrowed from other financiers.

Ayub wants to add more stock in his hardware shop. Although Ayub’s hardware shop is fairly new he hopes to relocate it to a bigger and more spacious building. This will enable him to stock more items frequently needed by his customers.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. lives with her four children and is married to a farmer. She has no educational background. Esi is a fishmonger at Abura. The smoked fish is locally called by the Fante people “eban”. It is normally small in size. 

Esi uses her income in helping her husband pay their rent and also take good care of her children. Esi will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase other varieties of fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Esi plans to smoke fish in larger quantity to supply the market women in Abura instead of selling it herself.

loans.use: add the loan to her initial capital to purchase other varieties of fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed M. is a businessman as well as a worker who has seven years of business experience. He lives at 52 Ngalu Road, Bo, and sells at home.

He is married with three children who are all schooling. He works in close partnership with his wife to bring up the children well. The wife does the selling in the daytime while her husband is at work.

He is applying for a loan in order to increase his stock level. He intends to use the proceeds from the loan to complete his house.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Tsedevsuren

texts.en:
Tsedevsuren, 31, lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent).  Tsedevsuren operates a wooden products manufacturing business. He participated in a carpentry training course in 2002 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has since started his own wooden products manufacturing business. Between 2003-2005, Tsedevsuren and his brother worked together to manufacture wooden products. 

After Tsedevsuren's wife graduated college, they moved together to Uvurhangai province. Tsedevsuren worked as a gas distributer  at an Umbar gas station between 2005 and 2009. In 2009, he went into business for himself again, and reopened his wooden product manufacturing business at  a rented workplace in a business development center in Uvurhangai province. In 2010, he built his own workplace on his own plot of land and started making wooden products, furniture, and ger parts. He is an experienced and skillful wooden products manufacturer, and a hardworking person. Tsedevsuren operates grocery store in from his yard as well.  Tsedevsuren says, “It feels great to enjoy the results of hard work. I am working to operate different businesses.”

 He is requesting a 2,290,000 MNT loan to purchase timber and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other necessary materials for a woodworking business

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther Maria tiene 45 años, Esther tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación pues no es el primer financiamiento que solicita.  Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, pues sus inicios se dieron con su hijo pues él fue quien le dio la idea de empezar este negocio que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de la casa. Su deseo es salir a ofrecer sus productos a comunidades más alejadas que las de ella, así obtendrá nuevos clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther María, 45, has been collaborating with the Fundación for a long time; this isn’t her first loan request. For over 13 years she has been a used clothing merchant. She started the business with her son because he was the one who had the original idea for it because it would be a way to help meet household expenses. She hopes to be able to go out to communities that are further away to sell her merchandise in order to get new customers. This funding will be used to buy raw material needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: D. Lucienne est née en 1961 et vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Lobozounkpa, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Lucienne est mariée à LISSANON Paul et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Lucienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du foyer. Lucienne  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Lucienne mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, huile de palme, etc.) à son domicile. Lucienne s'approvisionne au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. C'est la deuxième fois que Lucienne sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Lucienne avait bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lucienne D. was born in 1961 and for the last 20 years has lived in Lobozounkpa in the Aborney Calavi commune. Lucienne is married to Paul LISSANON and is mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Lucienne lives with her husband and two children. Together the couple meets the various household needs. Lucienne didn't attend school. For about 10 years, Lucienne has worked selling different sauces (tomato, onion, chilli, palm oil) from home. She gets her supplies from the Cococodji market in the Abomey Calavi commune. It's the second time that Lucienne has requested financial support from ALIDé, with a view to strengthening her business and better meeting customer demands. Lucienne diligenty repaid her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de divers condiments.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 30-year-old farmer. He is married with two children who go to school. He does dairy farming and sells milk to Fresha Co-operative, a well-known milk-processing company in Kenya. He has been in the business for four years and hopes to expand the business.  

Paul joined the Nuru investment group in Faulu Kenya so as to access a loan easily. Through the group, he has managed to service one loan worth 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has been guaranteed another loan of 40,000 KES by the group. He will use this loan to buy a dairy cow so as to increase production.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta O. is from the village of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is 45 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods to the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,850 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa P. is from the town of Talibon. She is 25 years old, married and has 4 young children. Her eldest is only aged 8. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch. 

Teresa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and fishing equipments. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Teresa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and fishing equipment

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Beatriz D. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad  corazón de Jesús, lugar en donde se puede admirar unos paisajes sin igual, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Doña Rosa se dedica al arreglo de casas, trabaja en esta actividad desde la corta edad de 15 años, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a viernes de 7 a.m. a 13 p.m., lo de más de su tiempo lo dedica a la venta de productos YANBAL, lleva 1 año trabajando en este negocio.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación, sintiéndose muy contenta con sus amigas ya que conforman un lindo grupo de mujeres que luchan para entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad y un bebe de 9 meses, su primer hijo se encuentra en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos ya que su sueño es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Beatriz D. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Corazón de Jesús community, a place where one can admire unequaled views. The population is dedicated to farming and the raising of animals. Doña Rosa makes a living cleaning houses. She has been working at this since she was 15 years old. Her working hours are from Monday to Friday from 7am to 1pm. The rest of the time she sells YAMBAL products, this she has been doing for a year. This is her second loan with the Foundation. She feels very happy with her friends, they form a nice group of women working to bring a better future for their children. Mrs. Rosa is 30 years old, married and has one son of 8 years and a 9 month old baby. Her older son is in the neighborhood school. Her husband is a builder. They live in their own home. With this new loan from the Espoir Foundation she will purchase more cosmetics for resale. It is her dream to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yambal creams, perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tô

texts.en:
X. Tô Thị (20213050017) is a 33 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, X. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling internet connection & services in the local community.  X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  X. is now requesting a new loan of 8,736,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en: Jacques is 26 years old. He is married with two children aged 1 month and 2 years. He sells bananas. His wife is a farmer. He says that his business is well known for selling bananas at competitive prices and, also, he pays his taxes on time. Jacques has spent 15 years in this business and when he gets a loan he will buy more bananas to keep the business going. With the profit he will repair his house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 31años, lucha por salir adelante, ella está convive con Miguel, de 33 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos; Franco de 8 y Dairon de 1 año de nacido; como una gran familia ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Palcamayo. La principal actividad de sus habitantes es la agricultura, es por que desde niña se dedicó al cuidado de los terrenos de cultivo de sus padres a quienes ayudaba con mucha dedicación. Con el tiempo, pudo comprarse su propio terreno de cultivo; ahora siembra gladiolos, espinaca, lechuga y manzanilla, pero asegura que este último le brinda mayores ingresos; por eso hace ya dos años que vienen elaborando filtrantes de manzanilla (pequeñas bolsas que se colocan en agua caliente para beber). Pero su procedimiento es artesanal por ello es que trabaja duro para poder dar el gran paso de modernizar y expandir su negocio. Ella esta segura de poder progresar en este negocio ya que las propiedades curativas de la semilla en las diferentes enfermedades como la ulcera, hace que esta planta tenga mayor demanda. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy contenta con el éxito obtenido, asegura que más adelante, con la ayuda de su banco comunal podrá hacer realidad su sueño. Con el crédito que obtendrá; podrá comprar 2 mil kilos de manzanilla que sumados a los 2 mil Kilos que sembró; podrá procesar una buena cantidad de filtrantes de manzanilla.
texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and works hard to get ahead. She lives with Miguel, 33 years old, and they have 2 sons; Franco, 8 years old, and Dairon, 1 year old. The family lives together in their own house, located in the rural area of Palcamayo. The main economic activity of the people who live there is agriculture. 

Esther took care of her parents' farm land from the time she was a young girl, and she did so with dedication. Over time she was able to buy her own land; she now plants gladiolas, spinach, lettuce, and chamomile; it is this last one that brings in the greatest income. Because of this, for the past two years they have been making chamomile tea bags (small bags that are placed in hot water for drinking). Her process is by hand and so she is working hard so that she can make the changes to modernize and expand her business. She is sure that she will make progress with this business because the curative properties of the seed for different illnesses, such as ulcers, keep this plant in high demand. 

This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very happy with the success she has had. She is sure that, with the help of her communal bank, she will make her dream a reality. With the loan she will buy 2 thousand pounds of chamomile, which, added to the 2 thousand pounds she harvested, will be enough for her to process a good quantity of chamomile tea bags.

loans.use: To buy two thousand pounds of chamomile.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es: Concepción del Carmen P. D. V., resiD. en Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante D. productos varios, así mismo vive junto a dos hijos D. 18 y 16 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos más los cuales son fundamentales en este tipo D. negocios. El negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Lourdes en donD. posee varios años D. dedicarse a este oficio, y por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar, contando con varios clientes fijos. Concepción cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Concepción solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción del Carmen P. D. V. resides in Colón, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. There she lives with her husband, who works as a merchant selling various products, and their two children (ages 18 and 16) who are in school. Concepción has a store where she sells basic necessities for the home and personal products such as soap, shampoo, bread, milk, sweets, basic grains, and other products that are usually found in this type of business. Her store is located at the Lourdes Market where she has gained several years of experience. As a result, she has become well-known in the market and accumulated several established customers.

Concepción has many good references from her neighbors and friends. They indicate that she is a very responsible and hardworking person who is dedicated entirely to the welfare of her household. Concepción is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with everything she needs to expand her inventory and offer more products to her customers. This will help improve her earnings and allow her to get ahead alongsiD. her family.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Preventiva

texts.es: Preventiva tiene 37 años, vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, conejos, carneros y pollos, en donde su prioridad es alimentarlos para que tenga el peso exacto para poder venderlos en el mercado mayoristas de su ciudad. De esta manera se gana la vida, vendiendo estos animales a sus asiduos compradores, en donde siempre la esperan para llevar la mercadería que ofrece. Le gusta mucho su actividad porque se entretiene mucho, además la crianza de estos animales no es difícil, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijas y con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda a su esposo con los constantes gastos del hogar. Paralelamente a esta actividad, siembra papa y maíz cuya cosecha comercializa también en el mercados de la zona donde vive. Como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de animales, ya que sabe que este negocio es muy rentable. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, asimismo agradece a topas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales y otra parte en el pago de un terreno que esta comprando para poder construir su casa, así como su granja.
texts.en:
Preventiva is 37 years old and lives with her spouse and their 2 daughters in a rented house.  She has been raising animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits,  rams and chickens for 4 years.  She makes it a priority to feed them adequately so that they reach the exact weight in order to be able to sell them at the wholesale market in the city.  This is how she earns a living, selling these animals to her regular buyers.  They are always waiting for her to bring her merchandise.  She loves this job because she finds it very entertaining and it is not difficult.  Occasionally, her daughters help her and with the earnings she is able to help her husband with the never ending household expenses.  In addition to raising animals, she grows potatoes and corn that she sells in the markets in the region where she lives.  

Since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to buy more animals because she knows that this is a profitable business.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a part of her communal bank because all the members are  very supportive and responsible people.  She is grateful to everyone who will be a part of making this loan a reality as it will be very useful in advancing her business.  She will use part of the loan to buy more animals and the other part to make payment on a piece of land that she is buying to build her house and farm on.

loans.use: To buy more animals and to construct her house and farm

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada A. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 37 years-old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Amada owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and junk food in the local community. Amada has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Amada joined  Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Amada is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Merlinda's Group

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao.  She is 37 years old.  Merlinda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merlinda is married and has 7 school-aged children.  To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing rice for sale.  She has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase farm supplies.  Merlinda is requesting her 14th loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for educational purposes. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For educational purposes

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles Gáleo  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien labora arduamente con el firme propósito de salir adelante. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en  la venta de ropa usada el cual lo inicio hace 5 años con pequeña cantidad de productos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de paca de ropa para con el fin de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: María de los Ángeles Gáleo is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works hard with the firm intention of getting ahead in life.  She has a small business selling used clothes that she started 5 years ago with a small quantity of products.  She will invest her loan in buying a bundle of clothes with the aim of improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and food for resale

loans.name: Namuuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Namuuntsetseg is 31-year-old divorcee, who lives with her only son Enkhtuvshin 13, in rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends a local secondary school.  Mrs.Namuuntsetseg is a professional hairdresser. Between 2004-2009 she used to work for a beauty parlor as a hairdresser. 

In 2009 she decided to start her own small business and established a private company. Soon afterward she rented a room and opened  “Namuun” beauty  salon. She hires one beautician and one manicurist in her salon. Since the start her business has flourished and at the moment she has her own trusted permanent customers. 

She is a  very enthusiastic, self-motivated person. Also she said that her communicative character helps in her business a lot. In the future she is planning to expand her business by opening one more branch and employing more people. At the moment, the loan she is requesting will be used to replenish beauty products and to replace old hairdressing and beauty equipment.

loans.use: to replenish beauty products and to replace old hairdressing and beauty equipment

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Em T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. To improve production, Mrs. Em T. is seeking a loan to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Koeun Port, is a traditional healer who also earns some money to support the family. Through their activity, they support two children who are studying in a local public school.

Four people make up this group from Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. Mrs. Em T. is the group leader who has been selected by the other members. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Abdilia

texts.es:
La señora Abdilia, habita en el municipio  de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo que labora como comerciante, ellos tienen cinco hijos tres mayores de edad e independiente, el de 18 y 16 años, estudian su secundaria y le apoyan con las actividades de hogar.
Desde hace diez años se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas por temporada de cada frutas o verduras, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no optar con un capital suficiente para hacer efectivo cada compra para poder trabajar y sacar hacia adelante a su dos hijos que necesitan tanto el apoyo de su mamá como el del papá. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos para vender como: frutas, verduras, granos básicos, leña entre otros.
texts.en:
Abdilia lives with her husband, who works as a merchant, in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She and her husband have five children.  The three oldest are independent, and the 18 year old and 16 year old go to high school.  They help her with the household chores.

She has been buying and selling seasonal crops of fruits or vegetables for ten years.  The greatest difficulty that presents itself is not having enough money to pay for each purchase.  She needs the purchases to be able to work and get her two children ahead.  They really need support from their mother as much as from their father.

She will use the loan to buy products to sell.  She will buy products like fruit, vegetables, and basic grains, among others.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 36 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns a retail fishing business. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonio Jose

texts.es:
Antonio José nació en el campo y es por esto que conoce muy bien como criar animales y cultivar la tierra, es por esto que él iniciará el negocio de engorde de gallinas para la venta y producción de huevos, sin embargo Antonio solo podrá dedicar en horas de la tarde a esta labor ya que él también trabaja en una empresa en el cargo de oficios varios.

El quiere que sus hijos aprendan de esta labor y que sea su legado, por esto ellos serán quienes en la mañana cuiden de los animales y así además podrá tener otros ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio José was born in the countryside and so he knows very well how to raise animals and cultivate the land.  For this reason, he started a business fattening hens for sale and producing eggs.  However, Antonio can only work on these tasks in the evening as he also works for a company in several positions.

Antonio José would like his children to learn this trade and for it to be his legacy to them.  They will be the ones who raise the animals in the future.  In addition, it will enable Antonio José to make extra income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy S. has been living in Kompong Cham province, and selling Khmer noodles. She typically earns around $1.33 in profits each day.  She was a widow, then she re-married, but she is now divorced from her husband. She lives with her two young children, who are enrolled in school. Luy S. is worried about her old house, and she does not have enough money to build a new house. In order to deal with this issue, she is requesting a loan from Kiva through HKL to construct her new house.

loans.use: to construct her new house

loans.name: Elshan

texts.ru:
Elshan jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Elshan yavlyayetsya IDP persnom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Elshan M. 39 let. 
On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, v osnovnom razvodit korov. Seychas Elshan nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov. On prodayet yogurt, Kefir i moloko v magazini.
texts.en: Elshan is married with two children.  Elshan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved family.  Elshan M. is 39 years old.  He has been a herdsman for seven years, primarily raising cattle.  Now, Elshan needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  He sells yogurt, kefir, and milk in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 59 years old, she has nine children who are ages 20-40 years old. Only two are in school while the others are already married. Her husband is a farmer while Irene sells food stuffs such as beans, sorghum etc. This business has enabled her pay school fees for her children and build a house in which she stays. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more food and make more profits. She plans to open up a wholesale store in the market where she hopes to get more clients. With the profits she plans to feed her family and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy food for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and married. He has four children.

Juan works hard to provide for his family. He has been running a general store for 10 years and also earns an income from his trisikad transport (a  bicycle with a passenger seat attached to the side).

He requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for his general store and tools for his trisikad transport.

Juan has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Juan aspires to save enough money so he can afford to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy items for his general store and tools for his trisikad transport.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells tomatoes, oranges, watermelons and pineapple at Elmina. a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.  Ekua has been selling tomatoes, oranges and pineapple for 2 years. She assists her husband in paying the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building an awning where she can sell the fruits.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es: Hipólito nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Hipolito está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Hipólito trabajo como locutor deportivo  en el radio Metropolitano. Ya son varios años que se dedica a esta profesión y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad  Hipólito requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como CD y materiales discográficos. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Hipólito was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  He is 44 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in the same city in which he was born.  Hipólito works as a sports commentator on Radio Metropolitano.  He has been in this job for several years and is doing well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Hipólito needs a loan to buy work materials such as CDs and records.  He is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, his friends invited him to join Asociación Arariwa's "Unión Latina" community bank.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as CDs and records

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha tem 63 anos de idade, vive na casa pròpria com sua familia, é mãe de 8 filhos dos 25 aos 42 anos de idade nenhum vai a Escola.  responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa. Fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, consegue mensalmente poupar 3.000.00mt na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca sai do Distrito, iniciou negócio na tentativa de aumentar a renda familiar. Anos depois da fixação do Mercado Informal que se encontra perto da sua casa, ela constroi quartos de aluguer para acomodar aos estrangeiros que vêem fazer intercâmbio de produtos naquele Mercado que funciona 2 vezes por semana(Quartas e Sabados) tem de lucro 10.000.00mt. Porque faziam refeições fora da sua casa, ela abre um estabelecimento em sua casa para satisfazer a necessidade dos mesmos fazendo refeições e vendendo produtos de primeira necessidade. Conta com ajuda da sua filha que se encontra na gerência do estabelecimeto e consegue de lucro 3.000.00mt e poupa 2.000.00mt no Banco. 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade( farinhas, sumos, caldos refrescos e mais) para revenda. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto para aceder a outros empréstimos, conhece a hluvuku atraves dos vizinhos que são clientes da instituição
texts.en:
Marta was born in the district of Namaacha.  She is 63 and lives in her own home with her family.  She is the mother of 8 children who range in age from 25 to 42.  None of them is still in school.  She is also financially responsible for 2 grandchildren that live with her.  She studied through the 4th grade but didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  She saves 3,000 meticals a month in her bank account.

She never left Naamacha.  She started her business to try to help her family with their income.  Years later, since there is an informal market near her home, she constructed rooms to rent out to accomodate strangers that come to trade products there.  The market is held twice a week on Thursdays and Saturdays.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 meticals.  Because her guests were eating their meals outside of her house, she started making meals to satisfy this need and also sells basic goods.  Her daughter helps her with the general management of her business and makes 3,000 meticals a month.  She saves 2,000 meticals a month in her bank.

This is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy basic goods to resell. (flour, juice, soup, soft drinks, and more).  She is confident that she will make her payments on time so she can request more loans.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through two neighbors who are also clients of the institution.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (flour, juice, soup, soft drinks, and more)

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tissie is married and a mother of four adult children. She is 54 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Tissie has a retail shop at home to earn a living. She is engaged in selling different food items like food in pouches, candies, biscuits and canned goods in the local community. She has been running her business for ten years. She earns a total monthly of PHP 4,000.00 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 at GDMPC to purchase rice and corn grain to sell.

Tissie has been member of GDMPC for two years. In the future,Tissie hopes to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grain to sell.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 39-year-old mother who has a small retail business selling clothes at home in Al Zarqa. She has been engaged in this business for two years and is able to support her husband who has a store selling fruits and vegetables. Now Nabeela want to have her own store to be able to show the products that she sells in a more professional way, and to add other types of clothes to sell. It is for this reason that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to have her own clothing store.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
David is 29 years old and from the village Kontuati, Imereti District, West Georgia. He is unmarried and lives with his family which includes his parents, a 31-year-old brother, and a 20-year-old sister. David works in a local carpentry workshop as painter. Along with his regular job, he is also involved with his family’s farm activities. His family owns three cows and David’s mother produces cheese and sells it on the open market. David’s family also grows maize and cultivates nut trees on their 1.25 hectare plot. The corn that they raise primarily goes to the dairy and they sell approximately 200 kilograms of nuts locally. 

David is requesting a loan to renovate his kitchen which is old and uncomfortable. Once the renovation is complete and the kitchen is equipped with better appliances, the family will enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a kitchen renovation

loans.name: Idonel

texts.es: Idonel vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y tiene 8 hijos en las edades de 24 a 43 años.  Allí tiene una panadería donde produce todo tipo de panes, que vende desde su casa y directamente puerta a puerta. Su experiencia data desde cuando trabajó como empleado de una panadería donde aprendió a elaborar panochas, pan piñita, pan de queso, y toda la línea de galletería y pudinería. En su panadería vende de contado y tiene una infraestructura para el potencial crecimiento y desarrollo de esta actividad, pero el gran desafío de no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para expandirese cada vez más es obstáculo para crecer; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen y de contado, para ganar descuentos y ser mucho más competitivo. Así mismo con su crédito adecuará la infraestructura física de su negocio, generando mejores condiciones productivas para el desempeño de esta actividad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Idonel lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and eight children who range in age from 24 to 43. He has a bakery where he produces all types of bread, which he sells from his home or directly by going door-to-door. His experience goes back to when he worked as an employee at another bakery where he learned how to make corn pancakes, sweet rolls, cheese bread, and all types of cookies and puddings. Idonel conducts cash sales in his bakery and has the infrastructure for potential growth and development of his business. However, his greatest challenge is not having sufficient operating capital for expansion, which is an obstacle he must overcome each time he wants to grow.

For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy materials and supplies in large volumes and with cash. This will allow him to receive discounts so that he can be more competitive. At the same time, he will use the loan to remodel the physical infrastructure of his business. This will provide better conditions for being productive, which will help to develop his food business.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies in bulk and to remodel the physical infrastructure of his business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is a business woman aged 49. She is married and blessed with three children. For the last 4 years, she has been selling cushions and curtains to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy curtains. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more business oriented.

loans.use: To buy curtains

loans.name: Gelmy Yolanda

texts.es:
La joven Gelmy tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Cerro de Marcovia, Gelmy esta casada y tiene dos hijos, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para salir adelante.
Gelmy se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad en la cual trabaja muy fuerte para generar buenos ingresos y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida y darle una buena educacion a sus hijos. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus sabrosas tortillas.
texts.en:
Gelmy, age 27, lives in the Cerro de Marcovia village. Gelmy is married and has two children.  She and her husband work hard in order to get ahead.

Gelmy makes and sells tortillas.  She has been in this business for two years.  She works very hard in order to generate good income.  That is the way to have a better quality of life and to give her children a good education.

She will use the loan to buy supplies to make her delicious tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime water, and firewood.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 31, married and has two infant children. She works retailing gasoline in their village to supplement her husband's income. She has operated this business for more than six years and earns a profit of P6,000 a month. She wants to sell more gasoline to increase her income, but due to inadequate capital, she wants to ask for an additional capital of P8,000 to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell in their village. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of gasoline to sell in their village.

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman with two grown children – one attends university, the other is in college. Her husband is self-employed as a private medical practitioner. Risper operates a poultry business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for almost a year, as well as operating a medical clinic. Her greatest business challenge is getting supplies during the low tourist season. Her largest monthly expenses are rent and employee salaries at the clinic. Risper rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Risper will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase baby chicks from the countryside. Risper aspires to expand the business and become a wholesale supplier. She joined Yehu because of their affordable interest rates, flexibility and sufficient repayment times.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicks from the countryside.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Josephine  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Josephine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Luzmery

texts.es:
Luzmery, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja hace 11 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos de 11, 5, 3 y 2 meses de nacida. Ellos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de La Unión. Luz, como la llaman de cariño, se dedica a la panadería. Desde el mes de mayo que el horno y el local se los compró a su suegro, ahora con mayor independencia puede disponer del negocio de acuerdo a sus necesidades. De ese modo, se encarga de preparar panes todas las noches, los que vende todas las mañanas en la puerta de su casa, y que aún no tiene un local adecuado para expenderlos. “Diario invierto 70 soles, comprando harina, azúcar y manteca; del preparado salen 25 latas de masa y por lata obtengo 35 panes”, explica Luz, además comenta que inmediatamente recupera sus 70 soles de capital y gana otros 70 soles, “es muy rentable”, agrega. En el trabajo apoyan su esposo y un personal al que pagan mensualmente, por ser una labor ardua y cansada. Antes, ella y su esposo vivían en una casa alquilada, ahora la compraron. Sus ansías de progreso no descansan, ahora están tramitando la licencia de funcionamiento para una bodega y panadería a la vez. Con su ayuda, Luzmery podrá acceder a su primer préstamo de MFP, por esa razón se muestra firme en su idea de pagar sus cuotas los días programados. Con el dinero del crédito, ella podrá comprar más insumos para la preparación de panes, tales como sacos de harina, sacos de azúcar y bolsas de manteca. 

a
texts.en: Luzmery, 27, and her partner have been together for 11 years.  They have a 2-month old baby and three older children who are 11-, 5-, and 3-years old, respectively  They live in a house they own in La Union.  Luz, as she's know, operates a bakery business.  She bought the bakery from her father-in-law in May so she can now manage it in a way that better suits her.  She makes batches of bread each night and sells what she makes in the mornings after.  She sells the bread from her house because she doesn't have a large enough shop for selling.  Luz says, "I spend 70 soles a day buying flour, sugar and butter to make" [a nightly batch of bread].  She says, too, that she makes back the 70 soles she spends on supplies plus another 70 soles.  "It's very profitable", she adds.  Her husband helps her with the business.  She also has an employee who she pays by the month to help her with the difficult and tiring work.  She and her husband rented before, but they own their own house now.  Luz's drive to get ahead knows no bounds: she is processing the paperwork to get the licenses she needs to operate the business as both a bakery and a shop.  With your help, Luzmery will be able to secure her first MFP loan.  She is committed to repaying the loan on time and says she will use it to buy flour, sugar, butter and the other supplies she needs to operate her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery business.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es: Ynes tiene 39 años de edad es madre de 02 hijos, la cual han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta ambulatoria de frutas, la cual lleva 07 años laborando de esta manera, este negocio nació ya que su madre se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de frutas pues ella es quien la abastece con las frutas, gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo a logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos. Ynes es madre soltera ella ha tenido que trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante sola a sus hijos.  Ynes solicito el préstamo para invertir en su negocio comprando frutas como tuna, palta y chirimoya y así tener que ofrecer a sus  clientes. A futuro a Ynes le gustaría alquilar un local en un lugar céntrico donde pueda ofrecer sus frutas. Ynes es integrante de la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Sembrando Esperanza” grupo conformado por 07 mujeres trabajadoras que se comprometen a trabajar bien con el Programa- Prosperidad ellas están muy agradecidos con la ayuda brindada porque pueden hacer posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Ynes is 39 years old and has two children who have been her motivation to get ahead in life.  Her business is selling fruit as an itinerant vendor.  She has been working in this way for seven years.  Her business came about as her mother grows and harvests fruit and she supplies her with her fruit.  Thanks to her efforts and hard work, Ynes has managed to improve her home and support her children.  She is a single mother and has had to work hard to provide for her children on her own.

Ynes requested this loan to invest in her business, buying fruit such as prickly pear, avocados and custard apples, so that she has enough to offer her customers.  In the future, Ynes would like to hire some premises in a central location where she can sell her fruit.

Ynes is a member of the 'Sembrando Esperanza' (Sowing Hope) community bank.  This group is comprised of seven hard-working women who pledge to work well within the Prosperidad (Prosperity) program.  They are very grateful for the help they have been offered because it will enable them to make progress.

loans.use: to buy prickly pear, avocados and custard apples

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por la comunidad de San Fernando en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar que se caracteriza por la belleza de su naturaleza y su mayor atracción es La Laguna de Busa, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, son personas muy amables y de un corazón cálido.

Doña Rosa tiene 29 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 10 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el extranjero ya que a migrado para mejorar la economía de su hogar. 

La Señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuida de sus hijos, en su casa cría y vende pollos y cuyes. Ella  es parte de una asociación en donde sus integrantes se dedican a la elaboración de yogur y conservas de una fruta de la región.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios secundarios, cursar los  estudios universitarios en las carreras de Licenciatura en Sociales y ser Ingeniera Agrónoma.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the Génesis communal bank. She lives in the San Fernando community in Cuenca city, an area known for the beauty of its nature. The main attraction is the Laguna de Busa. The residents work in agriculture and raise animals. They are kind, warm-hearted people.

Mrs. Rosa is 29, married, and has two children ages 3 and 10. Her oldest child goes to school in the city. Her husband works outside of the country, as he has emigrated in order to improve their income.

Mrs. Rosa does housework and cares for her children. She raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs in her home. She is part of an association whose members make yoghourt and preserves from a local fruit.

This is her second loan in the communal bank. She joined the bank at the invitation of her mother. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to finish her high school and go to university to study social sciences and become an agriculturalist.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tuyangatane Group

texts.en: Tabia, who is in her 20's, is married, has two children and earns a living by running a beauty parlor. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and makes a small monthly profit. She is applying for her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy supplies for her beauty saloon. She has successfully paid back all of these loans and is now applying for a new one, which she will also use to buy more supplies. Her dream is to one day build her own house. Tabia will share this loan with her loan group, which is called "Tuyangatane" and has 15 members. Each member of the group will hold the others accountable for paying back their share of this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en:
Nana Ama lives with her husband and seven dependents. She works buying fresh fish from the market and then smoking them to sell at Ankwanda near Elmina. Nana Ama uses her income to help her husband to pay school fees for their children. 

Nana Ama is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. This will result in an increased income that she will save for the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy and smoke fresh fish

loans.name: Bader

texts.en: Bader, 21 years old, is one of six brothers and sisters. He is studying to become a nurse in the Applied University and he is now in his third year. He has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester so he can graduate as soon as possible and get a job to help support his family.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Paul Walter

texts.es:
Paúl es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Paúl se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Gastronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chicharrón de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Paúl trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, todos los días desde tempranas horas de mañana él sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, Paúl puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Paúl se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizar la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi, tales como: carburador, faros, llantas, entre otros; de esta manera Paúl tendrá su vehículo en buenas condiciones para así seguir trabajando, con ello él espera poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos, para así poco a poco lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y un hombre de bien.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Kakamega. Kakamega is located in Western Kenya and is famous for the Kakamega Forest, the only tropical rain forest in Kenya. It is a very good location for beekeeping due to the old growth trees in the forest and the concentration of farms in the area, which provide bees with a variety of foliage. 

Philip is married and has six children. His wife is a nurse, while he works in the farming industry. He has been farming for three years and he is currently growing vegetables in greenhouses. Philip is excited about beekeeping because it would help him earn some extra income. 

This would be Philip’s first loan through Honey Care. He would like to use the proceeds to purchase beehives. He intends to use any income he generates from his beekeeping activities to pay for his children's school fees and to maintain his home. Philip’s hope for the future is to be able to package his honey for re-sale and to educate the community on beekeeping.

loans.use: to produce honey by purchasing beehives

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Everline a young farmer from Nandihills in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Everline is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Everline passionately loves farming and from farming, she has been able to earn a decent income and she attributes all this success to hard work and determination. Although she makes profits, she has always wanted to increase her farming and start a cereal-selling business. 

The main challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is seeking a loan to buy cereals. Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Nandihills and through your loan, she intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in her village and local market. There is no doubt that through your loan Everline's life is permanently going to change and she will assure her school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tabitha Wanjiku would like to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Djaretou

texts.en:
Mrs Djaretou is married with two children. She has sold charcoal and corn for five years. Her strategy of selling is to distribute goods to her clients as soon as she makes storage room. This means that she has permanent clients; she knows them well, and their business and their family situation. She often sells some of her charcoal at the local market. Some customers pay cash, others pay after ten or fifteen days; in this way she increases the number of her clients day by day and all her goods are sold. She benefits from a strong return on investment, which permits her to help her husband to support her family.

Mrs Djaretou is one of the HELP Africa women beneficiary groups called “Yerima-Djaretou.” The five women of this group are asking for a loan of $500 dollars total.

With this loan, she can account for the entirety of the needed charcoal stock.

loans.use: Purchase charcoal

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is a 37-year-old single mother of five children, Melanie (17), Elmuruiz (15), Jennifer (12), Almando (10), and Camillo (7). She currently does not own a store of her own, but sells frozen fresh squeezed juices and small baked goods out of a cooler that she carries around with her. With this money she is hoping to buy a new juicer, a bigger cooler, and then the fresh fruit and other materials to make the food she sells. She would eventually like to be able to have her own store and be able to sell more, since she is her children's sole provider.

Note: Paula is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $700 loan for their respective businesses and each will be accountable to the others for repaying their share of this loan. This group-lending method strengthens social ties in the community and helps ensure that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families. This money will go towards the next loan received by this Bank of Hope; once they finish paying back their current loan it will be activated.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and materials

loans.name: Docas

texts.en: Docas is a poultry farmer and she is happy with her kind of business. She raises birds & buys bird feed. She is 64 years of age and a married mother of 6 children. She hopes to expand her business with the above amount of $800 by buying more birds and feed. She has been in this business since 1999 and been a LAPO leader for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy more birds & bird feed

loans.name: Cahangir

texts.en: C. Cahangir was born in the Gubadli region, situated in the West of Azarbaijan. He is 54 years old and the father of five children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east of Azerbaijan. He is homeless and staying in a worker’s hostel in Sumgayit city. Cahangir opened his business 1998. He started selling a variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family’s food and important consumption needs. In 2004 Cahangir borrowed $300 from Normicro, expanded his business and bought necessary fruits. Next time he borrowed $600 and increased his business. Now, he wants to borrow an $800 loan to open a larger vegetable section of his business and he hopes to further improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to open a large vegetable section of his counter and to improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing for his sales and to construct a proper sewing studio in his home

loans.name: Leornard

texts.en: Leonard is a hard working entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable shop in the Vituka area, a business he has been doing for the past five years. He has been with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the last four years, and has been graduating from one loan to the next, a sign of growth of his business. He gets his fruits and vegetables from the surrounding agricultural regions. He is in need of USD 1200 to help him buy storage equipment for his perishable fruits and get more space.

loans.use: Buy storage equipment and get more space

loans.name: I Made Wenten

texts.id:
50 year old I Made wenten lives in Manistutu village in West Bali. 90% of the villagers work as farmers. I Made Wenten's neighbors mostly farms rice as the irrigation is very good for rice. As a farmer himself, I Made Wenten knows the needs of his neighbors during the planting season. Farmers in I Made Wenten's village really needs more fertilizer to improve productivity. However, it is difficult to procure fertilizer because the there are no nearby fertilizer vendors. Seeing this condition, I made Wenten saw a business opportunity. I made Wenten started selling fertilizer in addition to working his own farm. With DINARI loans, I made WEnten hopes to purchase more fertilizer from wholesaler to be resold. His farmer neighbors are so thankful to I made Wenten's effort to make it easier for them to obtain fertilizer. I Made Wenten also provides delivery service. This business really increased I Made Wenten's earnings. So he would be very thankful if his loan is approved.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

I Made Wenten, 50 tahun, tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa di Bali Barat yang mana hampir 90 % penduduknya bermata pencaharian sebagai petani. Khusus untuk lingkungan I Made Wenten, sebagian besar petani bercocok tanam dengan menanam padi. Hal ini disebabkan karena pengairan diwilayah tersebut mencukupi untuk menanam padi. Sebagai seorang petani, I Made Wenten paham akan kebutuhan para petani pada saat masa tanam. Petani di desa I Made Wenten sangat membutuhkan pupuk untuk meningkatkan produktifitas sawahnya. Namun yang menjadi kendala adalah sulitnya mencari pupuk karena selain jarak pedagang pupuk yang cukup jauh, ketersediaan pupuk pun sangat minim. Melihat hal ini, I Made Wenten menganggap sebagi peluang bisnis yang bisa diandalkan. Selain tetap mengerjakan sawahnya sendiri, I Made Wenten melayani penjualan beraneka jenis pupuk yang diperlukan oleh petani. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, I Made Wenten membeli pupuk di pedagang besar dan memasarkannya kembali. Para petani merasa sangat terbantu dengan usaha I Made Wenten, karena mereka dapat dengan mudah memperoleh pupuk. Satu hal yang sangat dihargai oleh para petani adalah layanan antar oleh I Made Wenten kepada para pembeli. Dengan usaha ini, I Made Wenten merasa sangat terbantu dari segi perekonomiannya dan ia sangat berterima kasih atas pinjaman yang didapatnya.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Bakery A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Edith N.. She is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to boost business. Edith is 35 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 3 to 21 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start selling both fruit and vegetables.

Edith is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Agnes N., Rose N., and Noreen N.. Harriet N. has a business in food selling and wants to add working capital. Agnes N. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to boost business. Rose N. operates a business selling fish and wants to add capital. Noreen N. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to stock more vegetables.

loans.use: To add more working capital to vegetable business

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is 48 years old and lives with his family in the town of Tyre in southern Lebanon. He has five children, and makes a living selling yogurt and milk. He has applied for his third loan from Al Majmoua, and will use the money to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Kuwet A 2041-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sunday R.. She has a grocery and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sunday is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 6 children and they go to school. Each week, Sunday makes approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Sunday is joined in her small group by Orufa J., Teresa J., Alice K., and Mary K.. Orufa J. has grocery business and wants to pay the school fees for her children. Teresa J. is currently operating a business selling phoso and wants a loan for construction. Alice K. operates a bread business and wants to expand the business. Mary K. has a retail business and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Gairat

texts.ru:
Gairat K. lives in the Rudaki area. He lives with his family and is married with 3 children. He rents a van that he uses to provide local bus service. He has had this job for two years. His profits are small because he has to pay rent. Today he has been given the option to purchase goats for a very low price. This is why he decided to get a loan and to purchase these goats. In a month he will be able to sell them at a higher price which will allow him to get a large profit. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонов Гайрат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Арендует маршрутку , которую использует как маршрутное такси. Рабоьает так уже два года. Доходы не большие , так как приходится оплачивать арендную плату. В данный момент ему придложили купить коз по очень низкой цене. Поэтому он решил получить ткредит и купить этих коз. Через месяц он сможет продать их по более высокой цене. Это тпоможет ему получить более высокий доход. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Goats

loans.name: Comite Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
The María Auxiliadora group formed thanks to the members of the United Women group in the Villa Salvador neighborhood of Aregua, Paraguay, who invited some of their neighbors to form a new group and receive the benefits of loans and training to help their small businesses. Currently the group consists of 15 members and it is in its second loan cycle. The women are requesting the loan to purchase merchandise or invest in their businesses, as detailed below:

1. Narcisa Villaba will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

2. Lucia V. will invest in paper and ink for her photocopier.

3. Silvia A. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

4. Anuncia O. will invest in the purchase of caramels, lollipops, gelatins and pastries.

5. Rosalba A. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

6. Antoliana R. will invest in the purchase of jewelry.

7. Mirian F. will invest in the purchase of jewelry.

8. Elena G. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

9. Herminia O. will invest in the purchase of caramels, lollipops, gelatins and pastries.

10. María Elizabeth M. will invest in the purchase of recyclable plastics.

11. Nicolaza M. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

12. Mirian M. will invest in silver jewelry.

13. Myrian A. will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, breads, tomatoes, napkins, meats, vegetables, oils and beers.

14. Petrona J. will invest in the purchase of pants, T-shirts, blouses, shorts, etc.

15. Mirian Quiñoñez will invest in the purchase of threads and cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

El comité María Auxiliadora se formó gracias a las integrantes del comité Mujeres Unidas del barrio Villa Salvador de la ciudad de Aregua quienes invitaron algunas de sus vecinas del barrio a formar un comité, para obtener los beneficios de créditos y capacitaciones para sacar adelante sus microempresas. Actualmente el comité está conformado por 15 integrantes y se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa. Ellas solicitan un crédito para comprar mercaderías e invertirlos en sus negocios. El detalle es el siguiente: 1. - Narcisa Villaba invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

2. - Lucia V. invertirá en la compra de hojas y tinta para fotocopiadora.

3. - Silvia A. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

4. - Anuncia O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores.

5. - Rosalba A. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

6. - Antoliana R. invertirá en la compra de joyas.

7. - Mirian F. invertirá en la compra de joyas.

8. - Elena G. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

9. - Herminia O. invertirá en la compra de caramelos, chupetines, galletitas, alfajores.

10. - María Elizabeth M. invertirá en la compra de plásticos para reciclar

11. - Nicolaza M. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc. 12. - Mirian M. invertirá en la compra de joyas de plata

13. - Myrian A. invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, panificados, discos para empanadas, tomates, servilletas, carnes, verduras, aceite, cervezas

14. - Petrona J. invertirá en la compra de pantalones, remeras, blusas, short, etc.

15. – Mirian Quiñoñez invertirá en la compra de hilos y tela.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise or supplies for their businesses / compra de mercaderías para sus negocios

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina started her business to help herself economically. She started one year ago selling natural products and participating in promotional and sales meetings, through which she started to earn commissions. which have let her improve her quality of life.

She needs a loan of $275, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and to organize meetings that will let her increase her sales to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Catalina inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente. Comenzó hace 1 año vendiendo l productos naturistas y participando en reuniones de promoción y venta del producto, con las cuales empezó a ganar comisiones, que le han permitido mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $275 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar el mercancía y organizar reuniones lo que le permitirá subir sus ventas para obtener mas ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yohana Yamilet

texts.es:
Yohana lives in the Georgino Andrade neighbhorhood, is 33 years old and married, and has three children ages 2, 12 and 14. Her husband works as a contractor and supports his family. Yohana sells cosmetics, and has four years in sales. At times, her customers fail to pay her which is difficult because she loses money and inventory. It can be a risky business, but she does have good customers and has managed to get ahead. She started with her own funds and she would like to invest the funds from her loan into more merchandise. In the future, she sees growing her sales, capturing more customers to increase her earnings, educating her children and supporting her husband in maintaining the family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Yohana habita en el barrio Georgino Andrade, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos de 2,12 y 14 años de edad, su esposo trabaja de contratista y apoya a su familia. Doña Yohana vende cosméticos y tiene cuatro años en las ventas, a veces le salen clientes que no le pagan y es difícil por que es dinero perdido y su inventario se viene abajo es un trabajo arriesgado pero no siempre es así ya que tiene buenas clientas y ha salido adelante, inició con fondos propios y con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en más mercadería. A futuro es crecer en las ventas, captar más clientes y así obtener mas ganancias, educar a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo en la manutención de la familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado estar activa, además de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos económicos. Empezó su negocio hace 5 años vendiendo gorditas y tacos en el pasillo de su casa y posteriormente ofreciendo comida entre sus vecinos situación que empezó a darle mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $125 que pagara en 1 mes para comprar materia prima a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Dolores started her business because she has always liked being active and also to be able to help her husband with household expenses. She started her business 5 years ago selling gorditas (like tacos with thicker shells) and tacos in the corridor of her home, more recently offering food among her neighbors. This situation started to provide her with better income.

She needs a loan of $125 that she will repay in one month to purchase raw material at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Material

loans.name: Mariaelena

texts.es:
