Marielena tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos. Estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria, vive en el Jr. Manco Capac  Nº 438 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una de las socias del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave.

Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 500 Nuevos Soles, pudo comprar detergentes, papel higiénico, pasta dental, etc. Nos cuenta que no continúo sus estudios  por que quedo embarazada. A los 22 años de edad decidió cambiar de negocio y actualmente se dedica a criar animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, pollos), los cuales vende los días Domingos en la Plaza Dominical con ayuda de su esposo.

Con este préstamo  de S/. 900,  el cual será cancelado en 3 cuotas, comprará forraje el cual le costara S/. 200 cada uno y comida para alimentar a sus animales.

“En el Banco Comunal me apoyaron bastante y así pude aumentar mi capital y hacer crecer mi negocio”.

Su anhelado sueño es tener una Granja de Cuyes de Raza y abrirse mercado en el Cusco para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marielena is 27 years old, she is married common law and she is the mother of 2 children. She went to school up to grade 11. She lives in Jr. Manco Capac No. 438 in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a member of the community bank "San Miguel" in Ilave.

In the beginning, with a loan of S/.500 nuevos soles, she was able to purchase detergents, bathroom tissue, toothpaste etc. She says that she couldn't keep going to school because she became pregnant. At the age of 22 she decided to change her business, one that she still carries out, and that is raising small livestock (guinea pigs, hens, chicken). She sells these on Sundays in the Plaza Dominical with the help of her husband.

With this loan amounting to S/.900, which will be repaid in a term of 3 months, she will purchase fresh feed for S/.200 each and other feed for her animals.

"The community bank supported me a great deal, permitting me to increase my capital to expand my business."

Her greatest dream is to have a Guinea pig farm and to find herself clientele in Cuzco to improve her standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Yarikul

texts.ru: Ярикул Гулаев житель города Яван. ЖИвет вместе со своей большой семьей. Ему 35 лет , он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства. Уже пять лет работает на рынке "Фаровон". Скупает породистых бычков и через некоторое время после откормки продает по более выгодной цене. Сейчас планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев , для того, чтобы купить породистого бычка. Это увеличит его товарооборот и поможет ему развивать бизнес.
texts.en:
Yarikul G. lives in the city of Yavan. He lives with his large family. He is 35, married, and has five children. He works in animal husbandry. He has worked in the Farovon market for five years. He buys thoroughbred calves, fattens them, and sells them for a higher price. He wants to take out a loan for twelve months in order to buy a thoroughbred calf. It will increase his sales and help him develop his business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyin a calf

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.en: Maria is a member of the Sumaq Huayta Village Bank; “Sumaq Huayta” means “Beautiful Flower” in Quechua. Maria is 51 years old; she is divorced and has three children. Maria is an obstetrician. She and her siblings have a family business making gold and silver jewelry. Maria is in charge of selling jewelry to a number of different institutions. She sells on credit, and collects payments on a monthly basis. Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles to buy gold and jewels. Maria dreams of improving her business and of opening her own jewelry store. Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal Sumaq Huayta que significa Linda Flor. Maria es divorciada, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos, Maria es obstetriz de profesión , Maria junto a sus hermanos tienen una empresa familiar que se dedican a la elaboración de joyas de oro y plata, Maria se encarga de las ventas en las diferentes instituciones, las cuales son al crédito y cobra cada fin de mes. Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de oro y joyas. Maria sueña con mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda de joyas.

loans.use: Buy gold and jewels

loans.name: Obeng

texts.en:
Obeng A. is fifty-one years old and married with three children: two boys and a girl. All of Obeng’s children are in the basic school. He lives with his family and children in a business community called Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region.

Obeng enjoys trading very much. He owns a provision shop in which he sells groceries such as milk, milo, sugar, and biscuits. He also sells in a store in front of his house which is by the street. He sells the provisions mostly to the people in his community who walk all the way to the market to buy. He has been in business for five years. Obeng says that he buys some of the goods from the big shops nearby. He does, however, travel to the bigger towns to procure some of his groceries sometimes. He hopes to increase the quantity of goods that he buys at each trip so as to cut down on his frequent transportation and sell to more people in his neighborhood and even beyond.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Бегова Озода жительница города Курган-Тюбе.Возраст 41 год, замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Поэтому она одна обеспечивает свою семью.Работает на рынке. Торгует фруктами. Этим бизнесом занимается уже около пяти лет. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить фрукты, а так же оплатить арендную плату за несколько месяцев вперед. Это даст возможность сохранить оборотную сумму. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ozoda B. lives in Kurgan-Tube. She is 41, married, and has 3 children. Ozoda's husband left to work in Russia. Ozoda sells fruits at a local market to provide for her family. She has been in business for 5 years. Ozoda will use this loan to purchase fruits and prepay a few months of stall rent. She plans to pay off this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the sales volume and pay rent for the stall

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
S., 42, is a local vegetable planter and she currently grows morning glories at the public lake in the area of Phnom Penh City, earning an average of US$ 5 per day. She is married to Than, 42, who is the father of seven children, and who also helps her in planting morning glories.

The family's businesses now are running very well and that motivates them continue working and improving. S. is asking for a US$ 500 loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a boat to supply her business operation. (S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available for photographing.)

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and a boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha R., 26, and her husband, Mr. Sophoin Kong, 26, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 2005 and have just one young son.

Sitha has been hired by her villagers to make garlands of jasmine flowers since 1996. She can earn about $2.50 per day. Mr. Sophoin Kong has been selling grocery items and gasoline for eight months. He wants to run a phone-fixing business; that's why Sitha is asking for her first loan of $1,000 in order to purchase phone-fixing materials, to build the grocery shop and to buy more grocery items for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase phone-fixing materials, to build the grocery shop and to buy more grocery items for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en:
Leafa T., 22, is married with 2 children. She has 5 years of experience in the pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and the public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~150 USD). SPBD loans are Leafa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and cooking oil.

loans.name: Phiona Assimire ‘S Group

texts.en:
Phiona is the leader of a group with 5 members. She is 28 years old and married with three children aged between 1 1/2 and 9 years. Two of her children go to school, and the other one is still young. She owns a five-room house where she lives with eight people. Phiona doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her house has no electricity but there is piped water. The family gets three meals a day.

Phiona resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. Phiona sells second-hand clothes in Namungoona Market (one of the city's suburbs). She sells to an average of 20 people a day, and works six days a week. Phiona’s major monthly expenses include rent for the business, school fees, and medication. She incurs extra transport costs traveling to and from Kampala to shop. She has been in this business for the last six years.

Phiona’s main challenges are the increasing prices of goods and competition. Phiona has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her ninth loan, working with the same group mates the whole time. She wants to use this loan partly to pay school fees for her children and partly to buy more clothes for resale. Phiona aspires to own a container full of second-hand clothes. .

loans.use: To buy more clothes and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es:
SONIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” vive en el Jr. Miguel Grau N° 360, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 37 años de edad, 4 hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad y su pareja trabaja como cerrajero en su propio taller.

Ella trabaja junto a su esposo fabricando ventanas y puertas de fierro, el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el cual adquirió soldaduras y acero que en ese entonces necesitaba para fabricar ventanas.

Con este préstamo que recibió de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles lo  invertirá en la  compra de fierros, soldaduras y herramientas que necesita porque las herramientas con el cual empezó el negocio están deterioradas.
 
Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
texts.en:
SONIA, a member of the LAS DIVINAS Microfinance Institute, lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is a 37-year-old mother of 4 children, one of whom is an adult. Her husband is a blacksmith who has his own workshop.

She works with her husband making window and door security bars. The first 300.00 PEN loan that she obtained from Manuela Ramos was used to purchase welding supplies and steel, which was what they needed to make window bars at the time.

She will invest this 1,200.00 PEN loan in purchasing pieces of metal, welding supplies, and tools that they need because the ones that they have had since they started the business have greatly deteriorated.

She states, “Manuela Ramos has helped me to generate an extra income for my family. It has allowed me to expand my business and keep growing and developing.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase metal, welding supplies, and tools

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Ana Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Martín de la Riva S/Nº, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años, 01 hijo estudiante que aún depende de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre la ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ubicada en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende todo el día. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de leche y aceite, también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal y también frutas, así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos. 
  
Anita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel belongs to the Ciudad de los Tres Pisos. She lives on Jr. Martín de la Riva S/Nº, Lamas province, San Martín department. She is 32, single, and she has one dependent son who is a student. Her characteristic fighting spirit and the desire to get ahead by her own means have served her well in setting up her own business of selling groceries. The business is located in her house. Little by little she was getting well known by her customers. Things are now going very well for her in the business. She currently continues with the same business where she sells all day. She has spent many years in this business, and she is very happy with what she does. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy groceries such as sacks of rice and sugar, packages of milk and oil, packages of different flavors and sizes of soft drinks, household cleaning supplies, personal hygiene products, and fruit. This way she will keep her customers happy and content. Anita, as she is affectionately called, feels very calm and happy with what she does. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to her being able to make her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries like rice, sugar, milk, oil, and personal use products

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto, pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC KILLA”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio,  tiene 23 años de edad, se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares, el socio tiene un pequeño stand en el centro comercial el paraíso, el compra todo tipo de celulares y los repara, y vende celulares de segunda mano, también vende accesorios de celulares, motivo por el cual el socio requiere el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y así adquirir mayor número de celulares y accesorios para tener más entrada económica.

Nuestro socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member Luis Alberto, belongs to the community bank "Mosoc Killa" and lives in the Santiago neighborhood of the city of Cusco. Our member is 23 years old and makes a living purchasing and selling cell phones. He has a small stall at the El Paraiso commercial center. He buys all types of cell phones and repairs them and then sells the second hand phones. He also sells cell phone accessories. The reason for his loan request is to be able to reinvest in his small business, obtain a larger quantity of cellular phones and accessories and increase his income. Our member is grateful for the opportunity that this provides for him and therefore promises to comply with the payment terms that correspond with this contract.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply his cell phone stand.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 65-year-old widow living in the beautiful green farm country of the Antique province town of Hamtic. She has two grown children, one of whom is a nurse, while the other is in information technology. Over the years she has provided for her family by operating a variety of businesses including farming and operating a sari sari store (general store) in her village.

This loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (or about $225 US) is for hog fattening, a popular business for people in her area suffering from poverty. She will buy four small piglets, two sacks of feed, and supplements and vitamins for the piglets. She will also construct a small nipa hut (a hut made of a kind of palm) for her pigs to live in. She will raise them for approximately six months until they are ready for sale.

It is her dream to be a successful businesswoman. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of hog fattening is one of the best ways to help provide for her family and she very much wants to lift her family out of poverty.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Hog fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the variety of goods in his grocery store.

loans.name: Mosherif

texts.ru: Мошериф Азимова проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 41 год. Вдова, имеет 3 детей.  Сын занимается ремонтом квартир. Сама Мошериф более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует она одеждой у себя дома. Помимо этого она еще занимается животноводством. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента. Покупает она с города, а потом продает в своем кишлаке.
texts.en:
Mosherif A. lives in the Yavan region. She is 41 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Her son remodels apartments. Mosherif herself has been in retail for more than five years. She sells clothing at her home. Besides that she also does animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment. She buys the items in the city and then resells in her village.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new assortment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E., age 39, lives on a farm with her husband and their 10-year-old adopted child. To finance their farm, they had borrowed money from financing groups that charge a high interest rate.

Helen is thankful that CEV accommodates farmers, because they really need the money to support their farm. When she became a member, she stopped borrowing from other individuals and financing groups. 

She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 to be used for farm inputs. Helen hopes she can save extra money for her child’s future with the low interest offered by CEV.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia R. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 29 years old. Letecia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Eden Plus Group

texts.fr: François K. 57 ans, est dirigeant de son groupe dénommé « Eden Plus » composé de 30 micro-entrepreneurs. Il vend des boissons et autres articles divers tels que du savon, des biscuits, boites à conserve etc… Il est actif dans son activité depuis 2003. Son affaire se situe dans la partie périphérique au nord de la ville de Kinshasa. François est client fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC depuis 2008. Il travaille durement pour réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin général. Son affaire lui procure présentement un bénéfice de $70 par semaine. Il compte avec le prochain prêt acheter 10 casiers de boissons et de divers articles pour renforcer sa boutique. François est marié et père de 7 enfants dont leurs varient entre 7 et 30 ans. Trois d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
François K., age 57, is the leader of a group of 30 micro-entrepreneurs called "Eden Plus". He sells drinks and other various items such as soap, cookies, canned food, etc. He's been running this business since 2003. His business is located in an outlying part of town, north of Kinshasa. François has been a loyal customer of Kiva's partner, the MFI Hope RDC, since 2008. He works hard to one day realize his dream: open a general store. At this time, his business turns a weekly profit of $70. With the next loan, he intends to buy 10 cases of beverages, and various other items to bolster his store. François is married and the father of 7 children, aged 7 to 30. Out of them, three attend school.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of beverages and other various items

loans.name: Mariano Marcos

texts.pt:
Mariano F. nasceu em Montepuez, Província de Cabo Delgado, tem 47 anos de idade, pai de 3 filhos de 18,16 e 11 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe parou porque os pais não tinham condições financeiras, assim viu se obrigado a começar a trabalhar para ajudar nas despesas de casa. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta também sua mãe em Montepuez enviando dinheiro para o pagamento de energia, agua e alguns géneros alimentícios.

Saiu de Montepuez em 1979 para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório em Maputo. Continua como militar e é quadro do Ministério da defesa Nacional. Aufere um salário no valor de 6.555.00mt e, depois das despesas caseiras, poupa algum no Banco Comercial BIM. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu colega e assim decidiu aproximar a instituição, nunca teve empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito. Este é o seu 1º crédito nesta organização no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (pregos, ferro, cimento, arame e chapas de Zinco) para fazer a cobertura da sua casa.

O desafio tem sido o elevado preço de material de construção, mas compromete se a pagar este empréstimo sem problemas afim de pedir os próximos, concluir a sua obra e sair da antiga casa que foi feita na base de material precário.
texts.en:
Mariano F. was born in Montepuez, province of Cabo Delgado, he is 47 years old and has 3 children who are 18,16 and 11 years old, they all go to school. He finished the 10th grade because his parents didn't have financial resources, so he had to start working to help at home. He lives in his own house with his family and he also supports his mother in Montepuez sending her money to pay electricity, water and food. He left Montepuez in 1979 to fulfill the military service which is obligatory in Maputo. He continues in the army and is part of the Ministry of National Defense. He earns a salary of 6.555MT and after household expenses he is able to save some money at the Commercial Bank BIM. He learned about Hlvuku thru a co-worker so he decided to approach the institution, he doesn't have credit at other financial institutions. This is his first loan for 10.000MT, and he expects to use it to buy construction materials (nails, iron, cement, wires and metal sheets of zinc) to build the frame of his house. His biggest challenge has been the price increase of construction materials, but he promises to pay the loan without any problems in order to request other loans to finish his house and leave the old house that was built out of precarious material.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es: Don Juan T. tiene 23 años de edad, es Casado Posee los Servicios de “Mecánica” cuenta con tres empleado, habita junto  a su Esposa, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad,  lleva 4  años de elaborar  en los servicios ya mencionados su  residencia  se encuentra en el Caserío Pajucbalicaj de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  por las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para poder comprar dicho Activo para movilizarse, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife. He owns a mechanics shop and has 3 employees. He has been doing this type of work for 4 years now. His residence is located in the farmhouse Pajucbalicaj in the village of Nimasac, which is in the department of Totonicapan in Guatemala. Due to the economic conditions in which he finds himself, he does not currently have enough money to purchase a vehicle to get around. For this reason, he turned to the association ASDIR to request a loan, and in this way he will be able to increase his sales, hoping also to help his family get ahead and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his services

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth C. M., tiene la edad de 32 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 4,11,12 y 13 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de 2 vacas de cría y de leche, esto le ayudará mucho porque va tener leche para el uso familiar y además obtener más ganancias con la venta de crías.El negocio del ganado es un complemento para su familia ya que ella está dedicada también a la agricultura de granos básicos y tuberculos. No es la primera vez que doña Ana Laura se financea con  FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Liseth C. M., 32, is married and the mother of 4 children, who are her highest priority in life. The children are 4, 11, 12, and 13 years old, respectively. She wants financing to buy two dairy cows to breed and for milk production. This will be a big help because she will be able to have milk for her family's nourishment and will earn even more profits selling any eventual young. The cattle raising is an added benefit for her family since she is also a farmer, growing basic grains and tubers. This isn't Ana Laura's first loan with FUDECOSUR. She states that the loan committee has been very helpful in the past since the help is what has allowed her to succeed in the various projects she has set up for herself. Besides, she is very happy with the loan terms she got. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and better economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming and cattle raising.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda G. is a 45-year-old woman who has dedicated her life to making things better for her family and helping them escape from poverty. She will do all she can to meet these goals, and especially wants her children to finish their studies and have a better future. Her husband, Ereneo, makes a living driving a sugarcane truck during milling season. When the mills close for the season, he drives a motorcycle and sometimes helps his wife with her business. The couple is blessed with five children, some of whom are still in school. They live in the village of Sitio Nasug-ong, Brgy Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

To help her husband meet their family's needs, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 to earn additional income. She began by buying and selling fruit in front of their house. Then she began selling clothing, where she earned enough money to help tremendously with her family's needs. As she secured additional loans, she looked for other ways to earn money. Now she makes a living selling fish to people in her local community. From this businesses, she earns a minimum of PHP 11,800 per month.  This has allowed her to educate her children and meet many household expenses. 

Florenda's previous loan of Php19,500 was used for her fish-selling business. She paid it on time and without any delay. Now she has applied for a new loan of PHP 19,500 which we will use to sell fruits and selling of fruits and clothing.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges,  Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in  the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its programs, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a  life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and clothing to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is married and has no kids. He is a 31-year-old trader. He lives with his wife in a rented apartment in a community in the western region of Ghana. He trades in garment tie dye material. Tie dye is designed from the combination of plain white cloth soaked in mixed dye to get the actual design. Tie dye is very useful and beautiful, so many people purchase it. The fabric can be sewn into African wear and it can also be used to sew a traditional style of clothing. Benjamin treks to Takoradi to buy his stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, he buys only a small amount of lace material and sells through hawking. He believes the loan will enable him to grow his business to the expected level. With the loan, he wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. He hopes to use part of his profit to expand his output.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Mr. Chhoeun I is 31 years old and he lives in Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Although he tries to work hard with his field, he still cannot support the family. Thus, he wants to start a new business to improve more than before. So, Mr. Chhoeun I decided to ask for the loan amount of 2,000,000R to buy ducklings for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Thet Chim is grocer who can earn a little income to help support her family. Mrs. Thet Chim is a mother of two children one of whom is a student in the local school; the other is too young to study or work. Mrs. Thet Chim is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducklings

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es: La señora María Josefa S. A. es maestra de educación `primaria es madre  soltera de cinco hijos y cuatro de ellos en edad escolar antes de tener este oficio era de limpieza y aduce que muchos padres de familia no confían en ella para que le eduquen a sus  hijos ella actualmente se sigue preparando para maestra de educación física lo cual lo hace los días sábado.
texts.en:
María Josefa S. A. is a primary school teacher. She is a single mother with five children. Four of the children are school-age. Before this occupation her job was cleaning. She states that many parents do not have confidence in her to teach their children. She is currently continuing to prepare to be a physical education teacher. She does this on Saturdays.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blocks, concrete, and pay for labor

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en: Madelyn V. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Madelyn owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2005, Madelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Madelyn is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more chicks to raise and sell. This loan will be her 6th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.en:
H. Niginamo is a small-scale entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is married and the loving mother of three children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. 

Niginamo sells women's clothing in the market. She is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of 800 USD to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. 

The only dream of Niginamo is to ensure her children a good education and to make them happy. We believe Niginamo’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing women's clothing to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Jane Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jane Wanjiru is a 36 year old mother of one child. She lives in Kongowea in the coastal city of Mombasa. 

Jane is in the business of selling second-hand clothes in the busy Kongowea market and her business is one year old. Her main customers are the residents of Mombasa who frequent the Kongowea market.

Jane is borrowing her first loan from KADET and with the money she plans to increase her stock of second-hand clothes locally know as mitumbas. 


She hopes to go wholesale in the business in future.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Asraf

texts.en:
Asraf A. is a hard-working businessman.  He is 33 years old and married with two children.  One child is living with him and in school.

Asraf operates a hardware business and he is also a blacksmith. He has been in this business for 10 years. He will use the loan to purchase more hardware items such as tins, iron sheets, and so forth for his business. He hopes to generate more profits out of his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en:
Anjelika, married with two daughters, lives in Melitopol where she owns a vending kiosk selling men’s and women’s underwear in the central marketplace. Anjelika, who launched her small enterprise 12 years ago, now has 25,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory and earns a monthly net profit of 6,500 Grivnyas.

Now seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify the merchandise offered for sale in her vending kiosk, she is planning to continue developing her trade and re-investing in its further expansion. Anjelika is hoping to use a portion of the generated profit to improve her housing situation.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
La Sra. Placida, vive en casa propia en la zona de Achachicala, tiene 54 años de edad y se encuentra casada con el Sr. Oscar  que tiene como actividad la de Gráfico y tienen solo un hijo que aun depende economicamente de ellos ya que se encuentra en edad escolar, son una familia muy unida.

Doña Placida tiene como actividad la venta de lenceria, mismo que lo realiza en su puesto ubicado en la avenida Buenos Aires, esta calle es comercial ya que muchos comerciants tienen su puesto de venta y es un lugar muy conocido por los Paceños. El crédito solicitado es para compra de mercaderia (fajas reductoras Silwet) por caja, es una persona trabajadora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Placida owns the house she lives in, in the Achachicala area; she is 54 years old and is married to Oscar, who works as a graphic designer, and they have one child of school age who still depends on them economically, since he is in elementary school. They are a very close-knit family. Placida works in the clothing business: she sells lingerie from her stall, located in the Avenida Buenos Aires, a renown business street for the Paceños (inhabitants of La Paz), as many retailers have their stalls there. The loan requested will be used to buy boxes of slimming Silwet brand girdles. She is a very hard-working woman, and she is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Mercaderia

loans.name: Nymdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa B., 50, lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest son, Anhbayr, attends a vocational training center. His youngest son, Erdenebat, attends a local secondary school. 

Nyamdavaa operates a wooden furniture manufacturing business. He has been operating his business since 2004, and has steadily expanded his business over the past six years. Nyamdavaa's initial working capital was only 40,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT), but after years of successful operation his working capital stands at 800,000 MNT today. With his business profit, Nyamdavaa has used 1,000,000 to purchase a house and plot of land with a yard for his family. Nyamdavaa is an skillful manufacturer and very hardworking person. He says, “I always try to make high quality products for my customers. ” He is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his business

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda G. is a 64 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fruit and vegetable business. She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 7 children, who are between 25 and 42 years old.  Some of their children have their own families, while the ones who are still single are working and helping the family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her business, she is gradually providing more economic stability for her family.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Florenda G. is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her business. This will be her 22nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her most recent loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Florenda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned its respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nuevo Porvernir 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Angelita is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Porvenir (New Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is in Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children.

Angelita is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells clothes and shoes in a Fantasia: a variety store that caters to women. She will use the profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy materials to finish house addition (roofing, etc.)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth S. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Ruth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold T. lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a ger- a traditional nomadic housing tent. Since 2004, Batbold has been operating a shoe business in Narantuul Trade market, the biggest and most crowded market in the city. He provides a variety of shoes to satisfy the customer's needs and imports the shoes from China. He owns a stall in the market where he sells the products.  After some years of positive growth with his business, he was able to increase his working capital to 3,000,000 MNT with a daily profit of 80,000 MNT and was able to purchase a plot of land where his family currently lives. Today, the family enjoys a stable operation with the businesses and is focused on expanding their shoe trade business in the near future.  Batbold is a very modest person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import a large number of shoes from Beijing, the capital city of China.

loans.use: To import a large number of shoes from Beijing

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa T. N. is 42 years old. She has two children who are attending high school and secondary school. She has been involved in our credit program for seven years. During that time of using our loan process, she has completed her repayments successfully. 

Her main business is running a grocery shop in her village. The profit that she earns from this shop is very stable. Currently, she requests a loan of 8,006,000 VND to buy more products for her shop in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Bokk Jomm Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BOKK JOMM a été créé depuis l'ouverture du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite en 1995. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et partage le même centre d'intérêt qui la promotion de leurs activité commerciales. 

Madame Hélène N. debout derrière à gauche de la photo et soulevant la main droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est veuve et âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mère de 9 enfants mais qui sont tous majeurs. Par contre elle a la responsabilité de ses deux petites filles.

Elle fait du commerce avec la vente de couscous préparé à base de mil. Elle vend également de la farine de mil et de la pâte d'arachide. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant trois sacs  mil et deux seaux de pâte d'arachide pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.

Son objectif est d'aider ses enfants dans la prise en charge alimentaire de la famille et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jomm has been created in 1995 following the opening of Banc Villageois of Wango to which it belongs. The group is composed of 12 women all living in the same neighborhood and sharing the goal of developing their businesses. Mrs. Hélène Ndion, standing on the left in the back row on the photo, raising her right hand, is the group’s leader. She is a widow, 65 years of age. She is the mother of nine, but her children are all grown now. However, she has two granddaughters in her care. Her line of business is selling a couscous-type dish cooked with millet. She also sells millet flour and peanut paste. With her new loan she is going to boost her stock and purchase three bags of millet and two buckets of peanut paste in order to better meet her customers’ needs and increase her profit margins. Her goal is to help her children pay for groceries as well as to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing millet and peanut paste

loans.name: Seydi Areli

texts.es: La Sra. Seydi P. G. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en el colegio Monseñor Bosco Vivas de la comunidad Santa Rita  donde tiene 12 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: Seydi P. G. is from the city of Santa Rosa del Peñón. She is a primary school teacher at Monseñor Bosco Vivas school in Santa Rita. She has worked there for 12 years. This is the first loan she has requested through Ceprodel. With this loan, she wants to improve her home and she would buy tiles, cement, and  would receive the money for labor costs.

loans.use: to buy tiles, cement and for labor costs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 36 años, es un hombre muy bueno y alegre, esta casado con Maritza, de 32 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el pueblo de Yanapuquio. Él afirma con mucha alegría que, lo que más le gusta es el trabajo en el campo, “me gusta regar los sembríos”, menciona. Todos los días, cargando sus herramientas de cultivo se dirige a las alturas donde tiene sus terrenos agrícolas; ahí siembra papa, olluco y cebada (productos agrícolas). Cada temporada, Pedro viaja al mercado central de su localidad, allá; vende sus cosechas, asimismo comercializa animales que posee. Ahora está juntando capital para comprar un terreno agrícola donde podrá adquirir mayores ganancias. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que con el apoyo de su banco comunal podrá lograr su objetivo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono natural, con ello asegurará la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Pedro is 36 years old and is a very good and happy man.  He is married to 32-year-old Maritza and they have three children and live in a rented house located in the town of Yanapuquio.  He says very happily that what he likes most is working in the field.  “I like to water the fields,” he mentions.  Every day he carries his farming tools and heads to the highlands where his croplands are.  There, he plants potato, ‘olluco’ (an Andean tuber) and barley.  Every season he travels to the main market in his area and sells his crops, as well as animals that he owns.  He is now saving money to buy a cropland where he will be able to earn more.  This is his second loan through MFP and he is sure that with the support of his communal bank, he will be able to achieve his goal.  With the loan requested, he will purchase natural manure with which he will be able to ensure the quality of his crops.

loans.use: To purchase natural manure.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married woman with one pre-school age child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall, selling green vegetable and tomatoes for over two years.  Her customers are neighbors and visitors. Matilda faces a challenge of fluctuating prices and that effects her profits.

Matilda hopes to expand and even establish another business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu because of its mission of empowering social-economically marginalized entrepreneurs.  With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Jael Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Jael L. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive en el barrio la Pradera que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, también salen a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades, muchos también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Nuestra socia se dedica a atender la tienda que tiene hace 5 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, en sus tiempos libres también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos Avon, lleva 3 años en este negocio y estos productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad y visitando a sus amigas y conocidas.
 
La Señora. Jael tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 33, 31, 20, 18, 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientes con sus familias, el tercero y cuarto de sus hijos estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es ebanista y labora en su taller propio, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en  el banco comunal y fue  invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres triunfadoras.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en más productos para su tienda. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs Jael L. is a member of the “Siempre Amigas” (Friends Forever) community bank.  She lives in La Padrera neighborhood in Valle district.  This district is noted for its cold climate.  It has a beautiful view of nature.  The people from this area work as farmers and raise animals.  They also travel to the city to carry out different business activities.  Many have migrated in search of a better job.

Jael serves in the store which she has had for 5 years.  She works every day from 6 in the morning until 10 at night.  In her spare time she also sells Avon products.  She has been selling Avon products for 3 years and she sells in the city and when visiting her friends and acquaintances.

Jael is 57 years old.  She is married and has 5 children aged 33, 31, 20, 18 and 15.  Her eldest two children are married and live with their own families.  Her third and fourth children are studying at university and her youngest daughter is in high school.  Her husband is a cabinet maker who works in his own workshop.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

This is the fourth loan that Jael has had from her community bank.  She was invited to join this group of successful women by a friend.  The money from this loan will be invested in buying more products for her store.  Her biggest dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: To buy food products such as sugar, rice, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita E. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Lolita is married and has three adult children. To make a living Lolita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling everyday products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and convenience foods in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010 Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional stock. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children, 5 of them are adults and only one is school-aged. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for educational purposes. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For educational purposes.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en un sector urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por su abundante movimiento de transporte y comercio, es la región Lambayeque.

Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros). El brinda su servicio en la periferia de la ciudad y se vale de el para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a reparar su moto y a adquirir algunos accesorios adicionales.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 22 years old, he is single and he doesn’t have children. He lives with his parents in a suburban region of the city of Chiclayo. It is a region nationally known for its transportation services and commerce. It is in the region of Lambayeque. 

Luis provides transport services with a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle equipped with a cabin where both cargo and passengers can be transported). He provides his services throughout the city. It is a valuable business because it covers his personal expenses and he is able to contribute to the household finances. 

Continuous use of the rickshaw has caused wear and mechanical breakdown and it needs urgent repair to keep it running. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and it will help him repair the rickshaw and he will also purchase some additional accessories.

loans.use: To carry out maintenace repairs for his rickshaw.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia lives in Gujranwala, a mid-sized city in Pakistan, known for its rice industry. She lives with her family in the area of Sabri chowk in a 2-room brick house. She moved here 22 years ago. Safia is married to M. A., 42 years old, who is involved in a construction supplies sales business in the market. Safia is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her elder son works with his father in his construction supplies business and the other children attend a local school.

Safia supports her family financially by making artificial flowers. She supplies these flowers to different gift shops and also sells decoration pieces. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies, such as cement, bricks and sand, in bulk and increase his sales. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Safia is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to it. Safia is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, Safia is holding a book (called the Asasah passbook).

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nida's Group

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of Villa Luna, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Nida is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nida is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn M. is from the Barangay of Labo, Ozamiz City, M. Occidental. She is 33 years old. Anelyn is married and has two school-age and two infant children. To make a living she has been working at her business for almost six years and earns approximately $345 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. She is requesting an additional loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her work to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her buy and sell accessories business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 38 years old and runs a taxi business. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily. Therefore, he has managed to grow his business. He hopes to open other businesses in the future. He has been guaranteed a loan of 40, 000 KES with his group member in Faulu Kenya. With the loan, he will repair his car.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Féhintola

texts.fr: Monsieur Féhintola exerce comme activité la vente de pièces détachées et tire assez se revenus pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Il a commencé depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne en gros au grand marché de Lomé. Il revend les pièces dans un magasin à Hedzranawoé. Il est très accueillant ce qui l’aide à avoir du jour au lendemain plus de clients. Aussi il a employé dans le magasin 2 personnes qui l’aident. Il demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite quartier Yayrakomé, un quartier périphérique de Lomé.
texts.en: Mr. Féhintola is in the business of selling spare parts and generates enough income to support his family. He has been in business since 2003 and buys his merchandise wholesale at the large market in Lomé. He then sells the parts in a store in Hedzranawoé. He is very welcoming which helps him have a very loyal clientele. Also, he has two employees that help him with the store. He is asking for a loan in order to handle the increasing demand for his products. He is married and has four children.  He lives in the Yayrakomé neighborhood in the outskirts of Lomé.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ronald Steve

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de La Victoria, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
 
Se dedica a la carpintería metálica.  Brinda el servicio en un lugar acondicionado dentro de su casa donde atiende a sus clientes.  Los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en el sostenimiento económico de su familia, a quienes quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ronald quisiera comprar más herramientas para su negocio, ya que su demanda ha incrementado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in La Victoria district, which is located 10 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque department.
 
He is a metalworker, and offers his services in an air-conditioned place within his house where he can attend to his customers. The income he earns he invests in maintaining his family, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. 

Ronald would like to buy more tools for his business, since demand has increased. For this reason he thought it best to request a loan of 1500 soles ($550) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase more tools for his metalworking business

loans.name: Hellene

texts.en: Hellene was born in 1985; she has one child who is 2 years old. Her husband is a soldier while their child hasn’t started school yet. Hellene owns a hair cutting salon which she has operated for 8 months. She is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment. In the future she plans to expand her salon and offer plaiting and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Ekuba

texts.en:
Ekuba M. is a Wakye seller (cooked rice and beans). This dish is normally served with pepper sauce, macaroni, boiled eggs or salad. She is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a farmer. 

Her business is just two years old and she wants to grow it. She is requesting a loan to buy bags of rice, beans and other things so she can cook in larger quantities to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekuba plans to build a better structure to sell her food in.

At the time of the visit she had finished selling for the day and is showing how she dishes out the food.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en: Ryad is a 40 year-old married man with five children, from Sahab, Jordan. Ryad owns a grocery store and he would like to offer his customers more variety and healthy snack food choices for their children. Being the father of five children, Ryad believes in teaching children healthy eating habits to carry them into adulthood with a better quality of life and health. Ryad also knows that the summer months in Jordan can be very hot and challenging for young people. So, Ryad is requesting a loan of 1500JD to expand his selection of fresh fruits, fruit juices, fruit-flavored yogurts and sugar-free ice cream treats. Ryad aspires to expand his customer-base by incorporating a sense of sociA. responsibility into his business and treating his community with respect. Ryad also would like to increase his family income, improve their living conditions and give his children better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jacqueline Javiera

texts.es: Jacqueline Javiera tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años, que tiene este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo que le genere ingresos diariamente. Tiene un hijo a su cargo la lucha constante que realiza por mantener a su familia le ha permitido mejorar como persona. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de bolsos, camisas, sabanas, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Javiera is 34 years old. Her endeavor is the sale of general merchandise. It has been more than 11 years since she began this business due to her need to find work that would generate a daily income. 

She has a child under her care and she constantly fights to support her family. This has allowed her to better herself. 

The purpose for the loan she has taken out is to purchase bags, shirts, sheets, footwear, cosmetics and underwear among other things.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shirts, sheets, footwear, cosmetics and underwear among other things.

loans.name: Emerilou

texts.en:
Emerilou is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Emerilou has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Emerilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emerilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a Ugandan male, age 27. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is the father of one child, age 3 years.

A retailer of two years, he acquired his start-up capital from farming Irish potatoes and maize.

He needs a loan to purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to resell. 

He dreams of acquiring more land and becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru:
Анвар целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 2 детей. Он старается, чтоб его дети выросли образованными и культурными людьми, и чтоб работали в хороших кампаниях и открыли свой собственный бизнес. Он очень хочет, чтоб его дети не знали бедности и были счастливы. С этой целью он начал заниматься купля продажей аксессуаров для мобильных более 4 лет. Анвар мечтает о том, что когда-то он расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. С надеждою он обратился к Имон Интернэшнл, чтобы поддерживать его и запрашивает 3000$ США. Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Anvar is a goal-oriented and conscientious man. He is married and is a father of 2 children. He is doing his best to assure that his children grow up educated and cultured people, so that they can work for good companies and open their own business. Anvar wants his children to grow free of poverty and be happy. With this goal he has been managing his own mobile phone business for the last 4 years. Anvar dreams about expanding his business and maximizing his profits from it. With hope he has turned to Imon International to support him and loan him 3000 US dollars. Anvar wants to thank everyone who will support him in advance!

loans.use: to purchase new inventory

loans.name: Nuris Alicia

texts.es:
Nuris es comerciante, tiene tres años trabajando en su propio negocio, una pulperia que inicio con ahorros propios. Casada, su esposo labora como conductor de acarreo comercial, es madre de dos hijos, estudiantes de primaria.
Nuris es una mujer muy activa y como objetivo ha sido la construccion de su casa, como el apoyo  a su esposo con los gastos de alimentacion. Pues todo esta ah altos costos.
Sus ventas han aumentado al fortalecer su inventario, con prestamo que Afodenic, ha dado en seis ciclos, los cuales introdujo mas productos de consumo, y logro la captacion de mas clientes.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo, comprara: seis quintales de arroz, cinco quintales de azucar, cuatro vidones de aceite, cuatro quintale de frijoles, y golosinas. Siendo el mas vendido.
texts.en:
Nuris is a shopkeeper. She owns and works in a grocery store, which she started with her own savings 3 years ago. She is married and her husband works as a commercial driver hauling cargo. She has 2 children; both attend primary school.

Nuris is a very industrious woman. Her goal has been to build her house and to help her husband with food costs, as everything costs a lot. With the help of a loan from Afodenic, she was able to strengthen her inventory and increase sales. She did this in 6 loan cycles. During this time she introduced more consumer products and managed to attract more customers.

Now, with this new loan she is going to buy: 6 quintals (a quintal is 100 pounds) of rice, 5 quintals of sugar, 4 drums of oil, 5 quintals of beans and candy, as it is the best seller.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains to strengthen her inventory and increase sales.

loans.name: Durel Persyl

texts.fr:
Client âgé de 30 ans , célibataire sans enfant ,ayant arrete ses etudes en cours moyen elementaire a l'ecole  primaire , il se lance dans la prestation des services des jeux electroniques  en 2006 , il  ouvre une salle de jeux et a l'heure actuelle ,il a 6 postes televiseurs.
A l'otroi de son pret il va acheter  2 postes televiseurs de 14 pouces  en couleurs   et les programmes des jeux appropries et  un groupe electrogene , meme en temps coupure d'electricite de  continuer a faire fonctionner ses televiseurs et sa salle de jeux.
Il a des recettes de 6000 à 20.000 F Cfa par jour.Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, il pense épargner et à longue  ouvrir une autre salle de jeux.
texts.en: Durel is a 30 year old single man who, despite having not graduated from elementary school, began working in the electronic gaming business in 2006 by opening a game salon/room.
