Since the opening of his business five years ago, it has continued to grow, and he now owns six color televisions for his customers. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase two 14-inch color televisions, new electronic games and a small generator to enable his customers to continue gaming despite power outages. He earns between 6,000 and 20,000 FCA daily (approximately between 12 and 41 USD). He plans to continue saving money and hopes to open a second gaming room in the future.

loans.use: two 14 inch color televisions, new games and controllers and a small generator

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar.  Cuenta con educación secundaria (incompleta).
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, cereales, detergentes, pastas dentales, golosinas, etc.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cincuenta arrobas de avena,  detergentes y otros productos para venderlos en la ciudad de Moquegua.  Trabaja sola  en el negocio, su esposo es transportista.
La señora desea mejorar su casa y comprar más terrenos para dejárselos a sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” community bank which is located in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-age children.  She did not complete her secondary education.

Marlene has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles and she invested that money in her business selling groceries, cereals, detergents, toothpaste, candies, etc.  

With this new loan for 1,500 soles, Marlene will buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats (1 arroba = approx. 25lbs), detergents and other products to sell in the town of Moquegua.  She works alone in her business.  Her husband is a truck driver.

Marlene would like to make improvements to her home and buy more land to leave to her children.

What Marlene likes about her community bank are the meetings and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: to buy fifty 'arrobas' of oats, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Camp De Garde / Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tessito  est créé en Novembre  2006  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 17 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  MARIEANDRE,  (debout en cinquième position de la gauche vers la droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle vend des vêtements pour enfants  et des cuisses de poulet.  Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des vêtements pour enfants en vu des les revendre durant la rentrée des classes.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Tessito group was created in November 2006, on the day the "banc villageois" was inaugurated. It is composed of 17 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

Madame  Marieandre  (standing fifth, left to right), is the leader of the group. She is 73, married and the mother of five children. She sells children's clothing and chicken thighs, as she has been doing for five years now.

With this loan she counts on buying children's clothing to sell during the back-to-school period. 

The profit from her business will permit her to put aside savings and help her husband with food expenses and school fees.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 27 years old. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her two children and husband. 

Her husband is a bricklayer. Ly earns an income by making shoes at her house. She intends to take a loan to purchase better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Dexter is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Dexter has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dexter hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 34 años de edad es una madre soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años a la que cuida como lo más preciado en su vida. Ella vive en la casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Tarma. Judith empezó su actividad económica, abriendo un pequeño negocio de abarrotes en un ambiente de su hogar. Con el tiempo se dio cuenta de que no era rentable, por la falta de capital, por esa razón acudió a sus padres, los que la apoyaron con la apertura de un restaurante. Ahora Judith lleva 3 meses en este nuevo oficio. Ahí expende una variedad de alimentos solo para la hora del almuerzo, ya que para abastecer en las mañanas, tardes y noches es necesaria una mayor inversión. De  esa manera, al día recupera lo invertido y gana de 40 a 50 soles como promedio. A la vez, ella trabajaba en una entidad estatal como recepcionista, ingresos que ayudaron positivamente en su desarrollo y el de su menor hija, pero que tuvo que dejar, por que el negocio le absorbía mucho tiempo. Judith es consciente de que, si anhela seguir creciendo, necesita de un apoyo económico, pues sus metas están claras, “quiero abrir un restaurante turístico vendiendo comida típica de la ciudad a los visitantes”, confiesa. Con su ayuda, Judith podrá acceder a su préstamo número 2 de MFP, manifiesta que será puntual y constante con sus cancelaciones. Se compromete. Ella necesita ampliar su restaurante, por tal motivo destinará el dinero en la compra de sillas y mesas; ollas, sartenes y contenedores de alimentos.
texts.en:
Judith is 34 years old and a single mother with a 10-year-old daughter that she cares for like the most precious thing in her life. Judith lives in her parents' house in the city of Tarma.

She began her economic activity by opening a small grocery store at home. In time, she noted that it wasn't profitable for lack of capital, and for this reason, she approached her parents who helped her to open a restaurant. Judith has spent the last 3 months at her new trade. She sells a variety of dishes but only during breakfast, since having supplies for mornings, afternoons and nights would require a larger investment. In this manner, Judith has recuperated her initial investment and earns 40 to 50 sols daily.

At the same time, Judith was working in a state office as a receptionist, added income that helped positively in the development of herself and her minor daughter. But she had to leave that job because her business absorbed much of her time. Judith is conscious of the fact that if she wishes to continue to grow, she needs economic assistance, because her goals are clear: “I want to open a tourist restaurant selling typical food of the city to visitors,” she explains. 

With our help, Judith will be able to obtain her 2nd loan through MFP. She promises to be punctual and constant in her payments. Judith needs to expand her restaurant, and for that purpose, she will use the money to buy chairs and tables, pots, pans, and food containers.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, pots, pans, and food containers for the expansion of her restaurant.

loans.name: Makunda Shg Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of the group Makunda SHG. His group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Martin takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Martin will repay his loans and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Makunda SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Martin is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far end is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Magdalena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Consuelo”, del Distrito de San Pablo, Provincia de Bellavista y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años, y 04 hijos todos están a su cargo, el mayor  tiene 15 años estudiante del 4to de secundaria, la segunda de 11 años cursa  el sexto de secundaria, el tercero de 6 años cursa el primero de secundaria y el menor de 2 años.
Al tener pareja se dedica a la agricultura, por iniciativa se de su esposo incursiona en el negocio de salchipollo  que no le va bien , después decide incursionar en el negocio de ropa de segunda mano y actualmente lo sigue haciendo además incorporo útiles escolares, su esposo le ayuda esporádicamente. Se inicio con un capital de 300.00 nuevos soles que le brindo el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará  fardos de ropa usada para dama, caballero y niños, útiles escolares. 
La Sra. Magdalena  se considera una mujer exitosa, anhela  incrementar prendas de vestir y que sus hijos sean profesionales, está muy satisfecha con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the communal bank “Consuelo” in the San Pablo district of the province of Bellavista and department of San Martin.  She lives with her partner, is 37 years old and has 4 children, all of whom are in her care.  The oldest is 15 years old and in his fourth year of secondary school, the second oldest is 11 and in sixth grade, the third is 6 in first grade and the youngest is 2.  

When she got married she worked in farming, an initiative her husband started in Salchipollo that didn’t go well.  Afterwards, she decided to get into the business of selling second hand clothing.  Now she keeps selling clothes and has also added school supplies.  Her husband helps occasionally.  She started with 300.00 nuevos soles given to her by Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy bundles of used clothes for women, men, and children, and school supplies.

Magdalena considers herself a successful woman.  She years to increase her articles of clothing and hopes that her children will be professionals.  She is very happy with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop and move forward.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second hand clothes and school supplies.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with one six-year-old child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 32 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and has two children between the ages of 10 and 15. For the past eight years, Comfort has been selling dishes in the market, and she enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dishes to sell.  She plans to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a clothes dealer. She is married and has two children; one of whom is in school. The business has been running for 6 years. She learned of Milango from her friends. 

Khadija is applying for a loan of 80,000 KES to purchase more clothes for sale. Khadija’s main challenge is price fluctuations. She looks forward to owning a big store. She will use the extra income to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Nyantiop

texts.en: Nyantiop is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For one year, she has been selling fish in Bor, South Sudan. Nyantiop is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 33 year old man from Irbid, Jordan who helps support 6 family members. He is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy food products, drinks, phone credit refill cards and sodas for his store. He would like to expand his current business in this way and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy food products, drinks and phone credit refill cards to sell

loans.name: Wanignon-Pouce 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 1 est composé de huit personnes qui sont dans le même village. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Christine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Christine est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Léon. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Christine vend depuis quatre ans du vin de palme à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Christine vend également du riz. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Christine ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANIGNON-POUCE 1, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du vin de palme et du riz.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with 2 children.  He has had a motorcycle business for 5 years and it has been profitable. 

He has taken a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will help him grow his business more.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to educate his children and have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle and hopes this will help him grow his business more

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and lives in the Endebes area. She has six children, who are the reason for her hard work and motivation. Most financial institutions shy away from financing smallholder farmers but Juhudi Kilimo is different and is happy to provide a platform where Kiva lenders can support smallholder farmers.Mary loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Mary’s primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 10 years, and throughout, she has never regretted going into farming. Endebes area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve her income. Mary’s upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Mary has received training and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Mary is quite visionary and - with her accumulated profits - hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.
You can be part of Mary's story. Please lend now.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Madam Adjoa A. is a baker of 40 year old. She is living alone with her two (02) children and four (04) other children whom she cares for. Abandoned by her husband who has been living clandestinely in Europe for more than 5 years, Madam Adjoa BLEVI courageously manages to support all her family expenditures. Having dropped out of primary school very early, she started bread selling along roads and streets. Very ingenious, she has early understood that to better succeed in life, she must be her own mistress. That is why she underwent the training in bread making. Also enterprising and very courageous, she didn’t hesitate, from her first credit to build a hard packed oven for bread making and selling. Thanks to the quality of her breads, she is more and more solicited but she is very limited by her means and cannot satisfy her clients who are getting more and more numerous. Madam Adjoa A. really induces trust through the quality of her products and especially the good management of her two credits of $ 450 and $ 650 respectively. She promptly paid reimbursed. The new credit of $ 850 in request will serve to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock as in the period of Christmas and New Year those stuffs become scarce and expensive. Surely, this credit will have a positive impact on Madam Adjoa A., because it will help her to increase her production and income to improve her socio-economic living conditions.

Madame A. Adjoa est boulangère âgée de 40 ans. Elle vit seule avec ses deux de ses propres enfants et quatre (04) personnes à sa charge. Abandonnée par son mari qui vit en clandestinité en Europe depuis plus de 05 ans, Madame A. Adjoa prend son courage à deux mains et se débrouille pas mal pour supporter toutes ces charges familiales. N’ayant pas eu la chance de terminer au moins le cours primaire, elle s’était lancé dans la vente de pain au bord des rues. Très ingénieuse, elle a compris très tôt que pour mieux réussir sa vie, il faut être maîtresse de soi-même. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de la fabrication du pain à l’échelle manuel. Aussi entreprenante et très courageuse qu’elle soit, elle n’a pas tardé, par son premier crédit à construire un four en terre battue pour la fabrication et la vente du pain. Aujourd’hui, de par la qualité de ses pains, elle est de plus en plus sollicitée mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui, sans cesse, ne fait qu’augmenter. Madame A. Adjoa nourrit réellement confiance à travers la qualité de ses produits et surtout la bonne gestion faite de ses deux premiers respectifs de $450 et $650 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Le nouveau crédit de $850 sollicités servirons à acheter de farine de blé et du sucre afin d’assurer le stock de sécurité car en période des fêtes de noël, ces denrées deviennent très rares et très coûteux. Ce crédit aura a coup sûr un impact positif sur Madame A. Adjoa, car il lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie socio-économiques.

loans.use: to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
A married mother of 6, Ms. Akossiwa S. left Vogan in 1990 to rejoin her husband in Dévémé. 46 years of age, she has been able to maintain her condiment business since her arrival in Dévémé. In fact, she has become quite well-known due to the business. Her daily work consists of going to gardens, purchasing baskets of condiments and reselling them. She is now seeking a loan of $500 to diversify into the sale of essential manufactured products and increase her purchasing power. Implementing this project will allow Ms. S. to improve her family's living conditions with the income generated by the business.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, Madame S. Akossiwa quitta Vogan en 1990 pour rejoindre son mari à Dévémé. Agée de 46 ans, elle a pu maintenir son commerce de vente de condiments qu’elle exerce depuis son arrivée à Dévémé. Cette activité fait d’ailleurs d’elle une femme bien connue. Aller dans les jardins, acheter des paniers de condiments, revenir les vendre reste son boulot quotidien. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour associer la vente des produits manufacturés de première nécessité et augmenter son pouvoir d’achat. La réalisation de ce projet pourra amener Madame Akossiwa S. à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille grâce aux revenus dégagés de son activité.

loans.use: Diversify into the sale of essential manufactured items and increase her purchasing power

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Sai and her nephew who is in grade 8 live together as a family. They have 7,000m2 of planted cashew nut trees but their productivity is very low because she has no capital for fertilizer investment. Sai sells lottery tickets to earn money for her nephew who is going to school. Their income has increased by $6 per person per month. Sai wants to borrow a loan of $50 to buy more lottery tickets to sell (if she buys them in cash she can save 10-20 cents/day) and to buy fertilizer for her cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sai would like to buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios has seven years of experience in the making and sale of hammocks. Since he didn't have a job that would allow him to pay all of the household expenses, he had to start his own business. Fortunately, the quality of his products and the good service he provided have allowed him to increase sales and remain in business for all of these years. He is a very hard-working and responsible man. He is married and has two children, ages 19 and 21 respectively.

In order to increase his production and meet with his clients' demands, Juan de Dios is asking for a loan of $375. He will use the money to buy raw materials from which he will make hammocks. He commits himself to return the money within 5 months. By contributing to the development of this business, you can become an important part of Juan de Dios' life and that of his family. They would be very grateful.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios tiene siete años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ante la falta de empleo para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio, afortunadamente la calidad de los productos que elabora y su buen servicio le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y permanecer durante tanto tiempo en el negocio. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 21 años de edad.

Para poder incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Juan de Dios está solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las hamacas, él se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 5 meses. Contribuye al desarrollo de este negocio y se parte importante en la vida de Juan de Dios y su familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is married and a mother of seven. Having lost her mother at an early age, she did not have the  opportunity to go to school because of lack of finances. Her husband’s meager job is not sufficient to cater for the needs of their seven children, so she had to start doing some business to support him. In 2005, she obtained her first loan of $40 with which she started the business of selling roasted fish and raised enough profits to pay school fees for her children. Given a loan of $600, she plans to open a grocery store, continue in the former business line, save some money, and continue educating her children. She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery, fish, and oil

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Kieu and her husband plant 200 pillards of green dragon and work as day labourers to take care their two sons who are ages seven and two. Their average income is $9 per month/person. Kieu is requesting a loan of $75 to invest their green dragon planting and to develop their income. The loan will be repaid during six months.

loans.use: To invest in green dragon planting

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru:
Uguloy K. has been engaged in an enterpreneurial activity for more than 8 years. Her business is the main source of her family income. She supports six persons - her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law and two grandsons. Currently she is looking for a loan to buy wholesale and to increase the inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Холбекова Угулой занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 8 лет и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов в семье. В семье имеет 6 иждивенца (невестка , 2 внука, муж и 2 сына). На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет оптом приобрести товар у оптовиков по более низкой цене.

loans.use: to increase the inventory

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, better known in her community as Dora, is 24 years old and lives at AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS. She came to live with her family (mother and sisters) when she was still a young girl.

When she began her business she made and sold cleaning products. One year ago she opened a grocery store with which she helps her husband support their children.

Her intermediate goal is to construct a home because her current home is made of adobe. Dora has worked with EDAPROSPO since 2003 and has formed a community bank with the help of her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora, más conocida en su comunidad como Dora, tiene 24 años viviendo en el AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS, ella vino a vivir con su familia (madre y hermanas) cuando aun era muy jovencita.

Cuando comenzó su negocio se dedicaba a la fabricación y comercialización de productos de limpieza. Desde hace 1 año, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con lo que ayuda a su esposo a mantener a sus hijos.

Su meta a mediano plazo es construir su casa ya que en la actualidad es de adobe. Dora trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde el 2003 y llego a formar una alcancía con la ayuda de sus amigas.

loans.use: Build her house

loans.name: Norm

texts.en: Mr. Norm S., 37, is married with four children and lives with his wife in Batambong province, Cambodia. He supports his family by driving a motor-taxi and makes about $4 a day. His wife stays at home cooking and looking after the family. But Mr. S. and his wife hope to raise their family's income by using this loan to buy a stall in the local market from which she can sell a variety of fruits.

loans.use: To buy a stand in the local market from which to sell a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita M. is a baker who prepares pastries for sale. She is  divorced with 4 children. Sales are going well and she wants to increase production and to meet the demands of her customers.

She is requesting a $525 loan as an additional capital to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, oil and other ingrediants which she needs for the preparation of the pastries.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more flour, sugar, margarine, oil and other ingrediants which she needs for the preparation of the pastries.

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
Hostensia M. is a widow with four children. Her difficulties in life have been that of educating her children. The worst moment came when she lost two daughters over a short period of time. These children being the eldest had the responsibility of being the breadwinner for the family. With this grate loss she was unable to provide the basic needs for the remaining children.

With the loan she plans to buy piglets, feed, medication for pigs and also plank and nails to repair and expand her pig farm. She will use part of the money to maintain one of her houses that she will give out to rent. This will help provide shelter for others and the manure will be used to cultivate her crops and improve the output. She plans to repay her loan in 24months.Her first installment will be done on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan

loans.use: Buying of piglets, feed and seedlings and repair materials

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Vorn C. is 41 and lives in Sre Au Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of five children, two of whom work in a garment factory, while the others study in the local school. Her husband, Vin Suong, is a bed maker in the village.

Mrs. Vorn Nuon is a farmer and last year her rice field faced drought. In addition, her land was infertile. For these reasons, she decided to request a loan to buy a water pump to irrigate her rice field and to buy fertilizer to enrich the infertile field. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra P. is 35 years old and the loving mother of three children of school age. Gulchehra sells fruits and vegetables like apples, apricots, strawberries, bird-cherries, tomatoes, cucumbers and others in the central local market. She has been in this business already for 14 years. Over these years Gulchehra has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, she knows how to store the fruits so that they keep their marketable conditions and don't lose the taste and useful properties.

Being located in the biggest central market, Gulchehra's business has great clientele and is rather stable, generating the main income allowing her to support her family. Gulchehra has proved herself as an honest and reliable client. Today she requests $900 US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Gulchehra plans to spend the loan to purchase fruits in order to increase the range of goods she sells. She would like to thank all for supporting her and promises to manage the current loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Gulchehra would like to purchase fruits and vegetables in order to increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mercedonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Mercedonio D. P., reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, casado, tiene 2 hijas menores; se dedica a la venta artículos de ropería y zapatería en general. El reparto de sus mercaderías lo realiza por nuestra ciudad y las zonas de Yabebyry, Laureles, Cerrito etc. para lo cual cuenta con un vehiculo.

Su esposa, Eva Rodríguez, lo ayuda en el reparto por la ciudad de San Ignacio, mediante esta actividad que posee el Sr. Mercedonio sus hijas pueden acceder a la educación de nivel medio y el bienestar de su familia.

Solicitó de este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de camperas, calzados deportivos, tricotas de lanas específicamente debido a que posee mucha demanda en esta época D. año.
